data.v: अहं हि मतिसाचिव्यं करिष्यामि नरर्षभ । मित्रं चैवोपदेक्ष्यामि युवाभ्यां संस्कृतोऽग्निना ।।
data.es: O best among men I will help you with my wisdom and give you friendly advice when I am purified by you both through cremation on the funeral pyre.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा दनुना तेन राघवः । इदं जगाद वचनं लक्ष्मणस्योपशृण्वतः ।।
data.es: Rigteous Rama spoke the following words in response to the story of Danu within Lakshmana's earshot:

data.v: रावणेन हृता सीता मम भार्या यशस्विनी । निष्क्रान्तस्य जनस्थानात्सह भ्रात्रा यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: My illlustrious wife Sita was carried away by Ravana comfortably when I was away from Janasthana along with my brother.

data.v: नाममात्रं तु जानामि न रूपं तस्य रक्षसः । निवासं वा प्रभावं वा वयं तस्य न विद्महे ।।
data.es: I only know his name. We do not know how he looks, where he lives and what influence he has.

data.v: शोकार्तानामनाथानामेवं विपरिधावताम् । कारुण्यं सदृशं कर्तुमुपकारे च वर्तताम् ।।
data.es: Creatures like you may help those who, like orphans, run here and there, stricken with sorrow.

data.v: काष्ठान्यानीय शुष्काणि काले भग्नानि कुञ्जरैः । भक्ष्यामस्त्वां वयं वीर श्वभ्रे महति कल्पिते ।।
data.es: O hero we will cremate you in a huge pit to be prepared for this occasion, collecting dry logs of wood broken by elephants.

data.v: स त्वं सीतां समाचक्ष्व येन वा यत्र वा हृता । कुरु कल्याणमत्यर्थं यदि जानासि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: If you really know where SIta has been kidnapped and by whom, tell me. You will be doing a great service.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाक्यं दनुरनुत्तमम् । प्रोवाच कुशलो वक्तुं वक्तारमपि राघवम् ।।
data.es: Danu who was proficient in speech spoke with chosen words to Rama who was a great speaker himself:

data.v: दिव्यमस्ति न मे ज्ञानं नाभिजानामि मैथिलीम् । यस्तां ज्ञास्यति तं वक्ष्ये दग्धः स्वं रूपमास्थितः ।।
data.es: I do not have divine wisdom (now). Nor do I know Sita. When you cremate me, I shall assume my original form and will tell you the name of the person who knows it.

data.v: अदग्धस्य हि विज्ञातुं शक्तिरस्ति न मे प्रभो । राक्षसं तं महावीर्यं सीता येन हृता तव ।।
data.es: O lord before I am cremated, I do not have the ability to know about that powerful demon by whom Sita has been abducted.

data.v: विज्ञानं हि महद्भ्रष्टं शापदोषेण राघव । स्वकृतेन मया प्राप्तं रूपं लोकविगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: O Rama due to the curse I have lost my wisdom. By my own deed, I have attained this form despicable to the world.

data.v: किं तु यावन्न यात्यस्तं सविता श्रान्तवाहनः । तावन्मामवटे क्षिप्त्वा दह राम यथाविधि ।।
data.es: Before the Sun disappears with his tired horses drop me into a pit and cremate me in accordance with tradition, O Rama

data.v: दग्धस्त्वयाहमवटे न्यायेन रघुनन्दन । वक्ष्यामि तमहं वीर यस्तं ज्ञास्यति राक्षसं ।।
data.es: O heroic Rama, delight of the Raghus, if you drop me in a pit and cremate me as per custom, I will tell you about him who knows the demon.

data.v: तेन सख्यं च कर्तव्यं न्याय्यवृत्तेन राघव । कल्पयिष्यति ते प्रीतः साहाय्यं लघुविक्रमः ।।
data.es: O Rama you should establish friendship with him in a just manner. That hero of swift action will help you when he is pleased.

data.v: न हि तस्यास्त्यविज्ञातं त्रिषु लोकेषु राघव । सर्वान्परिसृतो लोकान्पुरा वै कारणान्तरे ।।
data.es: O Rama, there is nothing that he does not know in the three worlds. In the past for a different reason he roamed all the (three) worlds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवमुक्तौ तु तौ वीरौ कबन्धेन नरेश्वरौ । गिरिप्रदरमासाद्य पावकं विससर्जतुः ।।
data.es: Thus said by Kabandha, the two lords of men, the heroes reached a cave in the mountain and lighted the fire.

data.v: लक्ष्मणस्तु महोल्काभिर्ज्वलिताभिः समन्ततः । चितामादीपयामास सा प्रजज्वाल सर्वतः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana lit the pyre with big meteorlike logs on all sides and it burned.

data.v: तच्छरीरं कबन्धस्य घृतपिण्डोपमं महत् । मेदसा पच्यमानस्य मन्दं दहति पावक ।।
data.es: As the flesh of Kabandha's body decomposed, if burnt slowly in the fire although it was like a huge mass of fat.

data.v: स विधूय चितामाशु विधूमोऽग्निरिवोत्थितः । अरजे वाससी विभ्रन्मालां दिव्यां महाबलः ।।
data.es: Mighty Kabandha shook himself off the funeral pyre and rose like smokeless fire, wearing a pair of clean clothes and a divine garland.

data.v: ततश्चिताया वेगेन भास्वरो विरजाम्बरः । उत्पपाताशु संहृष्टः सर्वप्रत्यङ्गभूषणः ।।
data.es: Thereafter shining brightly in pure clothes and wearing ornaments all over the body, Kabandha hurtled out happily and instantaneously from the pyre.

data.v: विमाने भास्वरे तिष्ठन्हंसयुक्ते यशस्करे । प्रभया च महातेजा दिशो दश विराजयन् ।।
data.es: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.

data.v: सोऽन्तरिक्षगतो रामं कबन्धो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । शृणु राघव तत्त्वेन यथा सीमामवाप्स्यसि ।।
data.es: The effulgent Kabandha rose into the sky on a famous aerial chariot harnessed to swans. Seated on it, he illuminated all ten directions and spoke from the sky,'O Raghava I will truly tell you how you will get Sita, listen to me'.

data.v: राम षड्युक्तयो लोके याभिः सर्वं विमृश्यते । परिमृष्टो दशान्तेन दशाभागेन सेव्यते ।।
data.es: O Rama there are six expedients (peace,war,marching,neutrality, alliance, making peace with one and waging war with another, for attaining your goal in the world. Only the unlucky can help the unfortunate.

data.v: दशाभागगतो हीनस्त्वं राम सहलक्ष्मणः । यत्कृते व्यसनं प्राप्तं त्वया दारप्रधर्षणम् ।।
data.es: Along with Lakshmna you are passing through a bad period on account of which your wife has been kidnapped and you, lying low, are experiencing great grief, O Rama

data.v: तदवश्यं त्वया कार्यः स सुहृत्सुहृदां वर । अकृत्वा न हि ते सिद्धिमहं पश्यामि चिन्तयन् ।।
data.es: O Rama, the best of friends you should certainly make friendship with him. As I think over the matter, I do not see any success if you do not adopt this method.

data.v: श्रूयतां राम वक्ष्यामि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः । भ्रात्रा निरस्तः क्रुद्धेन वालिना शक्रसूनुना ।।
data.es: O Rama, listen. I shall tell you. A monkey named Sugriva has been banished from the kingdom in a fit of anger by his brother Vali, the son of Indra.

data.v: ऋष्यमूके गिरिवरे पम्पापर्यन्तशोभिते । निवसत्यात्मवान्वीरश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।
data.es: A hero of great selfrespect, he lives with four monkeys on a beautiful mountain Rishyamuka extending up to lake Pampa.

data.v: वयस्यं तं कुरु क्षिप्रमितो गत्वाद्य राघव । अद्रोहाय समागम्य दीप्यमाने विभावसौ ।।
data.es: O Rama, immediately proceed today from here to mighty Sugriva. Having reached him, make him your friend without malice in the presence of burning fire.

data.v: न च ते सोऽवमन्तव्यः सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः । कृतज्ञः कामरूपी च सहायार्थी च वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Thinking that Sugriva is only a vanara king, he should not be disrespected. He has a sense of gratitude. He can take any form at will. He is in need of your help although he is very strong.

data.v: शक्तौ ह्यद्य युवां कर्तुं कार्यं तस्य चिकीर्षितम् । कृतार्थो वाकृतार्थो वा कृत्यं तव करिष्यति ।।
data.es: You are both young and able to do the work he wants. Whether his work is done or not, he will fulfil your task.

data.v: स ऋक्षरजसः पुत्रः पम्पामटति शङ्कितः । भास्करस्यौरसः पुत्रो वालिना कृतकिल्बिषः ।।
data.es: Born of Riksharaja, he is the offspring of the Sungod. He has developed enmity with Vali, and is roaming about the banks of Pampa, suspecting danger from Vali.

data.v: संनिधायायुधं क्षिप्रमृष्यमूकालयं कपिम् । कुरु राघव सत्येन वयस्यं वनचारिणम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, with your weapons kept ready, go to Sugriva, king of the monkeys, a resident of Rishyamuka. He is wandering in the forest. Establish friendship with him.

data.v: स हि स्थानानि सर्वाणि कार्त्स्न्येन कपिकुञ्जरः । नरमांसाशिनां लोके नैपुण्यादधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: He is the foremost of the monkeys. He knows well by his wisdom all the dwellingplaces of the carnivorous demons in the world.

data.v: न तस्याविदितं लोके किंचिदस्ति हि राघव । यावत्सूर्यः प्रतपति सहस्रांशुररिंदम ।।
data.es: There is nothing unknown to Sugriva in this world as far as the Sun shines, O subduer of enemies

data.v: स नदीर्विपुलाञ्शैलान्गिरिदुर्गाणि कन्दरान् । अन्विष्य वानरैः सार्धं पत्नीं तेऽधिगमिष्यति ।।
data.es: Along with his monkeys, he will search all rivers, mountains and caves and will find out your consort.

data.v: वानरांश्च महाकायान्प्रेषयिष्यति राघव । दिशो विचेतुं तां सीतां त्वद्वियोगेन शोचतीम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva will find out the lady of purity and chastity brooding over you in separation in the abode of Ravana. He can send gigantic monkeys in different directions in order to search for her.

data.v: स मेरुशृङ्गाग्रगतामनिन्दितां; प्रविश्य पातालतलेऽपि वाश्रिताम् । प्लवंगमानां प्रवरस्तव प्रियां; निहत्य रक्षांसि पुनः प्रदास्यति ।।
data.es: Sugriva, king of the monkeys, will reach the demons and restore you that blameless, beloved consort of yours, even if she is there on top of mount Meru or in the deep underworld. इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventysecond sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: निदर्शयित्वा रामाय सीतायाः प्रतिपादने । वाक्यमन्वर्थमर्थज्ञः कबन्धः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having shown Rama the means to find Sita, Kabandha spoke again these significant words:

data.v: एष राम शिवः पन्था यत्रैते पुष्पिता द्रुमाः । प्रतीचीं दिशमाश्रित्य प्रकाशन्ते मनोरमाः ।।
जम्बूप्रियालपनसाः प्लक्षन्यग्रोधतिन्दुकाः । अश्वत्थाः कर्णिकाराश्च चूताश्चान्ये च पादपाः ।।
तानारुह्याथ वा भूमौ पातयित्वा च तान्बलात् । फलान्यमृतकल्पानि भक्षयन्तौ गमिष्यथः ।।
data.es: Climbing those trees or else pulling them down with your strength, both of you eat the nectarlike sweet fruits and proceed ahead.

data.v: चङ्क्रमन्तौ वरान्देशाञ्शैलाच्छैलं वनाद्वनम् । ततः पुष्करिणीं वीरौ पम्पां नाम गमिष्यथः ।।
data.es: O brave men, pass from hill to hill, forest to forest in great countries until you reach a lake named Pampa.

data.v: अशर्करामविभ्रंशां समतीर्थमशैवलाम् । राम संजातवालूकां कमलोत्पलशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: The slopes of Pampa are without stones or pebbles, O Rama They are not slippery slopes. They are without moss. The water is neither deep nor shallow. It has smooth beds of sand on the banks and it is full of lotuses and lilies.

data.v: तत्र हंसाः प्लवाः क्रौञ्चाः कुरराश्चैव राघव । वल्गुस्वरा निकूजन्ति पम्पासलिलगोचराः ।।
data.es: Moving in the waters of Pampa you will see swans, ducks, krauncha birds and curlews cackling and cooing, O Son of the Raghus.

data.v: नोद्विजन्ते नरान्दृष्ट्वा वधस्याकोविदाः शुभाः । घृतपिण्डोपमान्स्थूलांस्तान्द्विजान्भक्षयिष्यथः ।।
data.es: Not knowing that they may be killed, the innocent creatures will not be scared of human beings. Both of you can kill and eat the fat birds comparable to balls of ghee.

data.v: रोहितान्वक्रतुण्डांश्च नलमीनांश्च राघव । पम्पायामिषुभिर्मत्स्यांस्तत्र राम वरान्हतान् ।।
data.es: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.

data.v: निस्त्वक्पक्षानयस्तप्तानकृशानेककण्टकान् । तव भक्त्या समायुक्तो लक्ष्मणः संप्रदास्यति ।।
data.es: O Rama, scion of the Raghu dynasty there at Pampa, by shooting an arrow at the choicest fishes with a single bone, prawns and big fishes, crookedfaced fishes, fishes without scales and fins, baked on iron skewers and cooked will be offered to you by faithful Lakshmana.

data.v: भृशं ते खादतो मत्स्यान्पम्पायाः पुष्पसंचये । पद्मगन्धि शिवं वारि सुखशीतमनामयम् ।।
data.es: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.

data.v: उद्धृत्य स तदाक्लिष्टं रूप्यस्फटिकसंनिभम् । अथ पुष्करपर्णेन लक्ष्मणः पाययिष्यति ।।
data.es: While you delightedly eat the fishes, Lakshmana will fetch you water in a lotus leaf from the Pampa to drink. The waters of Pampa full of lotuses carry their scent, It is enjoyable, cool, healthy and clear, resembling silver and crystal.

data.v: स्थूलान्गिरिगुहाशय्यान्वराहान्वनचारिणः । अपां लोभादुपावृत्तान्वृषभानिव नर्दतः । रूपान्वितांश्च पम्पायां द्रक्ष्यसि त्वं नरोत्तम ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जरतम], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससयर], अज्ञातम् [१२: यततभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसतत]

data.es: O best of men you will see huge boars of delightful appearance that roar like bulls resting in mountain caves, roaming in the forest and coming to Pampa for its water.

data.v: सायाह्ने विचरन्राम विटपी माल्यधारिणः । शीतोदकं च पम्पायां दृष्ट्वा शोकं विहास्यसि ।।
data.es: When you stroll in the evening, you will see the trees laden with blossoms and lake Pampa full of cool water. You will forget your grief.

data.v: सुमनोभिश्चितांस्तत्र तिलकान्नक्तमालकान् । उत्पलानि च फुल्लानि पङ्कजानि च राघव ।।
data.es: O son of the Raghus there you will see tilaka trees, night jasmines full of flowers. You will also see blossoming water lilies and lotuses in Pampa.

data.v: न तानि कश्चिन्माल्यानि तत्रारोपयिता नरः । मतङ्गशिष्यास्तत्रासन्नृषयः सुसमाहितः ।।
data.es: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama

data.v: तेषां भाराभितप्तानां वन्यमाहरतां गुरोः । ये प्रपेतुर्महीं तूर्णं शरीरात्स्वेदबिन्दवः ।।
data.es: While drops of sweat from the bodies of sage Matanga's disciples fell on earth under the heavy load of forest products they carried for their preceptor, they remained in a calm state. Those drops of sweat turned into flowers and those flowers do not wither due to the power of penance of the sages.

data.v: तानि माल्यानि जातानि मुनीनां तपसा तदा । स्वेदबिन्दुसमुत्थानि न विनश्यन्ति राघव ।।
data.es: There is no one to wear those flowers. Those garlands do not wilt or wither O Rama

data.v: तेषामद्यापि तत्रैव दृश्यते परिचारिणी । श्रमणी शबरी नाम काकुत्स्थ चिरजीविनी ।।
data.es: O Kakutstha even now their attendant, named Sabari, an old ascetic is there even though they have left long ago.

data.v: त्वां तु धर्मे स्थिता नित्यं सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् । दृष्ट्वा देवोपमं राम स्वर्गलोकं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: O Rama, she is established in righteousness, and you are godlike, and revered by all beings. When she sees you, she will attain heaven.

data.v: ततस्तद्राम पम्पायास्तीरमाश्रित्य पश्चिमम् । आश्रमस्थानमतुलं गुह्यं काकुत्स्थ पश्यसि ।।
data.es: O Rama of the Kakutstha family, you will see on reaching the western bank of Pampa an incomparable site of hermitage concealed in a remote place.

data.v: न तत्राक्रमितुं नागाः शक्नुवन्ति तमाश्रमम् । ऋषेस्तस्य मतङ्गस्य विधानात्तच्च काननम् ।।
data.es: The elephants of the forest and on the mountains do not attack the hermitage forbidden by sage Matanga.

data.v: तस्मिन्नन्दनसंकाशे देवारण्योपमे वने । नानाविहगसंकीर्णे रंस्यसे राम निर्वृतः ।।
data.es: O Rama, you will enjoy your stay in that forest which is like Nandana garden, the garden of the gods, full of various birds.

data.v: ऋष्यमूकस्तु पम्पायाः पुरस्तात्पुष्पितद्रुमः । सुदुःखारोहणो नाम शिशुनागाभिरक्षितः । उदारो ब्रह्मणा चैव पूर्वकाले विनिर्मितः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: ररतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: सरजत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरतत]

data.es: Mount Rishyamuka situated on the bank of Pampa has trees filled with blossoms. It is difficult to climb and is protected by young elephants.This lofty mountain was created by Brahma in olden days.

data.v: शयानः पुरुषो राम तस्य शैलस्य मूर्धनि । यत्स्वप्ने लभते वित्तं तत्प्रबुद्धोऽधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: Whatever wealth one dreams of in sleep on top of that mountain he will get on waking up, O Rama

data.v: न त्वेनं विषमाचारः पापकर्माधिरोहति । तत्रैव प्रहरन्त्येनं सुप्तमादाय राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: If an evildoer or a sinner ascends the (Rishyamuka) mountain, he, in his sleep, will be thrown down with asleep by the demons from there itself. A sinner does not climb this mountain of uneven terrain.

data.v: ततोऽपि शिशुनागानामाक्रन्दः श्रूयते महान् । क्रीडतां राम पम्पायां मतङ्गारण्यवासिनाम् ।।
data.es: O Rama, the trumpeting of the young playful elephants inhabiting sage Matanga's forest can be heard at Pampa.

data.v: सिक्ता रुधिरधाराभिः संहत्य परमद्विपाः । प्रचरन्ति पृथक्कीर्णा मेघवर्णास्तरस्विनः ।।
data.es: The great, nimble elphants, dark like clouds, drenched with the flow of ichor come together and then separate and scatter.

data.v: ते तत्र पीत्वा पानीयं विमलं शीतमव्ययम् । निवृत्ताः संविगाहन्ते वनानि वनगोचराः ।।
data.es: The wandering elephants of the forest drink plentiful water, pure and cool, from Pampa and contented, plunge into the forest.

data.v: राम तस्य तु शैलस्य महती शोभते गुहा । शिलापिधाना काकुत्स्थ दुःखं चास्याः प्रवेशनम् ।।
data.es: O son of the Kakutstha family, there is a beautiful cave in that mountain covered with a slab of stone. It is difficult to enter.

data.v: तस्या गुहायाः प्राग्द्वारे महाञ्शीतोदको ह्रदः । बहुमूलफलो रम्यो नानानगसमावृतः ।।
data.es: At the eastern entrance of the cave there is a cool watertank. On its bank teeming with various animals are delightful fruits and roots.

data.v: तस्यां वसति सुग्रीवश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः । कदाचिच्छिखरे तस्य पर्वतस्यावतिष्ठते ।।
data.es: Sugriva dwells in that cave with four other monkeys. At times he sits on the top of the mountain.

data.v: कबन्धस्त्वनुशास्यैवं तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । स्रग्वी भास्करवर्णाभः खे व्यरोचत वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Having instructed both Rama and Lakshmana, courageous Kabandha, wearing a flowergarland, shone brightly like the Sun in the sky.

data.v: तं तु खस्थं महाभागं कबन्धं रामलक्ष्मणौ । प्रस्थितौ त्वं व्रजस्वेति वाक्यमूचतुरन्तिकात् ।।
data.es: Both Rama and Lakshmana, ready to depart, went near the glorious Kabandha waiting in the sky and said, You may go now.

data.v: गम्यतां कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थमिति तावब्रवीच्च सः । सुप्रीतौ तावनुज्ञाप्य कबन्धः प्रस्थितस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then Kabandha said to the brothers satisfied, You may go now to accomplish your task. Then he took leave.

data.v: स तत्कबन्धः प्रतिपद्य रूपं; वृतः श्रिया भास्करतुल्यदेहः । निदर्शयन्राममवेक्ष्य खस्थः; सख्यं कुरुष्वेति तदाभ्युवाच ।।
data.es: Kabandha assumed his true form, his body shining like the radiance of the Sun. He stood in the sky showing his form and looking at Rama, said, Make friendship with Sugriva.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे त्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventythird sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तौ कबन्धेन तं मार्गं पम्पाया दर्शितं वने । आतस्थतुर्दिशं गृह्य प्रतीचीं नृवरात्मजौ ।।
data.es: The two princes set forth in the western direction towards Pampa shown by Kabandha.

data.v: तौ शैलेष्वाचितानेकान्क्षौद्रकल्पफलद्रुमान् । वीक्षन्तौ जग्मतुर्द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Observing the trees loaded with honeysweet fruits on the mountain, Rama and Lakshmana went to see Sugriva.

data.v: कृत्वा च शैलपृष्ठे तु तौ वासं रघुनन्दनौ । पम्पायाः पश्चिमं तीरं राघवावुपतस्थतुः ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana halted on the slope of the mountain and then departed for the western bank of Pampa.

data.v: तौ पुष्करिण्याः पम्पायास्तीरमासाद्य पश्चिमम् । अपश्यतां ततस्तत्र शबर्या रम्यमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Both reached the west bank of lake Pampa and saw the delightful hermitage of Sabari.

data.v: तौ तमाश्रममासाद्य द्रुमैर्बहुभिरावृतम् । सुरम्यमभिवीक्षन्तौ शबरीमभ्युपेयतुः ।।
data.es: Both reached the beautiful hermitage full of many kinds of trees. There they saw Sabari, and went towards her.

data.v: तौ तु दृष्ट्वा तदा सिद्धा समुत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः । पादौ जग्राह रामस्य लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः ।।
data.es: On seeing them both, Sabari, an accomplished ascetic, got up with folded hands and touched the feet of the sagacious Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: तामुवाच ततो रामः श्रमणीं संशितव्रताम् । कच्चित्ते निर्जिता विघ्नाः कच्चित्ते वर्धते तपः ।।
data.es: O ascetic hope you have overcome your obstacles to penance, you have controlled your anger and your desire for food. Is your austerity in progress.

data.v: कच्चित्ते नियतः कोप आहारश्च तपोधने । कच्चित्ते नियमाः प्राप्ताः कच्चित्ते मनसः सुखम् । कच्चित्ते गुरुशुश्रूषा सफला चारुभाषिणि ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: मसयत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: यभतभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसरत]

data.es: O Sweettongued Sabari, have you achieved selfcontrol? Has your mind attained peace ? Have your services to the preceptor yielded results?

data.v: रामेण तापसी पृष्ठा सा सिद्धा सिद्धसंमता । शशंस शबरी वृद्धा रामाय प्रत्युपस्थिता ।।
data.es: When Rama asked Sabari who was an old, accomplished ascetic adored by siddhas, she stood in front and replied :

data.v: चित्रकूटं त्वयि प्राप्ते विमानैरतुलप्रभैः । इतस्ते दिवमारूढा यानहं पर्यचारिषम् ।।
data.es: The men I served have ascended heaven on aerial chariots of incomparable radiance the moment you touched Chitrakuta.

data.v: तैश्चाहमुक्ता धर्मज्ञैर्महाभागैर्महर्षिभिः । आगमिष्यति ते रामः सुपुण्यमिममाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'

data.v: स ते प्रतिग्रहीतव्यः सौमित्रिसहितोऽतिथिः । तं च दृष्ट्वा वराँल्लोकानक्षयांस्त्वं गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: Those great honourable sages who knew the ways of dharma said: 'Rama would visit this sacred hermitage along with Lakshmana. He would be your guest. Receive him with due honour. And you would attain the great, inexhaustible worlds when you see him.'

data.v: मया तु विविधं वन्यं संचितं पुरुषर्षभ । तवार्थे पुरुषव्याघ्र पम्पायास्तीरसंभवम् ।।
data.es: O best among men I have collected and kept for your sake different kinds of forestfood grown on the bank of Pampa.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स धर्मात्मा शबर्या शबरीमिदम् । राघवः प्राह विज्ञाने तां नित्यमबहिष्कृताम् ।।
data.es: Entreated by her in that manner, the righteous Rama spoke to Sabari who was established in true knowledge:

data.v: दनोः सकाशात्तत्त्वेन प्रभावं ते महात्मनः । श्रुतं प्रत्यक्षमिच्छामि संद्रष्टुं यदि मन्यसे ।।
data.es: I have heard from great Danu about your power. If you agree, I would like to see this power in person.

data.v: एतत्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा रामवक्त्राद्विनिःसृतम् । शबरी दर्शयामास तावुभौ तद्वनं महत् ।।
data.es: At these words from the mouth of Rama, Sabari took them both round the great garden.

data.v: पश्य मेघघनप्रख्यं मृगपक्षिसमाकुलम् । मतङ्गवनमित्येव विश्रुतं रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O delight of the Raghus see this garden looking like the dense cloud. Full of animals and birds, it is popularly known as Matanga garden.

data.v: इह ते भावितात्मानो गुरवो मे महाद्युते । जुहवांश्चक्रिरे तीर्थं मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रपूजितम् ।।
data.es: My precepters, who had perceived the Supreme Spirit made sacrificial offerings in this great garden, invoked gods through the power of mantras. They brought water and offered oblations to the sacrificial fire.

data.v: इयं प्रत्यक्स्थली वेदी यत्र ते मे सुसत्कृताः । पुष्पोपहारं कुर्वन्ति श्रमादुद्वेपिभिः करैः ।।
data.es: This is the altar named Pratyaksthali where the saints aged and exhausted( by performing chandrayana) whom I worshipped made offerings of flowers with trembling hands.

data.v: तेषां तपः प्रभावेन पश्याद्यापि रघूत्तम । द्योतयन्ति दिशः सर्वाः श्रिया वेद्योऽतुलप्रभाः ।।
data.es: O Rama see, even now they illuminate the sacrificial altars with the power of their penance. They shed light in all directions with a matchless brilliance.

data.v: अशक्नुवद्भिस्तैर्गन्तुमुपवासश्रमालसैः । चिन्तितेऽभ्यागतान्पश्य समेतान्सप्त सागरान् ।।
data.es: Look at the seven seas, which have reached here at their mere thought as they could not reach them due to fatigue from fasting.

data.v: कृताभिषेकैस्तैर्न्यस्ता वल्कलाः पादपेष्विह । अद्यापि न विशुष्यन्ति प्रदेशे रघुनन्दन ।।
data.es: O delight of the Raghus look at the bark robes spread on the trees to dry after their bathing which are still wet.

data.v: कृत्स्नं वनमिदं दृष्टं श्रोतव्यं च श्रुतं त्वया । तदिच्छाम्यभ्यनुज्ञाता त्यक्तुमेतत्कलेवरम् ।।
data.es: You have seen the entire garden and have listened what is to be heard. With your permission I would like to give up this body.

data.v: तेषामिच्छाम्यहं गन्तुं समीपं भावितात्मनाम् । मुनीनामाश्रंमो येषामहं च परिचारिणी ।।
data.es: I wish to reach those realisers of the Supreme Spirit whom I served and to whom this hermitage belonged.

data.v: धर्मिष्ठं तु वचः श्रुत्वा राघवः सहलक्ष्मणः । अनुजानामि गच्छेति प्रहृष्टवदनोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana on hearing the pious words of Savari joyfully exclaimed, This is really wonderful.

data.v: अनुज्ञाता तु रामेण हुत्वात्मानं हुताशने । ज्वलत्पावकसंकाशा स्वर्गमेव जगाम सा ।।
data.es: With matted locks, tattered bark clothes and deer skin, Sabari consigned her old and emaciated body to the fire at that moment, with the permission of Rama and ascended to heaven, her body glowing like fire.

data.v: यत्र ते सुकृतात्मानो विहरन्ति महर्षयः । तत्पुण्यं शबरीस्थानं जगामात्मसमाधिना ।।
data.es: By virtue of her selfmeditation, Sabari went to that sacred world where the holy sages lived because of their good deeds.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये अरण्यकाण्डे चतुस्सप्ततितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventyfourth sarga of Aranyakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: दिवं तु तस्यां यातायां शबर्यां स्वेन कर्मणा । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चिन्तयामास राघवः ।।
data.es: When Sabari departed for heaven with her brilliance, Rama contemplated (about the power of sages)with Lakshmana.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा तु धर्मात्मा प्रभावं तं महात्मनाम् । हितकारिणमेकाग्रं लक्ष्मणं राघवोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thinking about the power of the great sages, righteous Rama said to Lakshmana, his wellwisher with singleminded devotion:

data.v: दृष्टोऽयमाश्रमः सौम्य बह्वाश्चर्यः कृतात्मनाम् । विश्वस्तमृगशार्दूलो नानाविहगसेवितः ।।
data.es: O handsome one, we have seen this highly wonderful hermitage, where deer and tigers dwell together with mutual confidence, where birds of all kinds inhabit.

data.v: सप्तानां च समुद्राणामेषु तीर्थेषु लक्ष्मण । उपस्पृष्टं च विधिवत्पितरश्चापि तर्पिताः ।।
data.es: O Lakshmana, having bathed in the waters of the seven seas (by taking ritualistic bath in these waters) the manes are offered oblations in accordance with tradition.

data.v: प्रनष्टमशुभं यत्तत्कल्याणं समुपस्थितम् । तेन त्वेतत्प्रहृष्टं मे मनो लक्ष्मण संप्रति ।।
data.es: We have got rid of inauspicious time and good days have come. Therefore, I feel truly happy. Good fortune will appear (now), O Lakshmana, O tiger among men

data.v: हृदये हि नरव्याघ्र शुभमाविर्भविष्यति । तदागच्छ गमिष्यावः पम्पां तां प्रियदर्शनाम् ।।
ऋश्यमूको गिरिर्यत्र नातिदूरे प्रकाशते । यस्मिन्वसति धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवोंऽशुमतः सुतः । नित्यं वालिभयात्त्रस्तश्चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमनम], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसयत], अज्ञातम् [१२: रररय]

data.es: Come, let us go to Pampa, which is pleasing to look at. Sugriva, the rigteous self, the son of the Sun has been staying for fear of Vali at the shining Rishyamuka, not far from here.

data.v: अभित्वरे च तं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम् । तदधीनं हि मे सौम्य सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् ।।

data.es: 'There are trees like ankola, kuranta, churnaka, paribhadraka, mango, patali, kovidara, muchukunda, arjuna, ketaka, uddalaka, shirisha, shimshupa and shava, all in full bloom on the mountain peaks.

data.v: केतकोद्दालकाश्चैव शिरीषाः शिंशपा धवाः । शाल्मल्यः किंशुकाश्चैव रक्ताः कुरबकास्तथा । तिनिशा नक्त मालाश्च चन्दनाः स्यन्दनास्तथा ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: तसजज], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररभम]

data.v: विविधा विविधैः पुष्पैस्तैरेव नगसानुषु । विकीर्णैः पीतरक्ताभाः सौमित्रे प्रस्तराः कृताः ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri varieties of colourful flowers, some red and some yellow, are spread out on the mountain slopes.

data.v: हिमान्ते पश्य सौमित्रे वृक्षाणां पुष्पसंभवम् । पुष्पमासे हि तरवः संघर्षादिव पुष्पिताः ।।
data.es: 'Winter has ended and the season of flowers has set in, O Saumitri The trees are full of flowers as if competing with one another.

data.v: पश्य शीतजलां चेमां सौमित्रे पुष्करायुताम् । चक्रवाकानुचरितां कारण्डवनिषेविताम् । प्लवैः क्रौञ्चैश्च संपूर्णां वराहमृगसेविताम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: रसमत], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसजम], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततस], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरनर]

data.es: 'O Saumitri look at this lake of cool water filled with, lotuses, chakravakas flying about and ducks floating.

data.v: अधिकं शोभते पम्पाविकूजद्भिर्विहंगमैः ।।
दीपयन्तीव मे कामं विविधा मुदिता द्विजाः । श्यामां चन्द्रमुखीं स्मृत्वा प्रियां पद्मनिभेक्षणाम् ।।
data.es: Pampa, filled with swimming, kraunchas and frequented by big animals looks splendid. The joyous warbling of a variety of birds is highly exciting. They kindle my passion for my young, Moonfaced, lotus eyed beloved.

data.v: पय सानुषु चित्रेषु मृगीभिः सहितान्मृगान् । मां पुनर्मृगशावाक्ष्या वैदेह्या विरहीकृतम् ।।
एवं स विलपंस्तत्र शोकोपहतचेतनः । अवेक्षत शिवां पम्पां रम्यवारिवहां शुभाम् ।।
निरीक्षमाणः सहसा महात्मा; सर्वं वनं निर्झरकन्दरं च । उद्विग्नचेताः सह लक्ष्मणेन; विचार्य दुःखोपहतः प्रतस्थे ।।
data.es: The great Rama was overcome with grief while scanning the entire forest with its streams and caves. Engrossed in her thoughts, dejected at heart and inflicted with pain, he set both, accompanied by Lakshmana.

data.v: तावृष्यमूकं सहितौ प्रयातौ; सुग्रीवशाखामृगसेवितं तम् । त्रस्तास्तु दृष्ट्वा हरयो बभूवु;र्महौजसौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ तौ ।।
data.es: Having seen the mighty Rama and Lakshmana, all other monkeys got frightened and ran into a sacred and safe hermitage.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे प्रथमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the first sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तौ तु दृष्ट्वा महात्मानौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । वरायुधधरौ वीरौ सुग्रीवः शङ्कितोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: On seeing the two great souls, heroic Rama and Lakshmana wielding the best of weapons, Sugriva was alarmed.

data.v: उद्विग्नहृदयः सर्वा दिशः समवलोकयन् । न व्यतिष्ठत कस्मिंश्चिद्देशे वानरपुंगवः ।।
data.es: Agitated at heart, the best of vanaras started in all directions and could not settle down at one spot.

data.v: नैव चक्रे मनः स्थाने वीक्षमाणो महाबलौ । कपेः परमभीतस्य चित्तं व्यवससाद ह ।।
data.es: Beholding the two strong heroes, the monkey (Sugriva) was very much frightened. His heart sank.

data.v: चिन्तयित्वा स धर्मात्मा विमृश्य गुरुलाघवम् । सुग्रीवः परमोद्विग्नः सर्वैरनुचरैः सह ।।
data.es: Righteous Sugriva, became highly agitated, deliberated with all his followers on the pros and cons of the situation.

data.v: ततः स सचिवेभ्यस्तु सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । शशंस परमोद्विग्नः पश्यंस्तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, extremely agitated at the sight of both Rama and Lakshmana, spoke to his minister:

data.v: एतौ वनमिदं दुर्गं वालिप्रणिहितौ ध्रुवम् । छद्मना चीरवसनौ प्रचरन्ताविहागतौ ।।
ततः सुग्रीवसचिवा दृष्ट्वा परमधन्विनौ । जग्मुर्गिरितटात्तस्मादन्यच्छिखरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: On seeing these supreme bowmen, Sugriva's counsellers left for the peak of another mountain.

data.v: ते क्षिप्रमभिगम्याथ यूथपा यूथपर्षभम् । हरयो वानरश्रेष्ठं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ।।
data.es: The leaders of the monkey troops reached Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, in no time and stood surrounding him.

data.v: एकमेकायनगताः प्लवमाना गिरेर्गिरिम् । प्रकम्पयन्तो वेगेन गिरीणां शिखराणि च ।।
data.es: Jumping from one mountain to another swiftly and shaking the mountain tops, the monkeys reached one spot.

data.v: ततः शाखामृगाः सर्वे प्लवमाना महाबलाः । बभञ्जुश्च नगांस्तत्र पुष्पितान्दुर्गसंश्रितान् ।।
data.es: Then the mighty monkeys jumping on the trees in full bloom shook them.

data.v: आप्लवन्तो हरिवराः सर्वतस्तं महागिरिम् । मृगमार्जारशार्दूलांस्त्रासयन्तो ययुस्तदा ।।
data.es: The great monkeys went on leaping all over the great (Rishyamuka) mountain, scaring the deer, wildcats and tigers.

data.v: ततः सुग्रीवसचिवाः पर्वतेन्द्रं समाश्रिताः । संगम्य कपिमुख्येन सर्वे प्राञ्जलयः स्थिताः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, all the ministers of Sugriva assembled together on the king of mountains and stood (in front of Sugriva), with folded hands.

data.v: ततस्तं भयसंत्रस्तं वालिकिल्बिषशङ्कितम् । उवाच हनुमान्वाक्यं सुग्रीवं वाक्यकोविदः ।।
data.es: Suspecting that Vali might have sent them (Rama and Lakshmana), Hanuman, skilful in communication, said to Sugriva who was trembling in fear:

data.v: यस्मादुद्विग्नचेतास्त्वं प्रद्रुतो हरिपुंगव । तं क्रूरदर्शनं क्रूरं नेह पश्यामि वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O chief of monkeys I do not see here any sign of the cruel Vali, of whom you are afraid.

data.v: यस्मात्तव भयं सौम्य पूर्वजात्पापकर्मणः । स नेह वाली दुष्टात्मा न ते पश्याम्यहं भयम् ।।
data.es: 'O goodnatured Sugriva you are afraid of your elder brother Vali as he is evilminded and sinful. (But) I do not see any reason for you to be frightened as he is not found anywhere here.

data.v: अहो शाखामृगत्वं ते व्यक्तमेव प्लवंगम । लघुचित्ततयात्मानं न स्थापयसि यो मतौ ।।
data.es: 'Oh monkey, whoever is lilylivered cannot be steady. It is evident that your very nature as a monkey makes you restless.

data.v: बुद्धिविज्ञानसंपन्न इङ्गितैः सर्वमाचर । न ह्यबुद्धिं गतो राजा सर्वभूतानि शास्ति हि ।।
सुग्रीवस्तु शुभं वाक्यं श्रुत्वा सर्वं हनूमतः । ततः शुभतरं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having heard the wise words of Hanuman, Sugriva addressed him with words more auspicious.

data.v: दीर्घबाहू विशालाक्षौ शरचापासिधारिणौ । कस्य न स्याद्भयं दृष्ट्वा एतौ सुरसुतोपमौ ।।
data.es: 'Who would not be apprehensive of these two longarmed and largeeyed individuals comparable to sons of gods wielding arrows, bows and swords.

data.v: वालिप्रणिहितावेतौ शङ्केऽहं पुरुषोत्तमौ । राजानो बहुमित्राश्च विश्वासो नात्र हि क्षमः ।।
data.es: 'I support these two excellent men might have been sent by Vali. Kings have many friends and so it may not be appropriate to trust any king.

data.v: अरयश्च मनुष्येण विज्ञेयाश्छन्नचारिणः । विश्वस्तानामविश्वस्ताश्छिद्रेषु प्रहरन्ति हि ।।
data.es: 'One has to identify these men roaming in disguise. These are not trustworthy and could even be our enemies, making us believe them so as to attack us when we are not vigilant.

data.v: कृत्येषु वाली मेधावी राजानो बहुदर्शनाः । भवन्ति परहन्तारस्ते ज्ञेयाः प्राकृतैर्नरैः ।।
data.es: 'Vali is wise in his actions. Kings employ many strategies to annihilate their enemies. Our gullible individuals should be able to detect them.

data.v: तौ त्वया प्राकृतेनैव गत्वा ज्ञेयौ प्लवंगम । शङ्कितानां प्रकारैश्च रूपव्याभाषणेन च ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman assume an ordinary form and approach them. Try to read them through their gestures, traits, forms and conversations.

data.v: लक्षयस्व तयोर्भावं प्रहृष्टमनसौ यदि । विश्वासयन्प्रशंसाभिरिङ्गितैश्च पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.

data.v: ममैवाभिमुखं स्थित्वा पृच्छ त्वं हरिपुंगव । प्रयोजनं प्रवेशस्य वनस्यास्य धनुर्धरौ ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys ascertain their purpose by praising them and studying their honest intentions. Gain the confidence of the wielders of bows and if you find them agreeable, enquire the purpose of their entering this forest.

data.v: शुद्धात्मानौ यदि त्वेतौ जानीहि त्वं प्लवंगम । व्याभाषितैर्वा रूपैर्वा विज्ञेया दुष्टतानयोः ।।
इत्येवं कपिराजेन संदिष्टो मारुतात्मजः । चकार गमने बुद्धिं यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Instructed thus by the king of the monkeys, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided to meet both Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: तथेति संपूज्य वचस्तु तस्य; कपेः सुभीतस्य दुरासदस्य । महानुभावो हनुमान्ययौ तदा; स यत्र रामोऽतिबलश्च लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the venerable, powerful and not easily conquerable monkey, honoured the words of the great Lord of the monkeys, offered salutations and said 'So be it'. And then proceeded towards the mighty Rama and Lakshmana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वितीयस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the second sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.

data.v: वचो विज्ञाय हनुमान्सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । पर्वतादृश्यमूकात्तु पुप्लुवे यत्र राघवौ ।।
data.es: Listening to great Sugriva, Hanuman leaped from mount Rishyamuka on to the location of the Raghavas.

data.v: स तत्र गत्वा हनुमान्बलवान्वानरोत्तमः । उपचक्राम तौ वाग्भिर्मृद्वीभिः सत्यविक्रमः ।।
स्वकं रूपं परित्यज्य भिक्षुरूपेण वानरः । आबभाषे च तौ वीरौ यथावत्प्रशशंस च ।।
राजर्षिदेवप्रतिमौ तापसौ संशितव्रतौ । देशं कथमिमं प्राप्तौ भवन्तौ वरवर्णिनौ ।।
data.es: 'You both fair in complexion, resemble royal sages or gods. You appear like ascetics and pursue vows in austerity. How come, you are present here, as if to frighten the animals and other creatures roaming this forest?

data.v: त्रासयन्तौ मृगगणानन्यांश्च वनचारिणः । पम्पातीररुहान्वृक्षान्वीक्षमाणौ समन्ततः ।।
इमां नदीं शुभजलां शोभयन्तौ तरस्विनौ । धैर्यवन्तौ सुवर्णाभौ कौ युवां चीरवाससौ ।।
data.es: 'Gazing at the trees on the bank of Pampa, you both appear in brilliant complexion as if to enhance the beauty of the auspicious river water. Though young, courageous and with handsome shoulders, you seem to sigh in exhaustion. And though you look like ascetics robed in bark, you seem to terrify these creatures.

data.v: सिंहविप्रेक्षितौ वीरौ सिंहातिबलविक्रमौ । शक्रचापनिभे चापे प्रगृह्य विपुलैर्भुजैः ।।
data.es: 'Having the gaze of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.

data.v: श्रीमन्तौ रूपसंपन्नौ वृषभश्रेष्ठविक्रमौ । हस्तिहस्तोपमभुजौ द्युतिमन्तौ नरर्षभौ ।।
data.es: 'Having the gaze of a lion, both of you are heroic in your stance. As each of you hold a bow resembling the rainbow, you seem to be mighty warriors eager to annihilate the enemies. With the valour of superior bulls and your shoulders resembling elephant's trunks, you look magnificent, handsome and brilliant. (No doubt,) you are the best among the humans.

data.v: प्रभया पर्वतेन्द्रोऽयं युवयोरवभासितः । राज्यार्हावमरप्रख्यौ कथं देशमिहागतौ ।।
data.es: 'You are young and radiant like the gods. This king of mountains (Rishyamuka) dazzles with your brilliance. Although you deserve to be sovereigns, how is it that you are here (into the forest)?

data.v: पद्मपत्रेक्षणौ वीरौ जटामण्डलधारिणौ । अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरौ देवलोकादिवागतौ ।।
यदृच्छयेव संप्राप्तौ चन्द्रसूर्यौ वसुंधराम् । विशालवक्षसौ वीरौ मानुषौ देवरूपिणौ ।।
data.es: 'Both of you appear alike, with eyes like lotus petals and locks of matted hair. You look like heroes descending from the world of the gods. You look like the Sun and the Moon dropped incidentally on this earth. With shoulders like those of a lion and the majesty of energetic bulls, you broadchested warriors appear like divine beings, though in fact humans.

data.v: सिंहस्कन्धौ महासत्त्वौ समदाविव गोवृषौ । आयताश्च सुवृत्ताश्च बाहवः परिघोत्तमाः । सर्वभूषणभूषार्हाः किमर्थं न विभूषितः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: जतभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरतज]

data.es: 'Your long arms and spherelike shoulders appear as strong as iron clubs. Although they deserve to be decked with ornaments, how is it they are unadorned?

data.v: उभौ योग्यावहं मन्ये रक्षितुं पृथिवीमिमाम् । ससागरवनां कृत्स्नां विन्ध्यमेरुविभूषिताम् ।।
data.es: 'To me, you both deserve to rule the entire earth encompassed by seas and forests and adorned with mountains like Vindhya and Meru.

data.v: इमे च धनुषी चित्रे श्लक्ष्णे चित्रानुलेपने । प्रकाशेते यथेन्द्रस्य वज्रे हेमविभूषिते ।।
data.es: 'Smeared with wonderful unguents, (your) bows look very attractive. And they glow very much like Indra's golden thunderbolt.

data.v: संपूर्णा निशितैर्बाणैर्तूणाश्च शुभदर्शनाः । जीवितान्तकरैर्घोरैर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पन्नगैः ।।
data.es: '(Your) quivers also appear beautiful, for they are fully filled with sharp and deadly arrows which look like the hissing of dreadful snakes

data.v: महाप्रमाणौ विपुलौ तप्तहाटकभूषितौ । खड्गावेतौ विराजेते निर्मुक्तभुजगाविव ।।
data.es: '(Your) long and broad swords appear very huge in size. Being encrusted with pure gold, they glitter brilliant like snakes in hyberation.

data.v: एवं मां परिभाषन्तं कस्माद्वै नाभिभाषथः ।।

लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वसतश्च वने तव । रक्षसापहृता भार्या मैथिली जनकात्मजा ।।
त्वया वियुक्ता रुदती लक्ष्मणेन च धीमता । अन्तरं प्रेप्सुना तेन हत्वा गृध्रं जटायुषम् ।।
भार्यावियोगजं दुःखं नचिरात्त्वं विमोक्ष्यसे । अहं तामानयिष्यामि नष्टां वेदश्रुतिं यथा ।।
data.es: 'Very soon you will be relieved of the grief caused by the separation from your wife. Just as Visnu retrieved the Vedas (carried away by the demons, Madhu and Kaitabha) I will deliver her to you.

data.v: रसातले वा वर्तन्तीं वर्तन्तीं वा नभस्तले । अहमानीय दास्यामि तव भार्यामरिंदम ।।
data.es: 'O subduer of enemies I will restore her to you even if she is kept in the bowels of the earth or in the vaults of heaven.

data.v: इदं तथ्यं मम वचस्त्वमवेहि च राघव । त्यज शोकं महाबाहो तां कान्तामानयामि ते ।।
data.es: 'O longarmed Rama, take these words of mine as true. Your consort cannot be absorbed with impunity even by the denizens of heaven including Indra or the ogres on earth any more than food cooked with poison.Give up grief.

data.v: अनुमानात्तु जानामि मैथिली सा न संशयः । ह्रियमाणा मया दृष्टा रक्षसा क्रूरकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.

data.v: क्रोशन्ती राम रामेति लक्ष्मणेति च विस्वरम् । स्फुरन्ती रावणस्याङ्के पन्नगेन्द्रवधूर्यथा ।।
data.es: 'Yes, I remember. I had observed a lady being carried away by a wicked demon. She was crying loudly 'Oh, Rama Oh Rama Oh Lakshmana' in a husky voice. It was Maithili. She was wriggling on the lap of Ravana like a female serpent.

data.v: आत्मना पञ्चमं मां हि दृष्ट्वा शैलतटे स्थितम् । उत्तरीयं तया त्यक्तं शुभान्याभरणानि च ।।
data.es: 'Seeing me as the fifth member seated on a mountain she dropped down the auspicious ornaments (bundled) in her veil

data.v: तान्यस्माभिर्गृहीतानि निहितानि च राघव । आनयिष्याम्यहं तानि प्रत्यभिज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Rama, we have kept them safely. I will fetch them so that you should be able to identify them.'

data.v: तमब्रवीत्ततो रामः सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम् । आनयस्व सखे शीघ्रं किमर्थं प्रविलम्बसे ।।
data.es: Rama then said to Sugriva, one who used pleasing words, 'O my friend why delay? Get them here immediately'.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः शैलस्य गहनां गुहाम् । प्रविवेश ततः शीघ्रं राघवप्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.es: On hearing this, Sugriva at once entered into the deep cave of the mountain (to get the ornaments and veil) in order to please Rama.

data.v: उत्तरीयं गृहीत्वा तु शुभान्याभरणानि च । इदं पश्येति रामाय दर्शयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: That monkey brought out the veil and auspicios ornaments, showed them to Rama and said, 'Please, see.'

data.v: ततो गृहीत्वा तद्वासः शुभान्याभरणानि च । अभवद्बाष्पसंरुद्धो नीहारेणेव चन्द्रमाः ।।
data.es: Holding the raiment as well as the ornaments, Rama's eyes were filled with tears.He appeared like the Moon covered with dews.

data.v: सीतास्नेहप्रवृत्तेन स तु बाष्पेण दूषितः । हा प्रियेति रुदन्धैर्यमुत्सृज्य न्यपतत्क्षितौ ।।
data.es: On account of his deep attachment for Sita, he shed profuse tears. Unable to maintain his natural composure, he sank down to the ground, saying 'O my darling Sita' and cried inconsolably

data.v: हृदि कृत्वा स बहुशस्तमलंकारमुत्तमम् । निशश्वास भृशं सर्पो बिलस्थ इव रोषितः ।।
data.es: Pressing the excellent ornaments to his bosom again and again Rama hissed like a cobra provoked in its anthill.

data.v: अविच्छिन्नाश्रुवेगस्तु सौमित्रिं वीक्ष्य पार्श्वतः । परिदेवयितुं दीनं रामः समुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Rama began to wail piteously while tears streamed down his eyes incessantly. He looked at Saumitri standing by his side and said:

data.v: पश्य लक्ष्मण वैदेह्या संत्यक्तं ह्रियमाणया । उत्तरीयमिदं भूमौ शरीराद्भूषणानि च ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, behold the veil and the ornaments dropped on the ground by Vaidehi while she was being abducted.

data.v: शाद्वलिन्यां ध्रुवं भूम्यां सीतया ह्रियमाणया । उत्सृष्टं भूषणमिदं तथारूपं हि दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'Sita, for sure, dropped these ornaments on the grassy ground. They are in good shape (without any damage).

data.v: ब्रूहि सुग्रीव कं देशं ह्रियन्ती लक्षिता त्वया । रक्षसा रौद्ररूपेण मम प्राणसमा प्रिया ।।
data.es: Then Rama said to Sugriva,.'Tell me, O Sugriva, to which region that fiercelooking demon has carried away my Sita, who is dearer than my life.

data.v: क्व वा वसति तद्रक्षो महद्व्यसनदं मम । यन्निमित्तमहं सर्वान्नाशयिष्यामि राक्षसान् ।।
data.es: 'Let me know where dwells that huge ogre who has caused this agony to me. I will exterminate all the demons

data.v: हरता मैथिलीं येन मां च रोषयता भृशम् । आत्मनो जीवितान्ताय मृत्युद्वारमपावृतम् ।।
data.es: 'By abducting Maithili he has stirred my fierce anger and has opened the door of his death.

data.v: मम दयिततमा हृता वना;द्रजनिचरेण विमथ्य येन सा । कथय मम रिपुं तमद्य वै; प्रवगपते यमसंनिधिं नयामि ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys tell me the whereabouts of that nightranger who has carried off my darling from the heart of the forest and has harassed her. I will send him now to the abode of Death.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्ठस्सर्गःThus ends the sixth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामेणार्तेन वानरः । अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं सबाष्पं बाष्पगद्गदः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:

data.v: न जाने निलयं तस्य सर्वथा पापरक्षसः । सामर्थ्यं विक्रमं वापि दौष्कुलेयस्य वा कुलम् ।।
data.es: 'I do not have any knowledge of this sinful demon's dwelling , his capability, his valour or his clan or his despicable lineage.

data.v: सत्यं तु प्रतिजानामि त्यज शोकमरिंदम । करिष्यामि तथा यत्नं यथा प्राप्स्यसि मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'O subduer of enemies, give up sorrow. I promise I will make necessary effort so that you will obtain the princess from Mithila.

data.v: रावणं सगणं हत्वा परितोष्यात्मपौरुषम् । तथास्मि कर्ता नचिराद्यथा प्रीतो भविष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'With all my capability I will kill Ravana and his clan. Thus I will be able to satisfy you soon with my efforts.

data.v: अलं वैक्लव्यमालम्ब्य धैर्यमात्मगतं स्मर । त्वद्विधानां न सदृशमीदृशं बुद्धिलाघवम् ।।
data.es: 'Give up despair. It is enough. Be patient. Maintain your natural disposition.It is unworthy of men like you to entertain such frivolus thoughts?

data.v: मयापि व्यसनं प्राप्तं भार्या हरणजं महत् । न चाहमेवं शोचामि न च धैर्यं परित्यजे ।।
data.es: 'Separated from my wife, I, too, am afflicted with deep grief. But I do not brood, I do not lose patience.

data.v: नाहं तामनुशोचामि प्राकृतो वानरोऽपि सन् । महात्मा च विनीतश्चा किं पुनर्धृतिमान्भवान् ।।
data.es: 'I am an ordinary monkey born. Even then, I do not brood over my wife. You are highsouled, humble and patient. Why do you grieve?

data.v: बाष्पमापतितं धैर्यान्निग्रहीतुं त्वमर्हसि । मर्यादां सत्त्वयुक्तानां धृतिं नोत्स्रष्टुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Restrain the flow of your tears. Be patient. Men (like you) endowed with equilibrium and dignity and patience ought not to leave their composure.

data.v: व्यसने वार्थ कृच्छ्रे वा भये वा जीवितान्तगे । विमृशन्वै स्वया बुद्ध्या धृतिमान्नावसीदति ।।
data.es: 'In times of grief or loss of wealth or at the hour of death, one who is patient does not abandon his wisdom, he does not despair.

data.v: बालिशस्तु नरो नित्यं वैक्लव्यं योऽनुवर्तते । स मज्जत्यवशः शोके भाराक्रान्तेव नौर्जले ।।
एषोऽञ्जलिर्मया बद्धः प्रणयात्त्वां प्रसादये । पौरुषं श्रय शोकस्य नान्तरं दातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I implore you with folded palms on account of our friendship to show manliness. You should not give in to grief.

data.v: ये शोकमनुवर्तन्ते न तेषां विद्यते सुखम् । तेजश्च क्षीयते तेषां न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'There is no happiness for those who give way to sorrow. Their brilliance is dimmed. Therefore, you ought not grieve.

data.v: हितं वयस्य भावेन ब्रूहि नोपदिशामि ते । वयस्यतां पूजयन्मे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'Out of friendly concern I offer my opinion in your interest. I am not competent to advise you. Respecting my friendship, you should never yield to grief.'

data.v: मधुरं सान्त्वितस्तेन सुग्रीवेण स राघवः । मुखमश्रुपरिक्लिन्नं वस्त्रान्तेन प्रमार्जयत् ।।
data.es: Consoled by the sweet words of Sugriva, Rama wiped his face filled with tears by the hem of his upper cloth.

data.v: प्रकृतिष्ठस्तु काकुत्स्थः सुग्रीववचनात्प्रभुः । संपरिष्वज्य सुग्रीवमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When lord Rama, the scion of the Kakutstha race was comforted by these words of Sugriva, he came to his senses, and clasping him said:

data.v: कर्तव्यं यद्वयस्येन स्निग्धेन च हितेन च । अनुरूपं च युक्तं च कृतं सुग्रीव तत्त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you have done what a friend should have done in a befitting manner with your sweet words and good wishes.

data.v: एष च प्रकृतिष्ठोऽहमनुनीतस्त्वया सखे । दुर्लभो हीदृशो बन्धुरस्मिन्काले विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O friend you have guided me back to my senses thus. It is difficult to find a friend like you specially at this time.

data.v: किं तु यत्नस्त्वया कार्यो मैथिल्याः परिमार्गणे । राक्षसस्य च रौद्रस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, you must make effort to trace the princess from Mithila and the evilminded, fierce demon Ravana.

data.v: मया च यदनुष्ठेयं विस्रब्धेन तदुच्यताम् । वर्षास्विव च सुक्षेत्रे सर्वं संपद्यते तव ।।
data.es: 'Now tell me about my duty without any hesitation. I assure you that your desire will be fulfilled, just as seeds sown in a fertile land with timely rains bear fruit.

data.v: मया च यदिदं वाक्यमभिमानात्समीरितम् । तत्त्वया हरिशार्दूल तत्त्वमित्युपधार्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O tiger amongst monkeys accept my words uttered out of injured honour in their true sense.

data.v: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन । एतत्ते प्रतिजानामि सत्येनैव शपामि ते ।।
data.es: 'I have never uttered a false word earlier nor will I do it in future. This is my promise. I swear by truth alone.'

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टः सुग्रीवो वानरैः सचिवैः सह । राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा प्रतिज्ञातं विशेषतः ।।
data.es: Sugriva and his counsellors felt glad on hearing Rama's words, particularly the assurance given by him.

data.v: महानुभावस्य वचो निशम्य; हरिर्नराणामृषभस्य तस्य । कृतं स मेने हरिवीर मुख्य;स्तदा स्वकार्यं हृदयेन विद्वान् ।।
data.es: Wise Sugriva, chief of monkeys, heard the words of the magnanimous Rama, a bull among men. He felt glad at heart thinking that his task has been achieved.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the seventh sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by the sage Valmiki.

data.v: परितुष्टस्तु सुग्रीवस्तेन वाक्येन वानरः । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रजं राममिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:

data.v: सर्वथाहमनुग्राह्यो देवतानामसंशयः । उपपन्नगुणोपेतः सखा यस्य भवान्मम ।।
data.es: 'Since one like you endowed with all virtues has become my friend I am (now) worthy of grace of the gods in all respects. There is no doubt.

data.v: शक्यं खलु भवेद्राम सहायेन त्वयानघ । सुरराज्यमपि प्राप्तुं स्वराज्यं किं पुनः प्रभो ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, my sinless Lord, it is possible to attain even the kingdom of the gods with your help, what to speak of my own kingdom?

data.v: सोऽहं सभाज्यो बन्धूनां सुहृदां चैव राघव । यस्याग्निसाक्षिकं मित्रं लब्धं राघववंशजम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, since you, born in Raghava dynasty, have become my friend with fire as witness, I have become equally honourable among my relatives and friends.

data.v: अहमप्यनुरूपस्ते वयस्यो ज्ञास्यसे शनैः । न तु वक्तुं समर्थोऽहं स्वयमात्मगतान्गुणान् ।।
data.es: 'You will come to know slowly that I am also a friend worthy of you.It is not proper for me to speak of my qualities( flatter myself).

data.v: महात्मनां तु भूयिष्ठं त्वद्विधानां कृतात्मनाम् । निश्चला भवति प्रीतिर्धैर्यमात्मवतामिव ।।
data.es: 'The affection of exalted souls is exceedingly stable like the patience of selfcontrolled and wellcomposed men like you.

data.v: रजतं वा सुवर्णं वा वस्त्राण्याभरणानि वा । अविभक्तानि साधूनामवगच्छन्ति साधवः ।।
data.es: 'Good friends consider(valuables such as) silver or gold, clothes or ornaments of worldly wealth indivisible.

data.v: आढ्यो वापि दरिद्रो वा दुःखितः सुखितोऽपि वा । निर्दोषो वा सदोषो वा वयस्यः परमा गतिः ।।
data.es: 'Whether rich or poor, afflicted or happy, flawless or guilty, a friend is the ultimate refuge to a friend.

data.v: धनत्यागः सुखत्यागो देहत्यागोऽपि वा पुनः । वयस्यार्थे प्रवर्तन्ते स्नेहं दृष्ट्वा तथाविधम् ।।
data.es: 'One will not hesitate to sacrifice wealth or happiness or even life for the sake of a friend like you.'

data.v: तत्तथेत्यब्रवीद्रामः सुग्रीवं प्रियवादिनम् । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो लक्ष्म्या वासवस्येव धीमतः ।।
data.es: As wise Lakshmana, brilliant like Indra stood witness, Rama said, 'it is true as you say' to Sugriva who spoke pleasing words.

data.v: ततो रामं स्थितं दृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् । सुग्रीवः सर्वतश्चक्षुर्वने लोलमपातयत् ।।
data.es: With mighty Rama and Lakshmana standing by, Sugriva cast his eyes eagerly all round the forest.

data.v: स ददर्श ततः सालमविदूरे हरीश्वरः । सुपुष्पमीषत्पत्राढ्यं भ्रमरैरुपशोभितम् ।।
data.es: Then the chief of monkeys saw a sala tree looking lovely with tender leaves and flowers graced by bees.

data.v: तस्यैकां पर्णबहुलां भङ्क्त्वा शाखां सुपुष्पिताम् । सालस्यास्तीर्य सुग्रीवो निषसाद सराघवः ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva cut the branch of a sala tree with luxuriant leaves and flowers, spread it on the ground and sat down along with Raghava.

data.v: तावासीनौ ततो दृष्ट्वा हनूमानपि लक्ष्मणम् । सालशाखां समुत्पाट्य विनीतमुपवेशयत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Hanuman also broke a branch of the sala tree and seated Lakshmana on it.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टः सुग्रीवः श्लक्ष्णं मधुरया गिरा । उवाच प्रणयाद्रामं हर्षव्याकुलिताक्षरम् ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva, eyes sparkling with joy, replied to Rama in a sweet, gentle voice.

data.v: अहं विनिकृतो भ्रात्रा चराम्येष भयार्दितः । ऋश्यमूकं गिरिवरं हृतभार्यः सुदुःखितः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, I have been insulted deeply and my wife hijacked. Stricken with fear I have taken refuge in this inaccessible forest.

data.v: सोऽहं त्रस्तो भये मग्नो वसाम्युद्भ्रान्तचेतनः । वालिना निकृतो भ्रात्रा कृतवैरश्च राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama humiliated by my brother Vali, I have developed enmity with him. Terribly distraught and disturbed I live in this forest in great fear.

data.v: वालिनो मे भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकाभयंकर । ममापि त्वमनाथस्य प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O great warrior who can frighten all the worlds scared of Vali, I feel helpless like an orphan to whom you ought to extend your grace.'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मवत्सलः । प्रत्युवाच स काकुत्स्थः सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:

data.v: उपकारफलं मित्रमपकारोऽरिलक्षणम् । अद्यैव तं हनिष्यामि तव भार्यापहारिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey I know friendship is the fruit of a beneficial deed. I will kill that Vali who has usurped your wife.

data.v: इमे हि मे महावेगाः पत्रिणस्तिग्मतेजसः । कार्तिकेयवनोद्भूताः शरा हेमविभूषिताः ।।
data.es: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.

data.v: कङ्कपत्रप्रतिच्छन्ना महेन्द्राशनिसंनिभाः । सुपर्वाणः सुतीक्ष्णाग्रा सरोषा भुजगा इव ।।
data.es: 'Here are my highspeed, winged arrows glowing like fierce fire, born out of Kartikeya's bed of reeds.They are smooth and welljointed, decked with gold, comparable in strength to great Indra's thunderbolt, very sharp with pointed tips looking like angry serpents.

data.v: भ्रातृसंज्ञममित्रं ते वालिनं कृतकिल्बिषम् । शरैर्विनिहतं पश्य विकीर्णमिव पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: 'With these sharp, serpentlike arrows Vali will be killed. He will fall down on the ground like a mountain shattered.You will see it now'.

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो वाहिनीपतिः । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे साधु साध्विति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's words, Sugriva, chief of the army of monkeys experienced immeasurable happiness and exclaimed, 'you're great, you're great.'

data.v: रामशोकाभिभूतोऽहं शोकार्तानां भवान्गतिः । वयस्य इति कृत्वा हि त्वय्यहं परिदेवये ।।
data.es: 'Rama I am overwhelmed with sorrow. You are the refuge of the distressed. As you are a friend I ventilate all my grief to you.

data.v: त्वं हि पाणिप्रदानेन वयस्यो सोऽग्निसाक्षिकः । कृतः प्राणैर्बहुमतः सत्येनापि शपाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'I value your hand of friendship extended to me, with fire as witness more than my very life. I, on my own, offer my pledge of friendship.

data.v: वयस्य इति कृत्वा च विस्रब्धं प्रवदाम्यहम् । दुःखमन्तर्गतं यन्मे मनो दहति नित्यशः ।।
एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं बाष्पदूषितलोचनः । बाष्पोपहतया वाचा नोच्चैः शक्नोति भाषितुम् ।।
data.es: His vision blurred, words choked with tears he was unable to speak further.

data.v: बाष्पवेगं तु सहसा नदीवेगमिवागतम् । धारयामास धैर्येण सुग्रीवो रामसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: Quickly Sugriva controlled his tears streaming fast like the rushing river, with patience, Rama seated in front.

data.v: संनिगृह्य तु तं बाष्पं प्रमृज्य नयने शुभे । विनिःश्वस्य च तेजस्वी राघवं पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Effulgent Sugriva controlled his tears, wiped his bright eyes, took deep breath and said to Rama:

data.v: पुराहं वलिना राम राज्यात्स्वादवरोपितः । परुषाणि च संश्राव्य निर्धूतोऽस्मि बलीयसा ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I was subjected to the harsh words of powerful Vali in the past when he uprooted me from the kingdom and threw me out.

data.v: हृता भार्या च मे तेन प्राणेभ्योऽपि गरीयसी । सुहृदश्च मदीया ये संयता बन्धनेषु ते ।।
data.es: 'I was robbed of my wife who is dearer than my own life. All my friends were rounded up and imprisoned.

data.v: यत्नवांश्च सुदुष्टात्मा मद्विनाशाय राघव । बहुशस्तत्प्रयुक्ताश्च वानरा निहता मया ।।
data.es: 'O Rama this evilminded one made several attempts to kill me. The monkeys he sent to kill me were themselves killed.

data.v: शङ्कया त्वेतया चाहं दृष्ट्वा त्वामपि राघव । नोपसर्पाम्यहं भीतो भये सर्वे हि बिभ्यति ।।
data.es: 'It is because of suspicion that I did not approach you. Every one is scared when there is ample reason to fear.

data.v: केवलं हि सहाया मे हनुमत्प्रमुखास्त्विमे । अतोऽहं धारयाम्यद्य प्राणान्कृच्छ्र गतोऽपि सन् ।।
data.es: 'Only Hanuman and other chiefs are helping me. Therefore, I am surviving in spite of all difficulties.

data.v: एते हि कपयः स्निग्धा मां रक्षन्ति समन्ततः । सह गच्छन्ति गन्तव्ये नित्यं तिष्ठन्ति च स्थिते ।।
data.es: 'These monkeys out of love for me keep me protected from all sides. They go out with me when it is necessary and stay back whenever I stop (in order to guard me).

data.v: संक्षेपस्त्वेष मे राम किमुक्त्वा विस्तरं हि ते । स मे ज्येष्ठो रिपुर्भ्राता वाली विश्रुतपौरुषः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I tell you (my story) briefly. It is not necessary to go into details. My elder brother Vali, who is known for his prowess, is my enemy.

data.v: तद्विनाशाद्धि मे दुःखं प्रनष्टं स्यादनन्तरम् । सुखं मे जीवितं चैव तद्विनाशनिबन्धनम् ।।
data.es: 'My sorrow will go only with his death. My happiness and my life are also subject to his destruction.

data.v: एष मे राम शोकान्तः शोकार्तेन निवेदितः । दुःखितोऽदुःखितो वापि सख्युर्नित्यं सखा गतिः ।।
data.es: 'This what I had to tell you out of sorrow. This is how my sorrow will end. In joy and in sorrow your friend is your refuge.

data.v: श्रुत्वैतच्च वचो रामः सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत् । किंनिमित्तमभूद्वैरं श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ।।
data.es: After hearing Sugriva, Rama said 'I wish to know the actual cause of this enmity.

data.v: सुखं हि कारणं श्रुत्वा वैरस्य तव वानर । आनन्तर्यं विधास्यामि संप्रधार्य बलाबलम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing the cause of your enmity and considering your strength and weakness, I will take steps to make you happy.

data.v: बलवान्हि ममामर्षः श्रुत्वा त्वामवमानितम् । वर्धते हृदयोत्कम्पी प्रावृड्वेग इवाम्भसः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing about your humiliation I feel highly agitated at heart. I feel very much angry and restless like the water in rainy season.

data.v: हृष्टः कथय विस्रब्धो यावदारोप्यते धनुः । सृष्टश्च हि मया बाणो निरस्तश्च रिपुस्तव ।।
data.es: 'Tell me freely and cheerfully before I string the bow. Your enemy will be destroyed as soon as I release my arrow.'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः काकुत्स्थेन महात्मना । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे चतुर्भिः सह वानरैः ।।
data.es: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.

data.v: ततः प्रहृष्टवदनः सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणाग्रजे । वैरस्य कारणं तत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: With a smile on his face, Sugriva started narrating to Lakshmana's elder brother the facts about the cause of his enmity (with Vali).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टमस्सर्गःThus ends the eighth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: वाली नाम मम भ्राता ज्येष्ठः शत्रुनिषूदनः । पितुर्बहुमतो नित्यं मम चापि तथा पुरा ।।
data.es: 'My elder brother called Vali, capable of exterminating enemies was always highly regarded by my father and me.

data.v: पितर्युपरतेऽस्माकं ज्येष्ठोऽयमिति मन्त्रिभिः । कपीनामीश्वरो राज्ये कृतः परमसंमतः ।।
राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य पितृपैतामहं महत् । अहं सर्वेषु कालेषु प्रणतः प्रेष्यवत्स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'I served him obediently like a servant while he ruled over the great ancestral kingdom inherited by him.

data.v: मायावी नाम तेजस्वी पूर्वजो दुन्दुभेः सुतः । तेन तस्य महद्वैरं स्त्रीकृतं विश्रुतं पुरा ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi's eldest son Mayabi was a mighty demon. He developed bitter enmity with Vali for the sake of a woman.

data.v: स तु सुप्ते जने रात्रौ किष्किन्धाद्वारमागतः । नर्दति स्म सुसंरब्धो वालिनं चाह्वयद्रणे ।।
data.es: 'One midnight when all were asleep, he (Mayabi) came to the entrance of Kishkinda screaming angrily and bellowing at Vali, challenging him to a duel.

data.v: प्रसुप्तस्तु मम भ्राता नर्दितं भैरवस्वनम् । श्रुत्वा न ममृषे वाली निष्पपात जवात्तदा ।।
data.es: ' My brother Vali, who was asleep could not tolerate the frightful sound and jumped out of bed hastily.

data.v: स तु वै निःसृतः क्रोधात्तं हन्तुमसुरोत्तमम् । वार्यमाणस्ततः स्त्रीभिर्मया च प्रणतात्मना ।।
data.es: 'Enraged, he came out to kill the powerful demon even though I with the womenfolk (of the harem) tried to prevent him.

data.v: स तु निर्धूय सर्वान्नो निर्जगाम महाबलः । ततोऽहमपि सौहार्दान्निःसृतो वालिना सह ।।
data.es: 'That mighty warrior(Vali) came out, pushing aside all the womenfolk. I too followed him due to my affection towards him.

data.v: स तु मे भ्रातरं दृष्ट्वा मां च दूरादवस्थितम् । असुरो जातसंत्रासः प्रदुद्राव तदा भृशम् ।।
data.es: 'On seeing my brother and me from a distance, the demon took to his heels scared.

data.v: तस्मिन्द्रवति संत्रस्ते ह्यावां द्रुततरं गतौ । प्रकाशोऽपि कृतो मार्गश्चन्द्रेणोद्गच्छता तदा ।।
data.es: 'Frightened, he ran. We too chased him running faster. As the Moon was rising the path was welllit.

data.v: स तृणैरावृतं दुर्गं धरण्या विवरं महत् । प्रविवेशासुरो वेगादावामासाद्य विष्ठितौ ।।
data.es: 'The demon entered into a hole (cave) covered with a heap of grass, difficult, therefore, of access. Both of us reached there and took position.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं रिपुं दृष्ट्वा बिलं रोषवशं गतः । मामुवाच तदा वाली वचनं क्षुभितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: 'Seeing the enemy entering the cave, Vali became wrathful and his senses were terribly disturbed.He said to me:

data.v: इह त्वं तिष्ठ सुग्रीव बिलद्वारि समाहितः । यावदत्र प्रविश्याहं निहन्मि समरे रिपुम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva wait here at the entrance of the cave and be on your alert until I enter this hole and kill the enemy'.

data.v: मया त्वेतद्वचः श्रुत्वा याचितः स परंतप । शापयित्वा च मां पद्भ्यां प्रविवेश बिलं तदा ।।
data.es: 'On hearing him, I begged the scorcher of enemies (Vali) that I would follow him, but he made me swear on his feet and entered the cave.

data.v: तस्य प्रविष्टस्य बिलं साग्रः संवत्सरो गतः । स्थितस्य च मम द्वारि स कालो व्यत्यवर्तत ।।
अहं तु नष्टं तं ज्ञात्वा स्नेहादागतसंभ्रमः । भ्रातरं न हि पश्यामि पापशङ्कि च मे मनः ।।
data.es: 'Thinking him dead, I became agitated because of my love for him. My mind began to apprehend his death since I had not seen my brother for long.

data.v: अथ दीर्घस्य कालस्य बिलात्तस्माद्विनिःसृतम् । सफेनं रुधिरं रक्तमहं दृष्ट्वा सुदुःखितः ।।
नर्दतामसुराणां च ध्वनिर्मे श्रोत्रमागतः । निरस्तस्य च संग्रामे क्रोशतो निःस्वनो गुरोः ।।
data.es: 'I heard the roaring voices of the demons and not the yelling of my brother engaged in the duel.

data.v: अहं त्ववगतो बुद्ध्या चिह्नैस्तैर्भ्रातरं हतम् । पिधाय च बिलद्वारं शिलया गिरिमात्रया । शोकार्तश्चोदकं कृत्वा किष्किन्धामागतः सखे ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यमतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरनम], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससयम], अज्ञातम् [१२: जसमम]

data.es: 'O friend by those signs I understood that my brother was killed and concluding that way I blocked the entrance of the cave with a rock of the size of a mountain and offered oblations to my brother and came to Kishkinda. I intended to hide the fact of Vali's death. But the ministers came to know the truth with their efforts.

data.v: गूहमानस्य मे तत्त्वं यत्नतो मन्त्रिभिः श्रुतम् । ततोऽहं तैः समागम्य समेतैरभिषेचितः ।।
राज्यं प्रशासतस्तस्य न्यायतो मम राघव । आजगाम रिपुं हत्वा वाली तमसुरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'Then all the ministers assembled together and consecrated me. While I was ruling the kingdom lawfully, Vali, the monkey came back after killing the enemy demon.

data.v: अभिषिक्तं तु मां दृष्ट्वा क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः । मदीयान्मन्त्रिणो बद्ध्वा परुषं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: 'Seeing me on the throne, Vali became angry and his eyes turned red. He imprisoned my ministers and spoke to me harshly.

data.v: निग्रहेऽपि समर्थस्य तं पापं प्रति राघव । न प्रावर्तत मे बुद्धिर्भ्रातृगौरवयन्त्रिता ।।
data.es: 'O Rama even though I was capable of restraining the sinner, my intellect did not let me do so out of respect for my brother.

data.v: मानयंस्तं महात्मानं यथावच्चाभ्यवादयम् । उक्ताश्च नाशिषस्तेन संतुष्टेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: 'When my brother came back to the town after killing the enemy, I offered as usual my salutations to him. But he did not bless me wholeheartedly.

data.v: ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टं संरब्धं तमुपागतम् । अहं प्रसादयां चक्रे भ्रातरं प्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.es: 'I sought to appease my brother who arrived in an agitated state overpowered with anger.

data.v: दिष्ट्यासि कुशली प्राप्तो निहतश्च त्वया रिपुः । अनाथस्य हि मे नाथस्त्वमेकोऽनाथनन्दनः ।।
data.es: 'By providence you have come back safe and the enemy has been killed. You are the only protector to an orphan which I am.

data.v: इदं बहुशलाकं ते पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम् । छत्रं सवालव्यजनं प्रतीच्छस्व मयोद्यतम् ।।
data.es: 'Here is the manyribbed parasol shining like the full Moon above the horizon and the yak's tailfan held by me.Pray accept it.

data.v: त्वमेव राजा मानार्हः सदा चाहं यथापुरा । न्यासभूतमिदं राज्यं तव निर्यातयाम्यहम् ।।
मा च रोषं कृथाः सौम्य मयि शत्रुनिबर्हण । याचे त्वां शिरसा राजन्मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः ।।
बलादस्मि समागम्य मन्त्रिभिः पुरवासिभिः । राजभावे नियुक्तोऽहं शून्यदेशजिगीषया ।।
data.es: 'O king I bow my head and beg you with folded hands. The ministers and citizens assembled and forced me to take charge, as the kingdom without a ruler was vulnerable to attack.'

data.v: स्निग्धमेवं ब्रुवाणं मां स तु निर्भर्त्स्य वानरः । धिक्त्वामिति च मामुक्त्वा बहु तत्तदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: 'Even tnough I spoke to him with affection, Vali abused me in many words, saying, 'Fie on you'.

data.v: प्रकृतीश्च समानीय मन्त्रिणश्चैव संमतान् । मामाह सुहृदां मध्ये वाक्यं परमगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: 'Having invited ordinary people and favourite ministers he condemned me in the presence of friends.

data.v: विदितं वो यथा रात्रौ मायावी स महासुरः । मां समाह्वयत क्रूरो युद्धाकाङ्क्षी सुदुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: 'You know very well how that wicked demon, Mayabi, that night challenged me angrily to a duel.

data.v: तस्य तद्गर्जितं श्रुत्वा निःसृतोऽहं नृपालयात् । अनुयातश्च मां तूर्णमयं भ्राता सुदारुणः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing his words I came out of the royal abode quickly, followed by this wicked brother.

data.v: स तु दृष्ट्वैव मां रात्रौ सद्वितीयं महाबलः । प्राद्रवद्भयसंत्रस्तो वीक्ष्यावां तमनुद्रुतौ । अनुद्रुतस्तु वेगेन प्रविवेश महाबिलम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यभभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जतभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसजभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: सरमय]

data.es: 'The powerful demon that night saw me followed by another advancing towards him and fled out of fear. When we chased him, he entered this huge cave in great speed.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं विदित्वा तु सुघोरं सुमहद्बिलम् । अयमुक्तोऽथ मे भ्राता मया तु क्रूरदर्शनः ।।
data.es: 'When I saw the dreadful demon entering the great cave, I instructed this cruel brother of mine:

data.v: अहत्वा नास्ति मे शक्तिः प्रतिगन्तुमितः पुरीम् । बिलद्वारि प्रतीक्ष त्वं यावदेनं निहन्म्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'I cannot return from here without killing him. Wait at the entrance of the cave until I kill him. Look forward to my return.

data.v: स्थितोऽयमिति मत्वा तु प्रविष्टोऽहं दुरासदम् । तं च मे मार्गमाणस्य गतः संवत्सरस्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Presuming that Sugriva was waiting there, I entered the formidable cave. While I was searching for the demon there, one year passed.

data.v: स तु दृष्टो मया शत्रुरनिर्वेदाद्भयावहः । निहतश्च मया तत्र सोऽसुरो बन्धुभिः सह ।।
data.es: 'I could find that fearful enemy there and killed him along with his relatives without any difficulty.

data.v: तस्यास्यात्तु प्रवृत्तेन रुधिरौघेण तद्बिलम् । पूर्णमासीद्दुराक्रामं स्तनतस्तस्य भूतले ।।
सूदयित्वा तु तं शत्रुं विक्रान्तं दुन्दुभेः सुतम् । निष्क्रामन्नेव पश्यामि बिलस्य पिहितं मुखम् ।।
विक्रोशमानस्य तु मे सुग्रीवेति पुनः पुनः । यदा प्रतिवचो नास्ति ततोऽहं भृशदुःखितः ।।
data.es: 'When there was no response from Sugriva to my repeated call in distress I was very sad.

data.v: पादप्रहारैस्तु मया बहुशस्तद्विदारितम् । ततोऽहं तेन निष्क्रम्य यथा पुनरुपागतः ।।
data.es: 'I kicked the boulder again and again till it yielded. I came out that way and arrived at the city.

data.v: तत्रानेनास्मि संरुद्धो राज्यं मार्गयतात्मनः । सुग्रीवेण नृशंसेन विस्मृत्य भ्रातृसौहृदम् ।।
data.es: 'I was obstructed by wicked Sugriva who forgot his brotherly love and was desiring the kingdom, which belongs to me.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु मां तत्र वस्त्रेणैकेन वानरः । तदा निर्वासयामास वाली विगतसाध्वसः ।।
data.es: 'When Vali, the monkey, spoke that way I remained unperturbed. He banished me with the only cloth I was wearing.

data.v: तेनाहमपविद्धश्च हृतदारश्च राघव । तद्भयाच्च महीकृत्स्ना क्रान्तेयं सवनार्णवा ।।
data.es: 'O Rama my wife has been usurped. There is the fear of his attack. So I am roaming this entire earth, covered with forests and oceans.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकं गिरिवरं भार्याहरणदुःखितः । प्रविष्टोऽस्मि दुराधर्षं वालिनः कारणान्तरे ।।
data.es: 'Tormented by the abduction of my wife by Vali, I came to the great Rishyamuka mountain inaccessible to Vali for some other reason.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं वैरानुकथनं महत् । अनागसा मया प्राप्तं व्यसनं पश्य राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama I have given you this long, full account of the cause of our enmity. For no fault of mine I am suffering.

data.v: वालिनस्तु भयार्तस्य सर्वलोकाभयंकर । कर्तुमर्हसि मे वीर प्रसादं तस्य निग्रहात् ।।
data.es: 'O reverend Kakutstha, I feel helpless with fear from Vali. Save me. You should release me free from fear.'

data.v: एवमुक्तः स तेजस्वी धर्मज्ञो धर्मसंहितम् । वचनं वक्तुमारेभे सुग्रीवं प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: The righteous and glorious Rama to whom dharma is very dear said to Sugriva with a gentle smile on his face, when he was entreated thus:

data.v: अमोघाः सूर्यसंकाशा ममेमे निशिताः शराः । तस्मिन्वालिनि दुर्वृत्ते पतिष्यन्ति रुषान्विताः ।।
data.es: 'These arrows covered with kanka feathers, sharp and straight at the tip, comparable to great Indra's thunderbolt are (burning bright) like the sun. Looking like angry serpents, they will unfailingly strike at the miscreant Vali soon.

data.v: यावत्तं न हि पश्येयं तव भार्यापहारिणम् । तावत्स जीवेत्पापात्मा वाली चारित्रदूषकः ।।
data.es: 'That sinful Vali who has abducted your wife and violated the moral code will live only as long I do not see him.

data.v: आत्मानुमानात्पश्यामि मग्नं त्वां शोकसागरे । त्वामहं तारयिष्यामि कामं प्राप्स्यसि पुष्कलम् ।।
data.es: 'Inferring from my own experience, I see that you are immersed in an ocean of sorrow.I will help you cross over and fulfil your desire.'

data.v: रामस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा हर्षपौरुषवर्धनम् । सुग्रीवः पूजयां चक्रे राघवं प्रशशंस च ।।
data.es: On hearing his words that boosted his joy and vigour, Sugriva was immensely pleased and said these warm words.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे दशमस्सर्गःThus ends the tenth sarga of Kishkindhakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: असंशयं प्रज्वलितैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मर्मातिगैः शरैः । त्वं दहेः कुपितो लोकान्युगान्त इव भास्करः ।।
data.es: 'There is no doubt that your sharp, blazing arrows will pierce through the vital parts of the body once you are angry, just as the Sungod burns all worlds at the end of the Yuga.

data.v: वालिनः पौरुषं यत्तद्यच्च वीर्यं धृतिश्च या । तन्ममैकमनाः श्रुत्वा विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम् ।।
समुद्रात्पश्चिमात्पूर्वं दक्षिणादपि चोत्तरम् । क्रामत्यनुदिते सूर्ये वाली व्यपगतक्लमः ।।
data.es: 'In the early hours before Sunrise Vali crosses over the oceans from the west to the east and moving from south to north (performing sandhya) without getting fatigued.

data.v: अग्राण्यारुह्य शैलानां शिखराणि महान्त्यपि । ऊर्ध्वमुत्क्षिप्य तरसा प्रतिगृह्णाति वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: 'Climbing up speedily, valiant Vali would catch the huge mountain peaks.

data.v: बहवः सारवन्तश्च वनेषु विविधा द्रुमाः । वालिना तरसा भग्ना बलं प्रथयतात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Vali would break several sturdy trees in the forest with his vigour and speed, exhibiting his strength.

data.v: महिषो दुन्दुभिर्नाम कैलासशिखरप्रभः । बलं नागसहस्रस्य धारयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: 'Massive like the shining peak of mount Kailas and valiant like the mightybuffalo in form, Dundubhi possessed the strength of a thousand elephants.

data.v: वीर्योत्सेकेन दुष्टात्मा वरदानाच्च मोहितः । जगाम स महाकायः समुद्रं सरितां पतिम् ।।
data.es: 'Wicked Dundubhi of huge body was proud of his valour and deluded by virtue of the boons, went to the ocean, the lord of rivers.

data.v: ऊर्मिमन्तमतिक्रम्य सागरं रत्नसंचयम् । मम युद्धं प्रयच्छेति तमुवाच महार्णवम् ।।
data.es: 'Reaching the mighty ocean, he implored the sea with (high) waves and hoards of gems for a fight.

data.v: ततः समुद्रो धर्मात्मा समुत्थाय महाबलः । अब्रवीद्वचनं राजन्नसुरं कालचोदितम् ।।
data.es: 'O king, then the powerful and righteous king of the ocean came out and spoke to the demon (Dundubhi) who was driven to death by fate.'

data.v: समर्थो नास्मि ते दातुं युद्धं युद्धविशारद । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यस्ते युद्धं प्रदास्यति ।।
data.es: 'You are proficient in warfare. I am not competent enough to challenge you to a duel. But I will name the one who can.

data.v: शैलराजो महारण्ये तपस्विशरणं परम् । शंकरश्वशुरो नाम्ना हिमवानिति विश्रुतः ।।
data.es: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.

data.v: गुहा प्रस्रवणोपेतो बहुकन्दरनिर्झरः । स समर्थस्तव प्रीतिमतुलां कर्तुमाहवे ।।
data.es: 'Himavan, the supreme abode of ascetics is the fatherinlaw of Lord Siva. He is wellknown as king of mountains, who has, waterfalls, caves, caverns and great forests.He is competent to match your incomparable love for war.

data.v: तं भीतमिति विज्ञाय समुद्रमसुरोत्तमः । हिमवद्वनमागच्छच्छरश्चापादिव च्युतः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.

data.v: ततस्तस्य गिरेः श्वेता गजेन्द्रविपुलाः शिलाः । चिक्षेप बहुधा भूमौ दुन्दुभिर्विननाद च ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, the most powerful of demons, aware that the ocean is frightened of him went swiftly to Himavan like an arrow released from a bow. He raised many huge white cliffs of the size of great elephants to the ground and roared.

data.v: ततः श्वेताम्बुदाकारः सौम्यः प्रीतिकराकृतिः । हिमवानब्रवीद्वाक्यं स्व एव शिखरे स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Then the gentle Himavan of pleasing appearance stood in the form of a white cloud on the peak and spoke:

data.v: क्लेष्टुमर्हसि मां न त्वं दुन्दुभे धर्मवत्सल । रणकर्मस्वकुशलस्तपस्विशरणं ह्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi, it is not proper for you to trouble me, for I am devoted to righteousness. I am the resort of ascetics and not adept in warfare'.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा गिरिराजस्य धीमतः । उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:

data.v: यदि युद्धेऽसमर्थस्त्वं मद्भयाद्वा निरुद्यमः । तमाचक्ष्व प्रदद्यान्मे योऽद्य युद्धं युयुत्सतः ।।
data.es: 'If you are unable or unwilling to fight me out of fear, tell me who wants to challenge me to a duel.

data.v: हिमवानब्रवीद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वाक्यविशारदः । अनुक्तपूर्वं धर्मात्मा क्रोधात्तमसुरोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing such words, which no one had spoken earlier, righteous Himavan, skilful in conversation, flew into a rage and said to Dundubhi,the best of demons:

data.v: वाली नाम महाप्राज्ञः शक्रतुल्यपराक्रमः । अध्यास्ते वानरः श्रीमान्किष्किन्धामतुलप्रभाम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, son of Indra, is a wise, powerful and prosperous monkey. He resides at Kishkinda, a city of incomparable glory.

data.v: स समर्थो महाप्राज्ञस्तव युद्धविशारदः । द्वन्द्वयुद्धं महद्दातुं नमुचेरिव वासवः ।।
data.es: 'Vali is profoundly wise, an expert in warfare. He is capable of challenging you to a duel like Indra to Namuchi.

data.v: तं शीघ्रमभिगच्छ त्वं यदि युद्धमिहेच्छसि । स हि दुर्धर्षणो नित्यं शूरः समरकर्मणि ।।
data.es: 'If you wish to fight, go to him quickly.He is ever heroic and difficult to combat.

data.v: श्रुत्वा हिमवतो वाक्यं क्रोधाविष्टः स दुन्दुभिः । जगाम तां पुरीं तस्य किष्किन्धां वालिनस्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Having heard Himavan, Dundubhi, seized with anger, went to Kishkindha, the city of Vali.

data.v: धारयन्माहिषं रूपं तीक्ष्णशृङ्गो भयावहः । प्रावृषीव महामेघस्तोयपूर्णो नभस्तले ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.

data.v: ततस्तु द्वारमागम्य किष्किन्धाया महाबलः । ननर्द कम्पयन्भूमिं दुन्दुभिर्दुन्दुभिर्यथा ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Dundubhi assuming the form of a frightening buffalo with pointed horns looking like a huge, dark raincloud in the sky in monsoon marched to the entrance of Kishkinda and roared like a wardrum as if shaking the earth.

data.v: समीपजान्द्रुमान्भञ्जन्वसुधां दारयन्खुरैः । विषाणेनोल्लेखन्दर्पात्तद्द्वारं द्विरदो यथा ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi felled the trees nearby, rent the earth with its hoofs, scratched the entrance gate of the city as an elephant would do with its horns in arrogance.

data.v: अन्तःपुरगतो वाली श्रुत्वा शब्दममर्षणः । निष्पपात सह स्त्रीभिस्ताराभिरिव चन्द्रमाः ।।
data.es: 'Unable to tolerate the sound, Vali jumped out of the harem along with the women like the Moon with stars.

data.v: मितं व्यक्ताक्षरपदं तमुवाच स दुन्दुभिम् । हरीणामीश्वरो वाली सर्वेषां वनचारिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, king of the monkeys who roam the forest, saw Dundubhi and addressed, but briefly:
