data.v: किमर्थं नगरद्वारमिदं रुद्ध्वा विनर्दसि । दुन्दुभे विदितो मेऽसि रक्ष प्राणान्महाबल ।।
data.es: 'O Dundubhi why are you roaring, blocking the entrance of the city? I know you are powerful. Go and save your life.'

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्य धीमतः । उवाच दुन्दुभिर्वाक्यं क्रोधात्संरक्तलोचनः ।।
data.es: 'Dundubhi whose eyes turned red in anger when he heard the words of Vali ,the wise king of the monkeys, said:

data.v: न त्वं स्त्रीसंनिधौ वीर वचनं वक्तुमर्हसि । मम युद्धं प्रयच्छ त्वं ततो ज्ञास्यामि ते बलम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero speaking such words in the presence of women is not proper. Come to me for a combat and I will let you know your strength.

data.v: अथ वा धारयिष्यामि क्रोधमद्य निशामिमाम् । गृह्यतामुदयः स्वैरं कामभोगेषु वानर ।।
data.es: 'O monkey I will restrain my anger tonight and give you time for your indulgence in sensual pleasures till morning.

data.v: यो हि मत्तं प्रमत्तं वा सुप्तं वा रहितं भृशम् । हन्यात्स भ्रूणहा लोके त्वद्विधं मदमोहितम् ।।
data.es: 'Whoever kills a person, who is drunk or is heedless or is asleep or without weapons or stupified by lust in this world, is equal to a killer of a foetus in the womb.'

data.v: स प्रहस्याब्रवीन्मन्दं क्रोधात्तमसुरोत्तमम् । विसृज्य ताः स्त्रियः सर्वास्ताराप्रभृतिकास्तदा ।।
data.es: 'Then, Vali sent away Tara and all other women slowly and replied angrily to the foolish demon with a mischievous smile:

data.v: मत्तोऽयमिति मा मंस्था यद्यभीतोऽसि संयुगे । मदोऽयं संप्रहारेऽस्मिन्वीरपानं समर्थ्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Do not consider me drunken. This drink will serve as a warrior's drink in the combat. Be ready, if you are not afraid of a combat.'

data.v: तमेवमुक्त्वा संक्रुद्धो मालामुत्क्षिप्य काञ्चनीम् । पित्रा दत्तां महेन्द्रेण युद्धाय व्यवतिष्ठत ।।
data.es: 'Having addressed thus in a rage, Vali removed the golden garland gifted by Indra, his father, and stood ready for the combat.

data.v: विषाणयोर्गृहीत्वा तं दुन्दुभिं गिरिसंनिभम् । वाली व्यापातयां चक्रे ननर्द च महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: 'Vali, the elephantlike monkey then held the mountainlike Dundubhi by the horns and struck him down, roaring loudly.

data.v: युद्धे प्राणहरे तस्मिन्निष्पिष्टो दुन्दुभिस्तदा । श्रोत्राभ्यामथ रक्तं तु तस्य सुस्राव पात्यतः । पपात च महाकायः क्षितौ पञ्चत्वमागतः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: ररजभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसमत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरतर]

data.es: In the fight, Dundubhi fell down, with his strength, courage and prowess dwindled. Vali lifted his huge body and dashed it down on the ground. The body of Dundubhi dissolved into the five elements.

data.v: तं तोलयित्वा बाहुभ्यां गतसत्त्वमचेतनम् । चिक्षेप वेगवान्वाली वेगेनैकेन योजनम् ।।
data.es: 'Mighty Vali lifted on both shoulders the insensate body drained of life and hurled it speedily to a distance of a yojana.

data.v: तस्य वेगप्रविद्धस्य वक्त्रात्क्षतजबिन्दवः । प्रपेतुर्मारुतोत्क्षिप्ता मतङ्गस्याश्रमं प्रति ।।
data.es: 'Scattered by the wind, drops of blood fell at the hermitage of Matanga from the mouth of the deadbody flung.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा पतितांस्तत्र मुनिः शोणितविप्रुषः । उत्ससर्ज महाशापं क्षेप्तारं वालिनं प्रति । इह तेनाप्रवेष्टव्यं प्रविष्टस्य बधो भवेत् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: मसभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जतभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरनय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभर]

data.v: स महर्षिं समासाद्य याचते स्म कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'On hearing the monkeys, Vali went to the sage and begged forgiveness with folded hands.

data.v: ततः शापभयाद्भीत ऋश्यमूकं महागिरिम् । प्रवेष्टुं नेच्छति हरिर्द्रष्टुं वापि नरेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O Lord Rama because of the fear of the curse, Vali will not enter the great Rishyamuka mountain nor will he like to see it.

data.v: तस्याप्रवेशं ज्ञात्वाहमिदं राम महावनम् । विचरामि सहामात्यो विषादेन विवर्जितः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama aware of the prohibition of Vali from entering the place, I roam about this great forest accompanied by my ministers without any apprehension.

data.v: एषोऽस्थिनिचयस्तस्य दुन्दुभेः संप्रकाशते । वीर्योत्सेकान्निरस्तस्य गिरिकूटनिभो महान् ।।
data.es: 'Hurled with the pride of his(Vali's) prowess is this heap of bones of Dundubhi here, which shines like a huge mountain peak.

data.v: इमे च विपुलाः सालाः सप्त शाखावलम्बिनः । यत्रैकं घटते वाली निष्पत्रयितुमोजसा ।।
data.es: 'Look at these seven sturdy Sala trees with branches of one overlapping the other. Vali was able to remove all the leaves of one Sala tree with just one arrow.

data.v: एतदस्यासमं वीर्यं मया राम प्रकाशितम् । कथं तं वालिनं हन्तुं समरे शक्ष्यसे नृप ।।
data.es: 'O Rama Vali's strength and fame related by me is unequalled. O king how is it possible for you to kill him in a combat?'

data.v: यदि भिन्द्याद्भवान्सालानिमांस्त्वेकेषुणा ततः । जानीयां त्वां महाबाहो समर्थं वालिनो वधे ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । राघवो दुन्दुभेः कायं पादाङ्गुष्ठेन लीलया । तोलयित्वा महाबाहुश्चिक्षेप दशयोजनम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: रसमत], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरयय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यमनर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततम]

data.es: Rama,the mighty elder brother of Lakshmana, having said so to Sugriva in a pleasing manner, lifted the dried body of Dundubhi easily with his toe, shook it and flung it with ease to a distance of ten yojanas.

data.v: क्षिप्तं दृष्ट्वा ततः कायं सुग्रीवः पुनरब्रवीत् । लक्ष्मणस्याग्रतो राममिदं वचनमर्थवत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey was very pleased with Rama's words and said to him in front of Lakshmana:

data.v: आर्द्रः समांसप्रत्यग्रः क्षिप्तः कायः पुरा सखे । लघुः संप्रति निर्मांसस्तृणभूतश्च राघव । नात्र शक्यं बलं ज्ञातुं तव वा तस्य वाधिकम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: तममम], अज्ञातम् [१२: यभतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: सरसय], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरभत]

data.es: 'O friend, when Vali my brother flung the body, he was tired and intoxicated and the body was fresh with flesh (meaning heavy), but now, O Delight of the Raghu race, it is fleshless and light like a bunch of (dry) grass (for) which you could throw it playfully.

data.v: एतच्च वचनं श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवेण सुभाषितम् । प्रत्ययार्थं महातेजा रामो जग्राह कार्मुकम् ।।
data.es: Having heard Sugriva's pleasing words, the brilliant Rama took up the bow in order to inspire confidence in Sugriva.

data.v: स गृहीत्वा धनुर्घोरं शरमेकं च मानदः । सालानुद्दिश्य चिक्षेप ज्यास्वनैः पूरयन्दिशः ।।
data.es: Rama, subduer of the enemy's pride, strung his terrific bow, produced the twang that filled all directions, and discharged a single arrow aimed at the sala tree.

data.v: स विसृष्टो बलवता बाणः स्वर्णपरिष्कृतः । भित्त्वा सालान्गिरिप्रस्थे सप्त भूमिं विवेश ह ।।
data.es: Released with great force, Rama's arrow embellished with gold pierced through the seven sala trees and splitting the mountain terrain entered the earth.

data.v: प्रविष्टस्तु मुहूर्तेन रसां भित्त्वा महाजवः । निष्पत्य च पुनस्तूर्णं स्वतूणीं प्रविवेश ह ।।
data.es: In a moment the arrow emerged from the earth which it pierced and reentered the quiver with great speed.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा सप्त निर्भिन्नान्सालान्वानरपुंगवः । रामस्य शरवेगेन विस्मयं परमं गतः ।।
data.es: The chief of the monkeys was struck with wonder seeing Rama's arrow piercing through the seven sala trees so swiftly.

data.v: स मूर्ध्ना न्यपतद्भूमौ प्रलम्बीकृतभूषणः । सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो राघवाय कृताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: Sugriva was immensely happy and offered obeisance to Rama with folded hands and bowed down and prostrated while his ornaments touched the ground.

data.v: इदं चोवाच धर्मज्ञं कर्मणा तेन हर्षितः । रामं सर्वास्त्रविदुषां श्रेष्ठं शूरमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva who stood by, elated to watch the deed of Rama, best among the valiant, proficient in the use of arms of all kinds and knower of dharma, said:

data.v: सेन्द्रानपि सुरान्सर्वांस्त्वं बाणैः पुरुषर्षभ । समर्थः समरे हन्तुं किं पुनर्वालिनं प्रभो ।।
data.es: 'O bull among men, O lord, you are capable of killing with your arrows even the gods including Indra in the battle, what to speak of Vali.

data.v: येन सप्त महासाला गिरिर्भूमिश्च दारिताः । बाणेनैकेन काकुत्स्थ स्थाता ते को रणाग्रतः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama who can in a battle confront you, capable of splitting seven huge sala trees, the mountain and the earth with a single arrow?

data.v: अद्य मे विगतः शोकः प्रीतिरद्य परा मम । सुहृदं त्वां समासाद्य महेन्द्रवरुणोपमम् ।।
data.es: 'Having found a friend in you comparable to Indra and Varuna, my grief is gone and I am so happy now.

data.v: तमद्यैव प्रियार्थं मे वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम् । वालिनं जहि काकुत्स्थ मया बद्धोऽयमञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, for my pleasure kill Vali who is, to me, an enemy in the guise of a brother. I fold my hands to you.

data.v: ततो रामः परिष्वज्य सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम् । प्रत्युवाच महाप्राज्ञो लक्ष्मणानुमतं वचः ।।
data.es: Then wise Rama embraced handsome Sugriva and replied in these words which were agreeable to Lakshmana:

data.v: अस्माद्गच्छाम किष्किन्धां क्षिप्रं गच्छ त्वमग्रतः । गत्वा चाह्वय सुग्रीव वालिनं भ्रातृगन्धिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'

data.v: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम् । वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने ।।
data.es: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.

data.v: सुग्रीवो व्यनदद्घोरं वालिनो ह्वानकारणात् । गाढं परिहितो वेगान्नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed for Vali.

data.v: तं श्रुत्वा निनदं भ्रातुः क्रुद्धो वाली महाबलः । निष्पपात सुसंरब्धो भास्करोऽस्ततटादिव ।।
data.es: On hearing his brother roaring, powerful Vali was enraged and rushed like the Sun from behind the western shore of the ocean (this simile suggests the downfall of Vali).

data.v: ततः सुतुमुलं युद्धं वालिसुग्रीवयोरभूत् । गगने ग्रहयोर्घोरं बुधाङ्गारकयोरिव ।।
data.es: Then a tumultuous combat took place between Vali and Sugriva who looked like the planets Mercury and Mars.

data.v: तलैरशनिकल्पैश्च वज्रकल्पैश्च मुष्टिभिः । जघ्नतुः समरेऽन्योन्यं भ्रातरौ क्रोधमूर्छितौ ।।
data.es: The brothers, insensate with fury, struck each other like thunder with their palms, soles and fists in the combat.

data.v: ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिस्तावुभौ समुदीक्ष्य तु । अन्योन्यसदृशौ वीरावुभौ देवाविवाश्विनौ ।।
data.es: Bow in hand, Rama watched both the heroes who resembled the twin Aswini Kumaras.

data.v: यन्नावगच्छत्सुग्रीवं वालिनं वापि राघवः । ततो न कृतवान्बुद्धिं मोक्तुमन्तकरं शरम् ।।
data.es: Since Rama was not able to distinguish between Vali and Sugriva, he could not decide whether he should discharge his deadly arrow .

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे भग्नः सुग्रीवस्तेन वालिना । अपश्यन्राघवं नाथमृश्यमूकं प्रदुद्रुवे ।।
data.es: Discomfited by Vali, and not seeing Rama around, Sugriva ran towards Rishyamuka mountain.

data.v: क्लान्तो रुधिरसिक्ताङ्गः प्रहारैर्जर्जरीकृतः । वालिनाभिद्रुतः क्रोधात्प्रविवेश महावनम् ।।
data.es: Exhausted, disfigured and body mauled and drenched in blood all over, Sugriva, chased by the infuriated Vali, entered the region of great sage Matanga.

data.v: तं प्रविष्टं वनं दृष्ट्वा वाली शापभयात्ततः । मुक्तो ह्यसि त्वमित्युक्त्वा स निवृत्तो महाबलः ।।
data.es: Effulgent Vali saw Sugriva entering the (prohibited) grove and turned back due to the fear of the curse (of sage Matanga) saying, 'You have escaped'.

data.v: राघवोऽपि सह भ्रात्रा सह चैव हनूमता । तदेव वनमागच्छत्सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः ।।
data.es: Rama together with Lakshmana and Hanuman also arrived at the same gave where Sugriva was.

data.v: तं समीक्ष्यागतं रामं सुग्रीवः सहलक्ष्मणम् । ह्रीमान्दीनमुवाचेदं वसुधामवलोकयन् ।।
data.es: At the sight of Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, Sugriva felt ashmed and aggrieved, and looking down on the ground, said:

data.v: आह्वयस्वेति मामुक्त्वा दर्शयित्वा च विक्रमम् । वैरिणा घातयित्वा च किमिदानीं त्वया कृतम् ।।
data.es: 'You demonstrated your prowess and directed me to challenge Vali and then why did you make the enemy hit me thus?

data.v: तामेव वेलां वक्तव्यं त्वया राघव तत्त्वतः । वालिनं न निहन्मीति ततो नाहमितो व्रजे ।।
data.es: 'Had you, in fact, told me that you were not going to kill Vali, I would not have budged from this place.'

data.v: तस्य चैवं ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । करुणं दीनया वाचा राघवः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:

data.v: सुग्रीव श्रूयतां तातः क्रोधश्च व्यपनीयताम् । कारणं येन बाणोऽयं न मया स विसर्जितः ।।
data.es: 'O dear Sugriva dispel your anger and listen to me why I had not released the arrow.

data.v: अलंकारेण वेषेण प्रमाणेन गतेन च । त्वं च सुग्रीव वाली च सदृशौ स्थः परस्परम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva in form, ornaments and movements there is perfect resemblance between you and Vali.

data.v: स्वरेण वर्चसा चैव प्रेक्षितेन च वानर । विक्रमेण च वाक्यैश्च व्यक्तिं वां नोपलक्षये ।।
data.es: 'O monkey in your voice, in brightness, in looks, in valour or in words I have marked no difference between you.

data.v: ततोऽहं रूपसादृश्यान्मोहितो वानरोत्तम । नोत्सृजामि महावेगं शरं शत्रुनिबर्हणम् ।।
data.es: 'O distinguished monkey you both are so similar in form that I was puzzled and did not release my swift arrow that could have destroyed the enemy.

data.v: एतन्मुहूर्ते तु मया पश्य वालिनमाहवे । निरस्तमिषुणैकेन वेष्टमानं महीतले ।।
data.es: 'Therefore, O monkey, go and engage yourself in fight again. Do not suspect me. With this single arrow of mine, in one moment you will see Vali thrown down and rolling on the ground in this combat.

data.v: अभिज्ञानं कुरुष्व त्वमात्मनो वानरेश्वर । येन त्वामभिजानीयां द्वन्द्वयुद्धमुपागतम् ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys while you both are engaged in a duel wear some identification mark by which I can recognise you.

data.v: गजपुष्पीमिमां फुल्लामुत्पाट्य शुभलक्षणाम् । कुरु लक्ष्मण कण्ठेऽस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana this Gajapushpi in bloom is auspicious. Pluck and fasten it on great Sugriva's neck.'

data.v: ततो गिरितटे जातामुत्पाट्य कुसुमायुताम् । लक्ष्मणो गजपुष्पीं तां तस्य कण्ठे व्यसर्जयत् ।।
data.es: Then Lakshmana went to the mountain slope, plucked the (creeper with) gajapuspi blossoms and fastened it on the neck of Sugriva.

data.v: स तथा शुशुभे श्रीमाँल्लतया कण्ठसक्तया । मालयेव बलाकानां ससंध्य इव तोयदः ।।
data.es: With the creeper round the neck, Sugriva looked like the raincloud at twilight, adorned by a row of cranes like a garland.

data.v: विभ्राजमानो वपुषा रामवाक्यसमाहितः । जगाम सह रामेण किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् ।।
data.es: Radiant Sugriva intent on carrying out Rama's words again went to Kishkinda ruled by Vali.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकात्स धर्मात्मा किष्किन्धां लक्ष्मणाग्रजः । जगाम सहसुग्रीवो वालिविक्रमपालिताम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, get ready at once. We will promptly proceed to Kishkinda from here. Go ahead and challenge Vali, your brother only in name, to a combat.'

data.v: समुद्यम्य महच्चापं रामः काञ्चनभूषितम् । शरांश्चादित्य संकाशान्गृहीत्वा रणसाधकान् ।।
data.es: Getting ready to go, Rama took up his great bow and arrows adorned with gold and potent in war looking (dazzling) like the Sun.

data.v: अग्रतस्तु ययौ तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः । सुग्रीवः संहतग्रीवो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः ।।
data.es: The strongnecked Sugriva and mighty Lakshmana walked in front of the highsouled Rama.

data.v: पृष्ठतो हनुमान्वीरो नलो नीलश्च वानरः । तारश्चैव महातेजा हरियूथप यूथपाः ।।
data.es: Brave and brilliant Hanuman, Nala, Nila, and Tara among the leaders of the monkeys walked behind.

data.v: ते वीक्षमाणा वृक्षांश्च पुष्पभारावलम्बिनः । प्रसन्नाम्बुवहाश्चैव सरितः सागरं गमाः ।।
data.es: They saw (on the way) trees bent down with the load of flowers, and rivers with pure water flowing into the sea.

data.v: कन्दराणि च शैलांश्च निर्झराणि गुहास्तथा । शिखराणि च मुख्यानि दरीश्च प्रियदर्शनाः ।।
data.es: (They saw) beautiful valleys, mountains, caves, prominent peaks with deep caverns.

data.v: वैदूर्यविमलैः पर्णैः पद्मैश्चाकाशकुड्मलैः । शोभितान्सजलान्मार्गे तटाकांश्च व्यलोकयन् ।।
data.es: Observing on the way delightful lotus buds with leaves like Vaidurya, clear water and full tanks (They moved on).

data.v: कारण्डैः सारसैर्हंसैर्वञ्जूलैर्जलकुक्कुटैः । चक्रवाकैस्तथा चान्यैः शकुनैः प्रतिनादितान् ।।
data.es: Ducks, cranes, swans, vanjulas, waterfowls, chakravakas and other birds warbling melodiously.

data.v: मृदुशष्पाङ्कुराहारान्निर्भयान्वनगोचरान् । चरतः सर्वतोऽपश्यन्स्थलीषु हरिणान्स्थितान् ।।
data.es: They observed deer feeding on tender grass on the ground around without fear, some standing and some roaming the forest

data.v: तटाकवैरिणश्चापि शुक्लदन्तविभूषितान् । घोरानेकचरान्वन्यान्द्विरदान्कूलघातिनः ।।
data.es: Observing terrific elephants adorned with white tusks wandering alone destroying the tanks, shattering the banks.

data.v: वने वनचरांश्चान्यान्खेचरांश्च विहंगमान् । पश्यन्तस्त्वरिता जग्मुः सुग्रीववशवर्तिनः ।।
data.es: Following Sugriva faithfully, they proceeded swiftly, observing animals of the forest and birds flying in the sky.

data.v: तेषां तु गच्छतां तत्र त्वरितं रघुनन्दनः । द्रुमषण्डं वनं दृष्ट्वा रामः सुग्रीवमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While walking fast, looking at the forest full of trees Rama, the delight of the Raghus said to Sugriva:

data.v: एष मेघ इवाकाशे वृक्षषण्डः प्रकाशते । मेघसंघातविपुलः पर्यन्तकदलीवृतः ।।
data.es: 'This cluster of trees surrounded by plantain groves look splendid like a vast collection of clouds in the sky.

data.v: किमेतज्ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सखे कौतूहलं मम । कौतूहलापनयनं कर्तुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वया ।।
data.es: 'O friend I wish to know what this is? Could you answer my curiosity?'

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मनः । गच्छन्नेवाचचक्षेऽथ सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वनम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).

data.v: एतद्राघव विस्तीर्णमाश्रमं श्रमनाशनम् । उद्यानवनसंपन्नं स्वादुमूलफलोदकम् ।।
data.es: 'O Raghava this is a hermitage, enchanting with vast gardens and trees bearing sweet fruits, full of tasty roots and water that relieves tiresomeness (of travellers).

data.v: अत्र सप्तजना नाम मुनयः संशितव्रताः । सप्तैवासन्नधःशीर्षा नियतं जलशायिनः ।।
सप्तरात्रकृताहारा वायुना वनवासिनः । दिवं वर्षशतैर्याताः सप्तभिः सकलेवराः ।।
data.es: 'These seven sages used to live on air and that too once in seven nights. They lived for seven hundred years performing penance with motionlessness and attained heaven along with their bodies.

data.v: तेषामेवं प्रभावेन द्रुमप्राकारसंवृतम् । आश्रमं सुदुराधर्षमपि सेन्द्रैः सुरासुरैः ।।
data.es: 'By virtue of the power of their penance, this hermitage surrounded by a row of trees is impenetrable even for demons and gods including Indra.

data.v: पक्षिणो वर्जयन्त्येतत्तथान्ये वनचारिणः । विशन्ति मोहाद्येऽप्यत्र निवर्तन्ते न ते पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Birds and wild animals avoid the hermitage and whoever enters there out of ignorance never returns.

data.v: विभूषणरवाश्चात्र श्रूयन्ते सकलाक्षराः । तूर्यगीतस्वनाश्चापि गन्धो दिव्यश्च राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, one can hear pleasant sounds of jingling ornaments (of nymphs), of songs and windinstruments here. One can inhale divine fragrance, too.

data.v: त्रेताग्नयोऽपि दीप्यन्ते धूमो ह्येष प्रदृश्यते । वेष्टयन्निव वृक्षाग्रान्कपोताङ्गारुणो घनः ।।
data.es: 'The three sacred fires keep burning and the thick smoke they emit resembles the red feet of pigeons. It shines forth as if enveloping the treetops.

data.v: कुरु प्रणामं धर्मात्मंस्तान्समुद्दिश्य राघवः । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा प्रयतः संयताञ्जलिः ।।
data.es: 'O rigteous Rama you and your brother Lakshmana humbly offer obeisance to them(sacred hermitage and sages Saptajana) with folded hands and meditate on them.

data.v: प्रणमन्ति हि ये तेषामृषीणां भावितात्मनाम् । न तेषामशुभं किंचिच्छरीरे राम दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'O Rama, nothing inauspicious happens to them who offer obeisance to those highly spiritual sacred sages.'

data.v: ततो रामः सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन कृताञ्जलिः । समुद्दिश्य महात्मानस्तानृषीनभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Rama and Lakshmana offered salutations with folded hands in memory of those great sages, great souls.

data.v: अभिवाद्य च धर्मात्मा रामो भ्राता च लक्ष्मणः । सुग्रीवो वानराश्चैव जग्मुः संहृष्टमानसाः ।।
data.es: Righteous Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva and all the monkeys offered obeisance and proceeded delighted at heart.

data.v: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं तस्मात्सप्तजनाश्रमात् । ददृशुस्तां दुराधर्षां किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् ।।
data.es: Walking a long distance from the hermitage of the seven seers, they beheld the unassailable Kishkinda ruled by Vali.

data.v: सर्वे ते त्वरितं गत्वा किष्किन्धां वालिपालिताम् । वृक्षैरात्मानमावृत्य व्यतिष्ठन्गहने वने ।।
data.es: Thay all rushed to Kishkinda, the capital of Vali and waited in the thick forest behind the trees.

data.v: विचार्य सर्वतो दृष्टिं कानने काननप्रियः । सुग्रीवो विपुलग्रीवः क्रोधमाहारयद्भृशम् ।।
data.es: Broadnecked Sugriva, a lover of the forest, looked around and flew into a rage.

data.v: ततः स निनदं घोरं कृत्वा युद्धाय चाह्वयत् । परिवारैः परिवृतो नादैर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva tightened up his waist cloth hurriedly and roared terrifically as though piercing the sky. And screamed for Vali.

data.v: अथ बालार्कसदृशो दृप्तसिंहगतिस्तदा । दृष्ट्वा रामं क्रियादक्षं सुग्रीवो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, proficient in the performance of any task, one who appeared like the rising Sun and moved like a proud lion, said to Rama:

data.v: हरिवागुरया व्याप्तं तप्तकाञ्चनतोरणाम् । प्राप्ताः स्म ध्वजयन्त्राढ्यां किष्किन्धां वालिनः पुरीम् ।।
data.es: 'We have arrived at Kishkinda, the capital of Vali, decorated with flags and having a glittering golden archway that can be opened mechanically. Teeming with monkeys, it looks like a snare to catch the enemy.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञा या त्वया वीर कृता वालिवधे पुरा । सफलां तां कुरु क्षिप्रं लतां काल इवागतः ।।
data.es: 'O heroic Rama fulfil quickly the vow taken by you earlier to kill Vali in the same way a creeper bears fruit when the time comes.'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा सुग्रीवेण स राघवः । तमथोवाच सुग्रीवं वचनं शत्रुसूदनः ।।
data.es: Requested thus by Sugriva, righteous Rama, the destroyer of enemies, replied:.

data.v: कृताभिज्ञान चिह्नस्त्वमनया गजसाह्वया । विपरीत इवाकाशे सूर्यो नक्षत्र मालया ।।
data.es: 'Lakshmana has uprooted a creeper of gaja, and fastened it on your neck by which you can be easily identified.

data.v: अद्य वालिसमुत्थं ते भयं वैरं च वानर । एकेनाहं प्रमोक्ष्यामि बाणमोक्षेण संयुगे ।।
data.es: 'O monkey, with the release of a single arrow in the combat, I shall dispel your fear and enmity (hatred) for Vali.

data.v: मम दर्शय सुग्रीववैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम् । वाली विनिहतो यावद्वने पांसुषु वेष्टते ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva show me your enemy,who is in the guise of your brother.He will be killed. He will roll down in the dust of the forest.

data.v: यदि दृष्टिपथं प्राप्तो जीवन्स विनिवर्तते । ततो दोषेण मा गच्छेत्सद्यो गर्हेच्च मा भवान् ।।
data.es: 'If Vali appears before me I will not let him go with life.Then you will not blame me and find fault with me.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं सप्त ते साला मया बाणेन दारिताः । ततो वेत्सि बलेनाद्य बालिनं निहतं मया ।।
data.es: 'You have seen how I have pierced through seven sala trees with a single arrow. You will know how with the same strength I will kill Vali.'

data.v: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे वीर कृच्छ्रेऽपि तिष्ठता । धर्मलोभपरीतेन न च वक्ष्ये कथंचन ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, I have uttered no falsehood before for fear of deviation from righteousness although I was in distress, nor shall I utter any falsehood in any circumstances hereafter.

data.v: सफलां च करिष्यामि प्रतिज्ञां जहि संभ्रमम् । प्रसूतं कलमं क्षेत्रे वर्षेणेव शतक्रतुः ।।
data.es: 'I shall fulfil my promise just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) helps production in the cornfield through timely rain. Give up your apprehension.

data.v: तदाह्वाननिमित्तं त्वं वालिनो हेममालिनः । सुग्रीव कुरु तं शब्दं निष्पतेद्येन वानरः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva give a warcry so that Vali adorned with a golden garland will come out.

data.v: जितकाशी जयश्लाघी त्वया चाधर्षितः पुरात् । निष्पतिष्यत्यसंगेन वाली स प्रियसंयुगः ।।
data.es: 'Vali, who is proud of his valour, is strong, fearless and fond of combat, will rush out of the city in response to your challenge.

data.v: रिपूणां धर्षणं शूरा मर्षयन्ति न संयुगे । जानन्तस्तु स्वकं वीर्यं स्त्रीसमक्षं विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'Proud of their own prowess, heroes will not brook the challenge of foes in battle, specially in the presence of women.'

data.v: स तु रामवचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो हेमपिङ्गलः । ननर्द क्रूरनादेन विनिर्भिन्दन्निवाम्बरम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's words, the goldenhued Sugriva roared in a fierce voice as if it would piece the sky.

data.v: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्ता गावो यान्ति हतप्रभाः । राजदोषपरामृष्टाः कुलस्त्रिय इवाकुलाः ।।
data.es: Alarmed at the yelling of Sugriva, the cows began to run in all directions, like the women of noble pedigree who, with their brightness lost, run perplexed for failure of the king to protect their chastity.

data.v: द्रवन्ति च मृगाः शीघ्रं भग्ना इव रणे हयाः । पतन्ति च खगा भूमौ क्षीणपुण्या इव ग्रहाः ।।
data.es: The deer were unable to run like wounded horses in a battle. Birds fell down on the ground like planets fall when their merit is exhausted.

data.v: ततः स जीमूतगणप्रणादो; नादं व्यमुञ्चत्त्वरया प्रतीतः । सूर्यात्मजः शौर्यविवृद्धतेजाः; सरित्पतिर्वानिलचञ्चलोर्मिः ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva, son of the Sungod, with his lustre enhanced by his valour moved swiftly. His roar resembled the rumbling of a cluster of thundering clouds. He gave a warcry the tone of which resembled the sounds of waves lashed by high velocity winds in the sea.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अथ तस्य निनादं तं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । शुश्रावान्तःपुरगतो वाली भ्रातुरमर्षणः ।।
data.es: The indignant Vali, who was in the harem, heard the roaring of his venerable brother, Sugriva.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु तस्य निनदं सर्वभूतप्रकम्पनम् । मदश्चैकपदे नष्टः क्रोधश्चापतितो महान् ।।
data.es: The roar (of Sugriva) that frightened all beings gave Vali's vanity a jolt and at once aroused in him violent rage.

data.v: स तु रोषपरीताङ्गो वाली संध्यातपप्रभः । उपरक्त इवादित्यः सद्यो निष्प्रभतां गतः ।।
data.es: Overcome with anger, Vali looked pale like the eclipsed Sun with the golden radiance faded from his face.

data.v: वाली दंष्ट्रा करालस्तु क्रोधाद्दीप्ताग्निसंनिभः । भात्युत्पतितपद्माभः समृणाल इव ह्रदः ।।
data.es: Vali, who looked fierce with his teeth and whose eyes shone like a flaming fire through anger looked like a pond with the lotuses and their stalks uprooted.

data.v: शब्दं दुर्मर्षणं श्रुत्वा निष्पपात ततो हरिः । वेगेन चरणन्यासैर्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: Unable to tolerate Sugriva's roar, Vali stepped out hurriedly, taking long strides as if breaking the earth.

data.v: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य स्नेहाद्दर्शितसौहृदा । उवाच त्रस्तसंभ्रान्ता हितोदर्कमिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Tara, perplexed out of fear, glanced at Vali lovingly, embraced him and gave him wise counsel:

data.v: साधु क्रोधमिमं वीर नदी वेगमिवागतम् । शयनादुत्थितः काल्यं त्यज भुक्तामिव स्रजम् ।।
data.es: 'O valiant Vali anger has overtaken you like the flood of a river. It is natural for you to be angry at this time, but shake off your anger just as the wise discard a flower garland already used up.

data.v: सहसा तव निष्क्रामो मम तावन्न रोचते । श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं निवार्यसे ।।
data.es: 'I do not like your rashness. I will explain the reason I am preventing you. Listen:

data.v: पूर्वमापतितः क्रोधात्स त्वामाह्वयते युधि । निष्पत्य च निरस्तस्ते हन्यमानो दिशो गतः ।।
data.es: 'Earlier, he (Sugriva) came and challenged you to a duel. You struck him in anger, and defeated, he fled, running in all directions. Now his challenge rouses my suspicion.

data.v: त्वया तस्य निरस्तस्य पीडितस्य विशेषतः । इहैत्य पुनराह्वानं शङ्कां जनयतीव मे ।।
data.es: 'One who is defeated and badly mauled by you is again coming and inviting you to a duel in this manner arouses suspicion in me.

data.v: दर्पश्च व्यवसायश्च यादृशस्तस्य नर्दतः । निनादस्य च संरम्भो नैतदल्पं हि कारणम् ।।
data.es: 'His determination, his insolence, his roaring, his arroganceall this cannot be for a small reason.

data.v: नासहायमहं मन्ये सुग्रीवं तमिहागतम् । अवष्टब्धसहायश्च यमाश्रित्यैष गर्जति ।।
data.es: 'Certainly Sugriva has not come here to give a warcry without any external help. The person whose refuge he has sought is not a small one.

data.v: प्रकृत्या निपुणश्चैव बुद्धिमांश्चैव वानरः । अपरीक्षितवीर्येण सुग्रीवः सह नैष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva is clever by nature. He is wise. Without assessing the ability of the ally he will not enter into friendship.

data.v: पूर्वमेव मया वीर श्रुतं कथयतो वचः । अङ्गदस्य कुमारस्य वक्ष्यामि त्वा हितं वचः ।।
data.es: 'O hero I have heard the news earlier from our son Angada. I will tell you what he had heard and what he has said to me:

data.v: तव भ्रातुर्हि विख्यातः सहायो रणकर्कशः । रामः परबलामर्दी युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Rama, famous for crushing foes in war, like the fire that breaks out at the dissolution of the world, has slain strong enemies like Khara and will help your brother.

data.v: निवासवृक्षः साधूनामापन्नानां परा गतिः । आर्तानां संश्रयश्चैव यशसश्चैकभाजनम् ।।
data.es: 'He is like a sheltering tree to the virtuous, an ultimate refuge for the destitutes and a protector of the distressed. He is the sole repository of fame.

data.v: ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नो निदेशो निरतः पितुः । धातूनामिव शैलेन्द्रो गुणानामाकरो महान् ।।
data.es: 'He is endowed with the knowledge of science and scriptures. He stood by his father's command. He is like a mine of virtues just as the lord of the mountain is a mine of minerals.

data.v: तत्क्षमं न विरोधस्ते सह तेन महात्मना । दुर्जयेनाप्रमेयेन रामेण रणकर्मसु ।।
data.es: 'Rama is immeasurable in prowess and unconquerable in war. Therefore, enmity with him is not desirable for you.

data.v: शूर वक्ष्यामि ते किंचिन्न चेच्छाम्यभ्यसूयितुम् । श्रूयतां क्रियतां चैव तव वक्ष्यामि यद्धितम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero, this I tell you not because I dislike you, but because I wish your welfare. Listen, and do as I say

data.v: यौवराज्येन सुग्रीवं तूर्णं साध्वभिषेचय । विग्रहं मा कृथा वीर भ्रात्रा राजन्बलीयसा ।।
data.es: 'O king O hero consecrate your brother Sugriva as prince at once. Do not create enmity with him.

data.v: अहं हि ते क्षमं मन्ये तव रामेण सौहृदम् । सुग्रीवेण च संप्रीतिं वैरमुत्सृज्य दूरतः ।।
data.es: 'Leave enmity with Sugriva far behind. Make friendship with Rama. I think it is the right thing for you.

data.v: लालनीयो हि ते भ्राता यवीयानेष वानरः । तत्र वा सन्निहस्थो वा सर्वथा बन्धुरेव ते ।।
data.es: 'This monkey is your younger brother and, therefore, deserves your protection. Whether he is here or there, he is your brother.

data.v: यदि ते मत्प्रियं कार्यं यदि चावैषि मां हिताम् । याच्यमानः प्रयत्नेन साधु वाक्यं कुरुष्व मे ।।
data.es: 'Pray, do me this favour. Treat me as your wellwisher. Heed my advice given with care.

data.v: तामेवं ब्रुवतीं तारां ताराधिपनिभाननाम् । वाली निर्भर्त्सयामास वचनं चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: To these words of Tara with her Moonlike face, Vali replied reproachfully:

data.v: गर्जतोऽस्य च संरम्भं भ्रातुः शत्रोर्विशेषतः । मर्षयिष्याम्यहं केन कारणेन वरानने ।।
data.es: 'O lady with a charming face why should I tolerate the enemy (Sugriva) who is none other than my own younger brother, especially when he roars excitedly?

data.v: अधर्षितानां शूराणां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम् । धर्षणामर्षणं भीरु मरणादतिरिच्यते ।।
data.es: O timid lady to swallow insult (without facing the opponent) is worse than death for indomitable heroes (like me) who know no retreat in a battle.

data.v: सोढुं न च समर्थोऽहं युद्धकामस्य संयुगे । सुग्रीवस्य च संरम्भं हीनग्रीवस्य गर्जतः ।।
data.es: 'When the weaknecked Sugriva roars eager to join a duel it is not right on my part to tolerate his arrogance,much less his warcry.

data.v: न च कार्यो विषादस्ते राघवं प्रति मत्कृते । धर्मज्ञश्च कृतज्ञश्च कथं पापं करिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'You need not be concerned about me on account of Rama. How can one who knows dharma and who has a sense of gratitude commit sin?

data.v: निवर्तस्व सह स्त्रीभिः कथं भूयोऽनुगच्छसि । सौहृदं दर्शितं तारे मयि भक्तिः कृता त्वया ।।
data.es: 'Go back with all the women of the harem. Why do you follow me again? Your devotion towards me is evident from the sincere concern expressed by you.

data.v: प्रतियोत्स्याम्यहं गत्वा सुग्रीवं जहि संभ्रमम् । दर्पं चास्य विनेष्यामि न च प्राणैर्विमोक्ष्यते ।।
data.es: 'I shall accept the challenge and fight with Sugriva. Give up your anxiety. I will destroy his pride, not his life.

data.v: शापितासि मम प्राणैर्निवर्तस्व जयेन च । अहं जित्वा निवर्तिष्ये तमलं भ्रातरं रणे ।।
data.es: 'I make a vow even on my life and my victory. Pray return with the retinue. I will be back only after winning the encounter with my brother.

data.v: तं तु तारा परिष्वज्य वालिनं प्रियवादिनी । चकार रुदती मन्दं दक्षिणा सा प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: Pleasing in her words, Tara then embraced Vali and sobbing, circumambulated Vali in compliance (to his advice).

data.v: ततः स्वस्त्ययनं कृत्वा मन्त्रवद्विजयैषिणी । अन्तःपुरं सह स्त्रीभिः प्रविष्टा शोकमोहिता ।।
data.es: The wise counsellor, Tara bade him farewell, wishing him victory and then, overwhelmed with sorrow, entered the inner apartment followed by the womenfolk.

data.v: प्रविष्टायां तु तारायां सह स्त्रीभिः स्वमालयम् । नगरान्निर्ययौ क्रुद्धो महासर्प इव श्वसन् ।।
data.es: After Tara and other women returned to their abode, Vali departed from the city, hissing like a huge angry cobra.

data.v: स निःश्वस्य महावेगो वाली परमरोषणः । सर्वतश्चारयन्दृष्टिं शत्रुदर्शनकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: The mighty Vali, breathing heavily, looked around to find where his enemy was.

data.v: स ददर्श ततः श्रीमान्सुग्रीवं हेमपिङ्गलम् । सुसंवीतमवष्टब्धं दीप्यमानमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: There Vali saw Sugriva in lustrous, red gold complexion standing ready for a combat steady like glowing fire.

data.v: स तं दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यं सुग्रीवं पर्यवस्थितम् । गाढं परिदधे वासो वाली परमरोषणः ।।
data.es: On seeing the great hero Sugriva standing firmly, the enraged Vali tied his upper cloth (around his loin) tightly.

data.v: स वाली गाढसंवीतो मुष्टिमुद्यम्य वीर्यवान् । सुग्रीवमेवाभिमुखो ययौ योद्धुं कृतक्षणः ।।
data.es: Vali tied up his cloth tightly, raised his fist and advanced towards Sugriva, ready for the encounter.

data.v: श्लिष्टमुष्टिं समुद्यम्य संरब्धतरमागतः । सुग्रीवोऽपि समुद्दिश्य वालिनं हेममालिनम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva also lifted his fist firmly and advanced more impatiently towards Vali adorned with a golden necklace.

data.v: तं वाली क्रोधताम्राक्षः सुग्रीवं रणपण्डितम् । आपतन्तं महावेगमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: While Sugriva, expert in combat, advanced swiftly to pounce upon (his enemy), Vali whose eyes turned red in anger said:

data.v: एष मुष्टिर्मया बद्धो गाढः सुनिहिताङ्गुलिः । मया वेगविमुक्तस्ते प्राणानादाय यास्यति ।।
एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवः क्रुद्धो वालिनमब्रवीत् । तवैव च हरन्प्राणान्मुष्टिः पततु मूर्धनि ।।
data.es: This infuriated Sugriva who, looking at Vali, said 'This fist of mine will draw your life out, hitting your forehead'.

data.v: ताडितस्तेन संक्रुद्धः समभिक्रम्य वेगतः । अभवच्छोणितोद्गारी सोत्पीड इव पर्वतः ।।
data.es: Struck by Vali, enraged Sugriva encountered Vali more aggresively. His body drenched in blood seemed a mountain with rivulets of blood flowing.

data.v: सुग्रीवेण तु निःसंगं सालमुत्पाट्य तेजसा । गात्रेष्वभिहतो वाली वज्रेणेव महागिरिः ।।
data.es: With all his vigour, Sugriva uprooted a sala tree, pulled it out and struck Vali on the body, like a thunderbolt striking a huge mountain.

data.v: स तु वाली प्रचरितः सालताडनविह्वलः । गुरुभारसमाक्रान्ता सागरे नौरिवाभवत् ।।
data.es: Struck by the blows of the sala tree, Vali also lost his balance like the heavily loaded ship of a trader shaken up in the ocean.

data.v: तौ भीमबलविक्रान्तौ सुपर्णसमवेगिनौ । प्रवृद्धौ घोरवपुषौ चन्द्रसूर्याविवाम्बरे ।।
data.es: Both of them endowed with terrible strength, fierce in appearance, and each seeking the weak points of the other advanced, as fast as Garuda, striking at the enemy. Their fight grew more and more fierce like the fight between Sun and Moon in the sky.

data.v: वालिना भग्नदर्पस्तु सुग्रीवो मन्दविक्रमः । वालिनं प्रति सामर्षो दर्शयामास लाघवम् ।।
data.es: With his strength waning and pride crushed, Sugriva, anguished, exhibited shrewdness.

data.v: ततो धनुषि संधाय शरमाशीविषोपमम् । राघवेण महाबाणो वालिवक्षसि पातितः ।।
data.es: Rama then fixed an arrow which resembled a venomous snake, on to his bow looking like the very deathwheel of Yama and stretched it fully.

data.v: वेगेनाभिहतो वाली निपपात महीतले ।।
data.es: Then the powerful monkey king Vali, who was proud of his might, fell down on earth, struck by the fast flying arrow.

data.v: अथोक्षितः शोणिततोयविस्रवैः; सुपुष्पिताशोक इवानिलोद्धतः । विचेतनो वासवसूनुराहवे; प्रभ्रंशितेन्द्रध्वजवत्क्षितिं गतः ।।
ततः शरेणाभिहतो रामेण रणकर्कशः । पपात सहसा वाली निकृत्त इव पादपः ।।
data.es: A tyrant in war, Vali struck by4.54.24 Rama's arrow, collapsed instantaneously like a tree felled down.

data.v: स भूमौ न्यस्तसर्वाङ्गस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणः । अपतद्देवराजस्य मुक्तरश्मिरिव ध्वजः ।।
data.es: Adorned with shining gold ornaments,Vali fell down with all his limbs touching the ground like Indra's flag when its ropes are loosened.

data.v: तस्मिन्निपतिते भूमौ हर्यृषाणां गणेश्वरे । नष्टचन्द्रमिव व्योम न व्यराजत भूतलम् ।।
data.es: When the lord of the monkey troops fell down, it was as though the earth lost its brightness like the sky loses its brightness devoid of the Moon.

data.v: भूमौ निपतितस्यापि तस्य देहं महात्मनः । न श्रीर्जहाति न प्राणा न तेजो न पराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Even though the highsouled Vali's body had fallen on the ground, its splendour, glow, life and valour had not left it.

data.v: शक्रदत्ता वरा माला काञ्चनी रत्नभूषिता । दधार हरिमुख्यस्य प्राणांस्तेजः श्रियं च सा ।।
data.es: As the most beautiful golden necklace, studded with diamonds, given by Indra was there on him, the life, brightness and splendour of Vali's body remained.

data.v: स तया मालया वीरो हैमया हरियूथपः । संध्यानुगतपर्यन्तः पयोधर इवाभवत् ।।
data.es: Vali, the chief hero of the monkeys, with his golden necklace appeared like the raincloud hallowed by the glowing twilight.

data.v: तस्य माला च देहश्च मर्मघाती च यः शरः । त्रिधेव रचिता लक्ष्मीः पतितस्यापि शोभते ।।
data.es: Even though he had fallen down, the effulgence of his necklace on his body, and the arrow pierced into his vital parts remained.

data.v: तदस्त्रं तस्य वीरस्य स्वर्गमार्गप्रभावनम् । रामबाणासनक्षिप्तमावहत्परमां गतिम् ।।
data.es: Rama's arrow released paved the way to heaven which was that hero's supreme destination.

data.v: तं तथा पतितं संख्ये गतार्चिषमिवानलम् । ययातिमिव पुण्यान्ते देवलोकात्परिच्युतम् ।।
आदित्यमिव कालेन युगान्ते भुवि पातितम् । महेन्द्रमिव दुर्धर्षं महेन्द्रमिव दुःसहम् ।।
महेन्द्रपुत्रं पतितं वालिनं हेममालिनम् । सिंहोरस्कं महाबाहुं दीप्तास्यं हरिलोचनम् । लक्ष्मणानुगतो रामो ददर्शोपससर्प च ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जतयय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरभभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमतम], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसयज]

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा राघवं वाली लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं परुषं धर्मसंहितम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the noblest of all monkeys, spoke these polite words in a pleasing manner to Lakshmana of terrific strength:

data.v: पराङ्मुखवधं कृत्वा को नु प्राप्तस्त्वया गुणः । यदहं युद्धसंरब्धस्त्वत्कृते निधनं गतः ।।
कुलीनः सत्त्वसंपन्नस्तेजस्वी चरितव्रतः । रामः करुणवेदी च प्रजानां च हिते रतः ।।
सानुक्रोशो महोत्साहः समयज्ञो दृढव्रतः । इति ते सर्वभूतानि कथयन्ति यशो भुवि ।।
तान्गुणान्संप्रधार्याहमग्र्यं चाभिजनं तव । तारया प्रतिषिद्धः सन्सुग्रीवेण समागतः ।।
data.es: 'Believing that you are a repository of all these virtues are in you, and respecting your noble lineage I engaged in a duel with Sugriva even though I was forewarned (by Tara).

data.v: न मामन्येन संरब्धं प्रमत्तं वेद्धुमर्हसि । इति मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना बभूवादर्शने तव ।।
न त्वां विनिहतात्मानं धर्मध्वजमधार्मिकम् । जाने पापसमाचारं तृणैः कूपमिवावृतम् ।।
data.es: 'I did not know that you have killed your soul (by acting against your conscience), that you are sinful in conduct and unrighteous under the show of virtues like a well, its mouth covered with grass.

data.v: सतां वेषधरं पापं प्रच्छन्नमिव पावकम् । नाहं त्वामभिजानानि धर्मच्छद्माभिसंवृतम् ।।
data.es: 'You are a sinful man covered with the mask of piety thus resembling a hidden fire. I failed to recognise that righteousness is a mere pretext for you.

data.v: विषये वा पुरे वा ते यदा नापकरोम्यहम् । न च त्वां प्रतिजानेऽहं कस्मात्त्वं हंस्यकिल्बिषम् ।।
data.es: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?

data.v: फलमूलाशनं नित्यं वानरं वनगोचरम् । मामिहाप्रतियुध्यन्तमन्येन च समागतम् ।।
data.es: 'I did no harm to your affairs or to your city. I did not insult you. Why did you choose to kill me, a monkey roaming in the forest and living on fruits and roots? I was not fighting you. Why did you come and strike a person like me?

data.v: त्वं नराधिपतेः पुत्रः प्रतीतः प्रियदर्शनः । लिङ्गमप्यस्ति ते राजन्दृश्यते धर्मसंहितम् ।।
data.es: 'O prince, you are son to a king, handsome and famous. Even signs of righteousness are discernible in you.

data.v: कः क्षत्रियकुले जातः श्रुतवान्नष्टसंशयः । धर्मलिङ्ग प्रतिच्छन्नः क्रूरं कर्म समाचरेत् ।।
data.es: 'Who, born in a kshatriya family, versed in the Vedas and free from doubt will commit such a cruel act under the guise of righteousness?

data.v: राम राजकुले जातो धर्मवानिति विश्रुतः । अभव्यो भव्यरूपेण किमर्थं परिधावसि ।।
data.es: 'You are born in a royal family. You are wellknown. You are proficient in dharma. Yet you are unworthy of your race and robe.

data.v: साम दानं क्षमा धर्मः सत्यं धृतिपराक्रमौ । पार्थिवानां गुणा राजन्दण्डश्चाप्यपकारिषु ।।
data.es: 'O king selfcontrol (of organs of action and sense organs), righteousness, steadfastness, truthfulness, valiance and capacity to punish the offenders are virtues of a king.

data.v: वयं वनचरा राम मृगा मूलफलाशनाः । एषा प्रकृतिरस्माकं पुरुषस्त्वं नरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama we are mere animals wandering in the forest and living on roots and fruits. This is our nature. (But) you are a lord of men.

data.v: भूमिर्हिरण्यं रूप्यं च निग्रहे कारणानि च । तत्र कस्ते वने लोभो मदीयेषु फलेषु वा ।।
data.es: 'We fight for land or gold or silver. What did you fight me for, for what I have or for the fruits of the forest?

data.v: नयश्च विनयश्चोभौ निग्रहानुग्रहावपि । राजवृत्तिरसंकीर्णा न नृपाः कामवृत्तयः ।।
data.es: 'Submissiveness and modesty are the attributes of good rulers and should not be mixed up with benevolence and selfrestraint. Kings ought not to act (as they like) impulsively.

data.v: त्वं तु कामप्रधानश्च कोपनश्चानवस्थितः । राजवृत्तैश्च संकीर्णः शरासनपरायणः ।।
data.es: 'Fulfilling your own desire is important for you. You are wrathful and unstable with royal course of conduct. Your business is with your bow and arrows.

data.v: न तेऽस्त्यपचितिर्धर्मे नार्थे बुद्धिरवस्थिता । इन्द्रियैः कामवृत्तः सन्कृष्यसे मनुजेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of men you have no faith in righteousness, no steadfastness in the acquisition of wealth. You have no control over the senses. You are overcome by delusion.

data.v: हत्वा बाणेन काकुत्स्थ मामिहानपराधिनम् । किं वक्ष्यसि सतां मध्ये कर्म कृत्वा जुगुप्सितम् ।।
data.es: 'O scion of the Kakutsthas Having killed me here with your arrow even though I have done you no harm, you have perpetrated an abominable act. How will you defend yourself in the midst of holy men after commiting such a sinful act?

data.v: राजहा ब्रह्महा गोघ्नश्चोरः प्राणिवधे रतः । नास्तिकः परिवेत्ता च सर्वे निरयगामिनः ।।
data.es: 'One who kills a king, a brahmin or a cow, a thief or one who delights in destruction of life an atheist or one who marries before his elder they all go to hell.

data.v: अधार्यं चर्म मे सद्भी रोमाण्यस्थि च वर्जितम् । अभक्ष्याणि च मांसानि त्वद्विधैर्धर्मचारिभिः ।।
data.es: 'My skin is not fit to be worn by the virtuous, my hair and bones are also prohibited from any use. My flesh is also not at all fit to be eaten by righteous people like you

data.v: पञ्च पञ्चनखा भक्ष्या ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण राघव । शल्यकः श्वाविधो गोधा शशः कूर्मश्च पञ्चमः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama brahmins and kshatriyas are permitted to eat only the five nailed animals the porcupine, the hedgehog, the alligator, the rabbit and the tortoise.

data.v: चर्म चास्थि च मे राजन्न स्पृशन्ति मनीषिणः । अभक्ष्याणि च मांसानि सोऽहं पञ्चनखो हतः ।।
data.es: 'O king the learned do not even touch my skin or bone. They do not eat my flesh. While it is so, you have unnecessarily killed me, a fivenailed animal.

data.v: त्वया नाथेन काकुत्स्थ न सनाथा वसुंधरा । प्रमदा शीलसंपन्ना धूर्तेन पतिता यथा ।।
data.es: 'O Kakutstha just as a wife endowed with good character cannot be protected by a wicked husband, you cannot be a protector of this earth.

data.v: शठो नैकृतिकः क्षुद्रो मिथ्या प्रश्रितमानसः । कथं दशरथेन त्वं जातः पापो महात्मना ।।
data.es: 'You are treacherous, dishonest, mean, guised with false humility and a sinner to the core. How were you born to that highsouled Dasaratha?

data.v: छिन्नचारित्र्यकक्ष्येण सतां धर्मातिवर्तिना । त्यक्तधर्माङ्कुशेनाहं निहतो रामहस्तिना ।।
data.es: 'Breaking through the chains of good character, trespassing the moral code of conduct of the sages, discharging the sharp arrow of righteousness, the elephantine (arrogant) Rama killed me.

data.v: दृश्यमानस्तु युध्येथा मया युधि नृपात्मज । अद्य वैवस्वतं देवं पश्येस्त्वं निहतो मया ।।
data.es: 'O prince had you fought me face to face you would have seen Vaivasvata, the lord of death today (you would have been killed by me).

data.v: त्वयादृश्येन तु रणे निहतोऽहं दुरासदः । प्रसुप्तः पन्नगेनेव नरः पानवशं गतः ।।
data.es: bitten to death by a snake while fast asleep.

data.v: सुग्रीवप्रियकामेन यदहं निहतस्त्वया । कण्ठे बद्ध्वा प्रदद्यां तेऽनिहतं रावणं रणे ।।
data.es: 'Had you sought my help earlier(before you met Sugriva), I would have restored Sita to you within a single day. I have been killed by you to oblige Sugriva. I would have handed over Ravana by the neck after killing him in the battle.

data.v: न्यस्तां सागरतोये वा पाताले वापि मैथिलीम् । जानयेयं तवादेशाच्छ्वेतामश्वतरीमिव ।।
data.es: 'Even if she were hidden in the waters of the ocean or in the underworld, I would have brought her by your order like Sweta to Aswatari or Hayagriva. (Hayagriva, an incarnation of Visnu brought Vedas stolen by demons, Madhu and Kaitabha from Patala or the netherworld)

data.v: युक्तं यत्प्रप्नुयाद्राज्यं सुग्रीवः स्वर्गते मयि । अयुक्तं यदधर्मेण त्वयाहं निहतो रणे ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva inheriting the kingdom after my departure to heaven is proper. But your killing me this way in the combat by unjustifiable means is not.

data.v: काममेवंविधं लोकः कालेन विनियुज्यते । क्षमं चेद्भवता प्राप्तमुत्तरं साधु चिन्त्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, in the world people meet with death when the time comes. Hiding yourself (from me) you have achieved it. Is it proper for you? You may think over and give your reply.'

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा परिशुष्कवक्त्रः; शराभिघाताद्व्यथितो महात्मा । समीक्ष्य रामं रविसंनिकाशं; तूष्णीं बभूवामरराजसूनुः ।।
इत्युक्तः प्रश्रितं वाक्यं धर्मार्थसहितं हितम् । परुषं वालिना रामो निहतेन विचेतसा ।।
data.es: To these harsh words though seemingly wellmeaning, courteous and righteous, Vali who had been mortally wounded and confused in mind, Rama replied:

data.v: तं निष्प्रभमिवादित्यं मुक्ततोयमिवाम्बुदम् । उक्तवाक्यं हरिश्रेष्ठमुपशान्तमिवानलम् ।।
data.es: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:

data.v: धर्मार्थगुणसंपन्नं हरीश्वरमनुत्तमम् । अधिक्षिप्तस्तदा रामः पश्चाद्वालिनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: To righteous Vali,the best of the monkeys, the lord of the monkeys, who looked like the Sun shorn of his brilliance or a raindrained cloud or a fire that had been extinguished. Rama, under the scanner, said in reply:

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च समयं चापि लौकिकम् । अविज्ञाय कथं बाल्यान्मामिहाद्य विगर्हसे ।।
data.es: 'Without correct knowledge of dharma, artha, kama and worldly ways, how do you reproach me bitterly now in total ignorance?

data.v: अपृष्ट्वा बुद्धिसंपन्नान्वृद्धानाचार्यसंमतान् । सौम्य वानरचापल्यात्त्वं मां वक्तुमिहेच्छसि ।।
data.es: 'O gentle Vali why do you speak with monkeyish frivolousness, without consulting the elders and teachers endowed with intelligence?

data.v: इक्ष्वाकूणामियं भूमिः सशैलवनकानना । मृगपक्षिमनुष्याणां निग्रहानुग्रहावपि ।।
data.es: 'This earth including mountains, groves and forests, animals, birds and humans belongs to the Ikshvaku kings.The right of purnishment and reward also vests with them.

data.v: तां पालयति धर्मात्मा भरतः सत्यवागृजुः । धर्मकामार्थतत्त्वज्ञो निग्रहानुग्रहे रतः ।।
data.es: 'Bharata, righteous, truthful, upright, knower of dharma, artha and kama and dispenser of punishment and rewards, rules this earth.

data.v: नयश्च विनयश्चोभौ यस्मिन्सत्यं च सुस्थितम् । विक्रमश्च यथा दृष्टः स राजा देशकालवित् ।।
data.es: 'Bharata in whom justice and discipline, truth and courage along with the knowledge of time and place for action are firmly rooted is king (of this earth).

data.v: तस्य धर्मकृतादेशा वयमन्ये च पार्थिवः । चरामो वसुधां कृत्स्नां धर्मसंतानमिच्छवः ।।
data.es: 'Following his command, in confirmity with dharma we and the other kings also move all over the entire world desirous of promoting dharma.

data.v: तस्मिन्नृपतिशार्दूल भरते धर्मवत्सले । पालयत्यखिलां भूमिं कश्चरेद्धर्मनिग्रहम् ।।
data.es: 'Who can stray from the path of dharma when the whole world is ruled by Bharata, a tiger among kings, and a lover of dharma?

data.v: ते वयं मार्गविभ्रष्टं स्वधर्मे परमे स्थिताः । भरताज्ञां पुरस्कृत्य निगृह्णीमो यथाविधि ।।
data.es: 'By the command of Bharata ,all of us are devoted to our duty of upholding dharma and virtue and duly punish those who deviate from the path of dharma.

data.v: त्वं तु संक्लिष्टधर्मा च कर्मणा च विगर्हितः । कामतन्त्रप्रधानश्च न स्थितो राजवर्त्मनि ।।
data.es: 'You have violated dharma. You stand condemned for your actions. Passion is your priority. You have strayed from the right path of kings.

data.v: ज्येष्ठो भ्राता पिता चैव यश्च विद्यां प्रयच्छति । त्रयस्ते पितरो ज्ञेया धर्मे च पथि वर्तिनः ।।
यवीयानात्मनः पुत्रः शिष्यश्चापि गुणोदितः । पुत्रवत्ते त्रयश्चिन्त्या धर्मश्चेदत्र कारणम् ।।
सूक्ष्मः परमदुर्ज्ञेयः सतां धर्मः प्लवंगम । हृदिस्थः सर्वभूतानामात्मा वेद शुभाशुभम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkey dharma is very subtle. It is extremely difficult to understand. Installed in the hearts of all living beings the self knows good and evil (soul is the witness of good and evil).

data.v: चपलश्चपलैः सार्धं वानरैरकृतात्मभिः । जात्यन्ध इव जात्यन्धैर्मन्त्रयन्द्रक्ष्यसे नु किम् ।।
data.es: 'You are fickle by nature. Your consultants are frivolous, pettyminded monkeys. It is like one born blind suppporting another blind by birth. What do you know (about dharma)?

data.v: अहं तु व्यक्ततामस्य वचनस्य ब्रवीमि ते । न हि मां केवलं रोषात्त्वं विगर्हितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I shall explain to you clearly (the reason for striking you down). It is not proper for you to despise me with mere anger and malice.

data.v: तदेतत्कारणं पश्य यदर्थं त्वं मया हतः । भ्रातुर्वर्तसि भार्यायां त्यक्त्वा धर्मं सनातनम् ।।
data.es: 'Now know the reason why I struck you down. Having abandoned the eternal law, you are living with your younger brother's wife.

data.v: अस्य त्वं धरमाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । रुमायां वर्तसे कामात्स्नुषायां पापकर्मकृत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:

data.v: तद्व्यतीतस्य ते धर्मात्कामवृत्तस्य वानर । भ्रातृभार्याभिमर्शेऽस्मिन्दण्डोऽयं प्रतिपादितः ।।
data.es: 'O monkey since you have violated morality by sinning against your brother's wife this punishment is justified.

data.v: न हि धर्मविरुद्धस्य लोकवृत्तादपेयुषः । दण्डादन्यत्र पश्यामि निग्रहं हरियूथप ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys I do not see any other way of controlling a person excepting punishing the one who has acted against dharma and swerved from the accepted code of conduct.

data.v: औरसीं भगिनीं वापि भार्यां वाप्यनुजस्य यः । प्रचरेत नरः कामात्तस्य दण्डो वधः स्मृतः ।।
data.es: 'I am a kshatriya born of a good family. I will not pardon you for your sin. Whosoever transgresses dharma against his own daughter, sister or brother's wife out of lust should be killed according to smriti.

data.v: भरतस्तु महीपालो वयं त्वादेशवर्तिनः । त्वं च धर्मादतिक्रान्तः कथं शक्यमुपेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: 'Bharata is a king and we follow his command. How can you, who have strayed from dharma, go unpunished?

data.v: गुरुधर्मव्यतिक्रान्तं प्राज्ञो धर्मेण पालयन् । भरतः कामवृत्तानां निग्रहे पर्यवस्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Wise Bharata being a respectable king rules by dharma. By the command of Bharata, we are bent upon punishing those who have strayed from dharma by being addicted to sensual pleasures.

data.v: वयं तु भरतादेशं विधिं कृत्वा हरीश्वर । त्वद्विधान्भिन्नमर्यादान्नियन्तुं पर्यवस्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'O Vali we have to follow Bharata's command and are bent upon punishing those wicked people who deviate from the bounds of dharma.

data.v: सुग्रीवेण च मे सख्यं लक्ष्मणेन यथा तथा । दारराज्यनिमित्तं च निःश्रेयसि रतः स मे ।।
data.es: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?

data.v: प्रतिज्ञा च मया दत्ता तदा वानरसंनिधौ । प्रतिज्ञा च कथं शक्या मद्विधेनानवेक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: 'My friendship with Sugriva is as strong as that with Lakshmana. Its motive is the recovery of his wife and sovereignty. I have promised this to him in the presence of monkeys. How can a pledge remain unhonoured by a person like me? How is it possible?

data.v: तदेभिः कारणैः सर्वैर्महद्भिर्धर्मसंहितैः । शासनं तव यद्युक्तं तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Knowing all these reasons(many violations of dharma), it is proper for you as a king to approve of the punishment accorded to you in consonance with dharma.

data.v: सर्वथा धर्म इत्येव द्रष्टव्यस्तव निग्रहः । वयस्यस्योपकर्तव्यं धर्ममेवानुपश्यता ।।
data.es: 'Punishment given to you should be viewed as a right course of action in all respects. This is the duty of a trustworthy friend who follows dharma.

data.v: राजभिर्धृतदण्डास्तु कृत्वा पापानि मानवाः । निर्मलाः स्वर्गमायान्ति सन्तः सुकृतिनो यथा ।।
data.es: 'Men who have perpetrated sins should be subjected to punishment by kings so that they become stainless and attain heaven like pious men who have performed good deeds.

data.v: आर्येण मम मान्धात्रा व्यसनं घोरमीप्सितम् । श्रमणेन कृते पापे यथा पापं कृतं त्वया ।।
data.es: 'In the past a similar sin was perpetrated by Sramana, a revered soul (mendicant) and Mandhata, a noble king of my race inflicted terrible punishment on him.

data.v: अन्यैरपि कृतं पापं प्रमत्तैर्वसुधाधिपैः । प्रायश्चित्तं च कुर्वन्ति तेन तच्छाम्यते रजः ।।
data.es: 'Vicious deeds have been committed by others when the kings were not watchful. Kings punish such sinners when they are vigilant. Otherwise they have to atone for their negligence.

data.v: तदलं परितापेन धर्मतः परिकल्पितः । वधो वानरशार्दूल न वयं स्ववशे स्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys do not regret. Your death has the sanction of dharma. We are under the control of sastras. We are committed to them. We do not have the freedom to act independently.

data.v: वागुराभिश्च पाशैश्च कूटैश्च विविधैर्नराः । प्रतिच्छन्नाश्च दृश्याश्च गृह्णन्ति सुबहून्मृगान् । प्रधावितान्वा वित्रस्तान्विस्रब्धानतिविष्ठितान् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: स्रग्विणी [१२: रररर], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसजर], अज्ञातम् [१२: ममभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जरतत]

data.es: 'O best of monkeys I have no mental agony nor do I regret in this case. Hidden from view or out in the open, people catch animals by means of snares or ropes or through other tricks.

data.v: प्रमत्तानप्रमत्तान्वा नरा मांसार्थिनो भृशम् । विध्यन्ति विमुखांश्चापि न च दोषोऽत्र विद्यते ।।
data.es: 'People seeking animal flesh for food kill animals alarmed or unalarmed, animals that run away or animals that stand still. They kill animals whether they are alert or not and no blemish is attached.

data.v: यान्ति राजर्षयश्चात्र मृगयां धर्मकोविदाः । तस्मात्त्वं निहतो युद्धे मया बाणेन वानर । अयुध्यन्प्रतियुध्यन्वा यस्माच्छाखामृगो ह्यसि ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यरनत], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभम], अज्ञातम् [१२: यमतभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररभज]

data.es: 'O monkey even royal saints wellversed in dharma go for hunting. I struck you down with an arrow whether you were fighting with Sugriva or not, since you are a monkey. (You can be hit whether you are fighting face to face or not).

data.v: दुर्लभस्य च धर्मस्य जीवितस्य शुभस्य च । राजानो वानरश्रेष्ठ प्रदातारो न संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys kings are donors of dharma, life and auspiciousness to people which is difficult to acquire. There is no doubt about it.

data.v: तान्न हिंस्यान्न चाक्रोशेन्नाक्षिपेन्नाप्रियं वदेत् । देवा मानुषरूपेण चरन्त्येते महीतले ।।
data.es: 'One should not insult kings, nor shout at them, nor disregard them nor speak unpleasant words to them. They are gods in human form moving on this earth.

data.v: त्वं तु धर्ममविज्ञाय केवलं रोषमास्थितः । प्रदूषयसि मां धर्मे पितृपैतामहे स्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'Seized with improper anger, you are reproaching one who is devoted to dharma, without knowing that I follow the code of conduct that has been passed on by my fathers and forefathers.'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण वाली प्रव्यथितो भृशम् । प्रत्युवाच ततो रामं प्राञ्जलिर्वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Vali was very much pained to hear Rama. He became free from confusion regarding dharma and no longer found fault with Rama.

data.v: यत्त्वमात्थ नरश्रेष्ठ तदेवं नात्र संशयः । प्रतिवक्तुं प्रकृष्टे हि नापकृष्टस्तु शक्नुयात् ।।
यदयुक्तं मया पूर्वं प्रमादाद्वाक्यमप्रियम् । तत्रापि खलु मे दोषं कर्तुं नार्हसि राघव ।।
data.es: In Progress

data.v: त्वं हि दृष्टार्थतत्त्वज्ञः प्रजानां च हिते रतः । कार्यकारणसिद्धौ ते प्रसन्ना बुद्धिरव्यया ।।
data.es: 'You are a wise man given to truth and righteousness.You remain devoted to people's wellbeing. As you know for certain about cause and effect your intellect is sound and words pleasant.

data.v: मामप्यवगतं धर्माद्व्यतिक्रान्तपुरस्कृतम् । धर्मसंहितया वाचा धर्मज्ञ परिपालय ।।
data.es: 'O knower of dharma, I did not follow dharma in the past. I have trangressed the bounds of dharma. Say, you have pardoned me, protect me in a righteous manner.

data.v: बाष्पसंरुद्धकण्ठस्तु वाली सार्तरवः शनैः । उवाच रामं संप्रेक्ष्य पङ्कलग्न इव द्विपः ।।
न त्वात्मानमहं शोचे न तारां नापि बान्धवान् । यथा पुत्रं गुणश्रेष्ठमङ्गदं कनकाङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: 'I neither grieve for myself nor for Tara nor for my kinsmen. But I do for my son Angada adorned with golden armlets. He is embellished with all virtues.

data.v: स ममादर्शनाद्दीनो बाल्यात्प्रभृति लालितः । तटाक इव पीताम्बुरुपशोषं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I loved him very much from his childhood. He will grow depressed in my absence. He will become like a pond whose waters have been dried up.

data.v: सुग्रीवे चाङ्गदे चैव विधत्स्व मतिमुत्तमाम् । त्वं हि शास्ता च गोप्ता च कार्याकार्यविधौ स्थितः ।।
data.es: 'Shower equal affection from your heart on Sugriva and Angada. You are their protector and punisher also. You know what should and should not be done.

data.v: या ते नरपते वृत्तिर्भरते लक्ष्मणे च या । सुग्रीवे चाङ्गदे राजंस्तां चिन्तयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O lord of men may you have the same kind of affection for Sugriva and Angada as you have for Bharata and Lakshmana.

data.v: मद्दोषकृतदोषां तां यथा तारां तपस्विनीम् । सुग्रीवो नावमन्येत तथावस्थातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'I hope Tara will not be made to suffer because of my offence. Make Sugriva not to run wretched Tara down.

data.v: त्वया ह्यनुगृहीतेन शक्यं राज्यमुपासितुम् । त्वद्वशे वर्तमानेन तव चित्तानुवर्तिना ।।
data.es: 'It is possible for a person favoured by you to rule the kingdom.It is possible for one who is under your control and acts according to your will to rule the entire world and earn heaven.

data.v: स तमाश्वासयद्रामो वालिनं व्यक्तदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: Now Vali was able to see clearly. Rama consoled him with words of peace and tranquillity, truth and righteousness.

data.v: न वयं भवता चिन्त्या नाप्यात्मा हरिसत्तम । वयं भवद्विशेषेण धर्मतः कृतनिश्चयाः ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys, abandon all your anxiety on this score. Bother not about us or about yourself. Whatever has happened, has happened in consonance with dharma.

data.v: दण्ड्ये यः पातयेद्दण्डं दण्ड्यो यश्चापि दण्ड्यते । कार्यकारणसिद्धार्थावुभौ तौ नावसीदतः ।।
data.es: 'The sinner and the punisher, whoever gives punishment and whoever receives it, are both regulated by the law of cause and effect. So do not despair.

data.v: तद्भवान्दण्डसंयोगादस्माद्विगतकल्मषः । गतः स्वां प्रकृतिं धर्म्यां धर्मदृष्ट्तेन वर्त्मना ।।
data.es: 'You have been purged of your sin through punishment from the point of view of righteousness. You have regained your spiritual nature on the path of dharma.

data.v: स तस्य वाक्यं मधुरं महात्मनः; समाहितं धर्मपथानुवर्तिनः । निशम्य रामस्य रणावमर्दिनो; वचः सुयुक्तं निजगाद वानरः ।।
data.es: Having listened to the sweet, wellcomposed words of great Rama, a crusher of the enemy in war ,follower of righteous path, Vali replied in appropriate manner:

data.v: शराभितप्तेन विचेतसा मया; प्रदूषितस्त्वं यदजानता प्रभो । इदं महेन्द्रोपमभीमविक्रम; प्रसादितस्त्वं क्षम मे महीश्वर ।।
data.es: 'Pray, O mighty prince, hero of immense valour, pardon me for the words of blame I unwittingly hurled at you. I said all that in excruciating pain caused by your mighty arrow and in confusion of what is right and what is wrong.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टादशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the eighteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic, composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: स वानरमहाराजः शयानः शरविक्षतः । प्रत्युक्तो हेतुमद्वाक्यैर्नोत्तरं प्रत्यपद्यत ।।
data.es: The king of monkeys lying on the ground struck by the arrow did not offer to reply after listening to Rama's appropriate answers (to his objections).

data.v: अश्मभिः परिभिन्नाङ्गः पादपैराहतो भृशम् । रामबाणेन चाक्रान्तो जीवितान्ते मुमोह सः ।।
data.es: Severely battered by stones, hit by trees and pierced by Rama's arrow, Vali lost consciousness as the end of his life was nearing.

data.v: तं भार्याबाणमोक्षेण रामदत्तेन संयुगे । हतं प्लवगशार्दूलं तारा शुश्राव वालिनम् ।।
data.es: Tara, wife of Vali, heard that her husband, tiger among monkeys, was killed in the battle by the arrow discharged by Rama.

data.v: सा सपुत्राप्रियं श्रुत्वा वधं भर्तुः सुदारुणम् । निष्पपात भृशं त्रस्ता विविधाद्गिरिगह्वरात् ।।
data.es: Hearing the terrible, unhappy news of her husband's death, Tara anxiously rushed along with her son out of the mountain cave.

data.v: ये त्वङ्गदपरीवारा वानरा हि महाबलाः । ते सकार्मुकमालोक्य रामं त्रस्ताः प्रदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.es: Alarmed at the sight of Rama holding the bow, the terribly courageous monkeys who followed Angada as his bodyguards ran in different directions.

data.v: सा ददर्श ततस्त्रस्तान्हरीनापततो द्रुतम् । यूथादिव परिभ्रष्टान्मृगान्निहतयूथपान् ।।
data.es: Tara saw the terrorstricken monkeys running helterskelter, like the herd of deer whose leader who had strayed had been killed.

data.v: तानुवाच समासाद्य दुःखितान्दुःखिता सती । राम वित्रासितान्सर्वाननुबद्धानिवेषुभिः ।।
data.es: Sorrowful Tara, the wife of Vali, duly approaching the monkeys stricken with grief and running as if chased by the arrows of Rama at their back, said to them:

data.v: वानरा राजसिंहस्य यस्य यूयं पुरःसराः । तं विहाय सुवित्रस्ताः कस्माद्द्रवत दुर्गताः ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys deserting the lion among kings,whose servants you are ? What should you be frightened for ? Why run away in distress?

data.v: राज्यहेतोः स चेद्भ्राता भ्राता रौद्रेण पातितः । रामेण प्रसृतैर्दूरान्मार्गणैर्दूर पातिभिः ।।
data.es: 'If the (elder) brother is struck down by his (younger) brother in anger for the sake of kingship using farreaching arrows discharged by Rama, why are you running?'

data.v: कपिपत्न्या वचः श्रुत्वा कपयः कामरूपिणः । प्राप्तकालमविश्लिष्टमूचुर्वचनमङ्गनाम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Tara, the wife of Vali, the monkeys who could assume any form at their will replied with clear words appropriate to the occasion:

data.v: जीव पुत्रे निवर्तस्य पुत्रं रक्षस्व चान्दगम् । अन्तको राम रूपेण हत्वा नयति वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O mother, your son is still alive. Go back and protect your son Angada. Lord of death in the form of Rama has come and killed Vali and is carrying him away.

data.v: क्षिप्तान्वृक्षान्समाविध्य विपुलाश्च शिलास्तथा । वाली वज्रसमैर्बाणैर्वज्रेणेव निपातितः ।।
data.es: 'Rama smashed the trees and stones Vali hurled at him and then struck him down with thunderboltlike arrows.

data.v: अभिद्रुतमिदं सर्वं विद्रुतं प्रसृतं बलम् । अस्मिन्प्लवगशार्दूले हते शक्रसमप्रभे ।।
data.es: 'When Vali who was equal to Indra in strength, a tiger among monkeys, was killed, the army of monkeys got terrified and ran away here and there, scattered in different directions.

data.v: रक्ष्यतां नगरं शूरैरङ्गदश्चाभिषिच्यताम् । पदस्थं वालिनः पुत्रं भजिष्यन्ति प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.es: 'Let the gate of the city be shut and Vali's son be consecrated as king. All the monkeys will serve him when he assumes power.

data.v: अथ वा रुचिरं स्थानमिह ते रुचिरानने । आविशन्ति हि दुर्गाणि क्षिप्रमद्यैव वानराः ।।
data.es: 'O lovely Tara, this very day other monkeys will soon occupy our citadels.

data.v: अभार्याः सह भार्याश्च सन्त्यत्र वनचारिणः । लुब्धेभ्यो विप्रयुक्तेभ्यः स्वेभ्यो नस्तुमुलं भयम् ।।
data.es: 'There are monkeys wandering in the forest (sent away by Vali). Some of them have made others' wives their own and some have been separated from their wives. They are a great cause of fear.'

data.v: अल्पान्तरगतानां तु श्रुत्वा वचनमङ्गना । आत्मनः प्रतिरूपं सा बभाषे चारुहासिनी ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of the pettyminded monkeys, Tara spoke to them in her own way with a gentle smile:

data.v: पुत्रेण मम किं कार्यं किं राज्येन किमात्मना । कपिसिंहे महाभागे तस्मिन्भर्तरि नश्यति ।।
data.es: 'Now that the glorious Vali, a lion among monkeys, my husband is dying, of what purpose is the son, or the kingdom or my own life?

data.v: पादमूलं गमिष्यामि तस्यैवाहं महात्मनः । योऽसौ रामप्रयुक्तेन शरेण विनिपातितः ।।
data.es: 'I will seek the soles of the feet of the great soul who has been killed by the arrow discharged by Rama.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा प्रदुद्राव रुदती शोककर्शिता । शिरश्चोरश्च बाहुभ्यां दुःखेन समभिघ्नती ।।
data.es: So saying, the griefstricken, weeping Tara hastened, sadly beating with both hands her head and her chest.

data.v: आव्रजन्ती ददर्शाथ पतिं निपतितं भुवि । हन्तारं दानवेन्द्राणां समरेष्वनिवर्तिनाम् ।।
data.es: As she was nearing (the spot) she saw her husband, a great conqueror of monkeys who never retreated from the battle, mortally hit and fallen on the ground.

data.v: क्षेप्तारं पर्वतेन्द्राणां वज्राणामिव वासवम् । महावातसमाविष्टं महामेघौघनिःस्वनम् ।।
data.es: Vali who used to hurl huge mountains like Indra discharges thunderbolts, who had the speed of wind of high velocity, who would roar like huge thundering clouds,

data.v: शक्रतुल्यपराक्रान्तं वृष्ट्वेवोपरतं घनम् । नर्दन्तं नर्दतां भीमं शूरं शूरेण पातितम् ।।
data.es: (Vali) who was equal to Indra in prowess looked like a huge monsoon cloud that had calmed down after pouring all water, a roaring warrior who could frighten others, struck down by another warrior, appeared like a lion killed by a tiger for the sake of meat

data.v: शार्दूलेनामिषस्यार्थे मृगराजं यथा हतम् । अर्चितं सर्वलोकस्य सपताकं सवेदिकम् ।।
नागहेतोः सुपर्णेन चैत्यमुन्मथितं यथा । अवष्टभ्यावतिष्ठन्तं ददर्श धनुरूर्जितम् ।।
रामं रामानुजं चैव भर्तुश्चैवानुजं शुभा । तानतीत्य समासाद्य भर्तारं निहतं रणे ।।
समीक्ष्य व्यथिता भूमौ संभ्रान्ता निपपात ह । सुप्तेव पुनरुत्थाय आर्यपुत्रेति क्रोशती ।।
रुरोद सा पतिं दृष्ट्वा संदितं मृत्युदामभिः । तामवेक्ष्य तु सुग्रीवः क्रोशन्तीं कुररीमिव ।।
विषादमगमत्कष्टं दृष्ट्वा चाङ्गदमागतम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Tara crying like a female osprey and Angada following her in despair, Sugriva felt pain (at heart).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the nineteenth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: रामचापविसृष्टेन शरेणान्तकरेण तम् । दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं भूमौ तारा ताराधिपानना ।।
data.es: Beholding her husband lying on the ground pierced by a deathdealing arrow released by Rama, the lovely moonfaced Tara went and embraced him.

data.v: सा समासाद्य भर्तारं पर्यष्वजत भामिनी । इषुणाभिहतं दृष्ट्वा वालिनं कुञ्जरोपमम् ।।
वानरेन्द्रं महेन्द्राभं शोकसंतप्तमानसा । तारा तरुमिवोन्मूलं पर्यदेवयदातुरा ।।
data.es: Beholding Vali, the lord of monkeys, who was strong as an elephant, splendid as a mountain, fallen down like an uprooted tree, struck by the arrow, Tara became restless and wailed bitterly:

data.v: रणे दारुणविक्रान्त प्रवीर प्लवतां वर । किं दीनामपुरोभागामद्य त्वं नाभिभाषसे ।।
data.es: 'O valiant hero, lord of monkeys you were terrifying in war. Why don't you speak now to me so forlorn and helpless?

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ हरिशार्दूल भजस्व शयनोत्तमम् । नैवंविधाः शेरते हि भूमौ नृपतिसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys get up. Come and sleep on the best of beds. Best of kings, you should not lie on the ground.

data.v: अतीव खलु ते कान्ता वसुधा वसुधाधिप । गतासुरपि यां गात्रैर्मां विहाय निषेवसे ।।
data.es: 'O lord of the earth I know you loved the earth more than you loved me since you have forsaken me and enjoy her company by hugging her with your limbs, even after death.

data.v: व्यक्तमन्या त्वया वीर धर्मतः संप्रवर्तता । किष्किन्धेव पुरी रम्या स्वर्गमार्गे विनिर्मिता ।।
data.es: 'O my heroic husband, you are the legitimate, righteous king of Kiskinda. You have evidently built another beautiful city Kiskinda on your way to heaven.

data.v: यान्यस्माभिस्त्वया सार्धं वनेषु मधुगन्धिषु । विहृतानि त्वया काले तेषामुपरमः कृतः ।।
data.es: 'Our pleasure trips to sweetscented forests have ended now. You have brought them to a close.

data.v: निरानन्दा निराशाहं निमग्ना शोकसागरे । त्वयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने महायूथपयूथपे ।।
data.es: 'You are the leader of leaders. Now that you have attained heaven I am bereft of all joy, plunged in a sea of grief.

data.v: हृदयं सुस्थिरं मह्यं दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं भुवि । यन्न शोकाभिसंतप्तं स्फुटतेऽद्य सहस्रधा ।।
data.es: 'I presume my heart is strong, for it has not broken into a thousand pieces, even though I am overwhelmed with grief to see my husband fallen on the ground.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्य त्वया भार्या हृता स च विवासितः । यत्तत्तस्य त्वया व्युष्टिः प्राप्तेयं प्लवगाधिप ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys you have banished Sugriva. You have usurped his wife. This is the fruit of your action.

data.v: निःश्रेयसपरा मोहात्त्वया चाहं विगर्हिता । यैषाब्रुवं हितं वाक्यं वानरेन्द्रहितैषिणी ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys wishing your wellbeing I tendered salutary advice. But out of delusion you despised them.

data.v: कालो निःसंशयो नूनं जीवितान्तकरस्तव । बलाद्येनावपन्नोऽसि सुग्रीवस्यावशो वशम् ।।
data.es: 'No doubt time is inexorable. The time of your death had surely arrived.Now you, whom nobody could control, have come under the sway of Sugriva.

data.v: वैधव्यं शोकसंतापं कृपणं कृपणा सती । अदुःखोपचिता पूर्वं वर्तयिष्याम्यनाथवत् ।।
data.es: 'I have not experienced poverty or suffering before. Immersed in grief, like an orphan, now I am reduced to the pitiable condition of a widow.

data.v: लालितश्चाङ्गदो वीरः सुकुमारः सुखोचितः । वत्स्यते कामवस्थां मे पितृव्ये क्रोधमूर्छिते ।।
data.es: 'To what plight will the tender Angada, who has been tended affectionately and deserves comforts, be reduced when his uncle displays anger?

data.v: कुरुष्व पितरं पुत्र सुदृष्टं धर्मवत्सलम् । दुर्लभं दर्शनं त्वस्य तव वत्स भविष्यति ।।
data.es: (Turning to Angada Tara said) 'O son, look at your father, a lover of dharma. See him, as it will be difficult to see him later, dear'.

data.v: समाश्वासय पुत्रं त्वं संदेशं संदिशस्व च । मूर्ध्नि चैनं समाघ्राय प्रवासं प्रस्थितो ह्यसि ।।
data.es: 'O lord you have set out on a long journey. Kiss your son on the forehead, enjoy its sweet smell, console him and give him your message.

data.v: रामेण हि महत्कर्म कृतं त्वामभिनिघ्नता । आनृण्यं तु गतं तस्य सुग्रीवस्य प्रतिश्रवे ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, Rama has achieved a great feat in fulfilling his promise to Sugriva. He is acquitted of the debt by killing you.

data.v: सकामो भव सुग्रीव रुमां त्वं प्रतिपत्स्यसे । भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यमनुद्विग्नः शस्तो भ्राता रिपुस्तव ।।
data.es: '(Now turning to Sugriva she said) O Sugriva your enemy brother has been killed and your desire has been fulfilled.You will get back Ruma and enjoy the kingdom without any obstacles.'

data.v: किं मामेवं विलपतीं प्रेंणा त्वं नाभिभाषसे । इमाः पश्य वरा बह्वीर्भार्यास्ते वानरेश्वर ।।
data.es: '(To Vali she said) O lord of monkeys Why don't you speak to me loving words when I am wailing this way? Here are your excellent wives'

data.v: तस्या विलपितं श्रुत्वा वानर्यः सर्वतश्च ताः । परिगृह्याङ्गदं दीनं दुःखार्ताः परिचुक्रुशुः ।।
data.es: On hearing the wailing of Tara, all the other wives of Vali held the piteous (in their arms) Angada and wailed, overwhelmed with sorrow:

data.v: किमङ्गदं साङ्गद वीर बाहो; विहाय यास्यद्य चिरप्रवासं । न युक्तमेवं गुणसंनिकृष्टं; विहाय पुत्रं प्रियपुत्र गन्तुम् ।।
data.es: 'O hero, adorned with armlets, why have you departed on a long journey, deserting your dear son Angada who possesses similar virtues like you? It is not proper.

data.v: किमप्रियं ते प्रियचारुवेष; कृतं मया नाथ सुतेन वा ते । सहायिनीमद्य विहाय वीर; यमक्षयं गच्छसि दुर्विनीतम् ।।
data.es: 'O darling, attractively dressed, you are leaving me and Angada and going too far. What unpleasant deeds we have done (to deserve this).

data.v: यद्यप्रियं किंचिदसंप्रधार्य; कृतं मया स्यात्तव दीर्घबाहो । क्षमस्व मे तद्धरिवंश नाथ; व्रजामि मूर्ध्ना तव वीर पादौ ।।
data.es: 'O longarmed chief of the monkey clan O warrior pardon me any wrong done unknowingly, inconsiderately. I touch your feet with my head.'

data.v: तथा तु तारा करुणं रुदन्ती; भर्तुः समीपे सह वानरीभिः । व्यवस्यत प्रायमनिन्द्यवर्णा; उपोपवेष्टुं भुवि यत्र वाली ।।
ततो निपतितां तारां च्युतां तारामिवाम्बरात् । शनैराश्वासयामास हनूमान्हरियूथपः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Hanuman, leader of the monkey clan, slowly consoled Tara who was (standing before her husband) like a star fallen from the sky.

data.v: गुणदोषकृतं जन्तुः स्वकर्मफलहेतुकम् । अव्यग्रस्तदवाप्नोति सर्वं प्रेत्य शुभाशुभम् ।।
data.es: 'On departing from this mortal world an embodied soul reaps gradually the good and evil fruits of action performed under the notion of virtue or vice with an eye to their good or evil consequences.

data.v: शोच्या शोचसि कं शोच्यं दीनं दीनानुकम्पसे । कश्च कस्यानुशोच्योऽस्ति देहेऽस्मिन्बुद्बुदोपमे ।।
data.es: 'For whom do you grieve except for yourself? You are miserable. Who are you sympathising with? Who are you grieving for? When this body itself is like a bubble, who is worth grieving for?

data.v: अङ्गदस्तु कुमारोऽयं द्रष्टव्यो जीवपुत्रया । आयत्या च विधेयानि समर्थान्यस्य चिन्तय ।।
data.es: 'You are mother of a surviving son, Angada. You have to look after him in times to come. Think of the duties to be performed now.

data.v: जानास्यनियतामेवं भूतानामागतिं गतिम् । तस्माच्छुभं हि कर्तव्यं पण्डिते नैहलौकिकम् ।।
data.es: 'You are aware of the uncertain and transient happenings in the lives of living beings. Therefore, a wise lady should do auspicious work in this world.

data.v: यस्मिन्हरिसहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च । वर्तयन्ति कृतांशानि सोऽयं दिष्टान्तमागतः ।।
data.es: 'Tens of millions of monkeys depended on this hero with their hopes on him. He has reached his ultimate destiny now to enjoy the fruits of his good deeds.

data.v: यदयं न्यायदृष्टार्थः सामदानक्षमापरः । गतो धर्मजितां भूमिं नैनं शोचितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'This hero with a right vision, adopted the means of conciliation, charity and forgiveness (in his administration) and has finally reached a position through righteousness in his death. It is not proper to mourn for him.

data.v: सर्वे च हरिशार्दूल पुत्रश्चायं तवाङ्गदः । हर्यृष्कपतिराज्यं च त्वत्सनाथमनिन्दिते ।।
data.es: 'O blemishless lady these great monkeys including your son Angada and the entire kingdom of monkeys and bears are under your protection.

data.v: ताविमौ शोकसंतप्तौ शनैः प्रेरय भामिनि । त्वया परिगृहीतोऽयमङ्गदः शास्तु मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: 'O fair sex Encourage these two griefstricken heroes (Angada and Sugriva) gently. Let Angada rule this earth under your protection.

data.v: संततिश्च यथादृष्टा कृत्यं यच्चापि साम्प्रतम् । राज्ञस्तत्क्रियतां सर्वमेष कालस्य निश्चयः ।।
संस्कार्यो हरिराजस्तु अङ्गदश्चाभिषिच्यताम् । सिंहासनगतं पुत्रं पश्यन्ती शान्तिमेष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'Let all the rituals of the king of vanaras be performed. Let Angada be consecrated. You will attain peace of mind to see your son seated on the throne.'

data.v: सा तस्य वचनं श्रुत्वा भर्तृव्यसनपीडिता । अब्रवीदुत्तरं तारा हनूमन्तमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Hanuman's words, Tara, tormented by the death of her husband said to Hanuman who was waiting for her reply:

data.v: अङ्गद प्रतिरूपाणां पुत्राणामेकतः शतम् । हतस्याप्यस्य वीरस्य गात्रसंश्लेषणं वरम् ।।
data.es: 'To embrace even the deadbody of this hero is better than (to embrace) a hundred prototypes of Angada.

data.v: न चाहं हरिराजस्य प्रभवाम्यङ्गदस्य वा । पितृव्यस्तस्य सुग्रीवः सर्वकार्येष्वनन्तरः ।।
न ह्येषा बुद्धिरास्थेया हनूमन्नङ्गदं प्रति । पिता हि बन्धुः पुत्रस्य न माता हरिसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman the best of monkeys, you need not think about (the future of) Angada. A father plans for a son and not (even) the mother.

data.v: न हि मम हरिराजसंश्रया;त्क्षमतरमस्ति परत्र चेह वा । अभिमुखहतवीरसेवितं; शयनमिदं मम सेवितुं क्षमम् ।।
data.es: There is nothing more befitting for me than joining the king of monkeys either here or in the next world. It is proper for me to resort to this resting place (pyre) used by this slain hero in front of me.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकविंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the twentyfirst sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: वीक्षमाणस्तु मन्दासुः सर्वतो मन्दमुच्छ्वसन् । आदावेव तु सुग्रीवं ददर्श त्वात्मजाग्रतः ।।
data.es: Vali, gazing all around, breathing slowly and sighing feably beheld Sugriva at first instance, Sugriva who was standing in front of his own son.

data.v: तं प्राप्तविजयं वाली सुग्रीवं प्लवगेश्वरम् । आभाष्य व्यक्तया वाचा सस्नेहमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Vali, the lord of monkeys, lovingly said to Sugriva, who had won a victory:

data.v: सुग्रीवदोषेण न मां गन्तुमर्हसि किल्बिषात् । कृष्यमाणं भविष्येण बुद्धिमोहेन मां बलात् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you ought not to accuse me of exiling you, and wresting your wife. My mind was deluded by the force of fate that controls one's future.

data.v: युगपद्विहितं तात न मन्ये सुखमावयोः । सौहार्दं भ्रातृयुक्तं हि तदिदं जातमन्यथा ।।
data.es: 'O dear I believe that both of us are not destined to enjoy the love and happiness that come together to brothers.

data.v: प्रतिपद्य त्वमद्यैव राज्यमेषां वनौकसाम् । मामप्यद्यैव गच्छन्तं विद्धि वैवस्वतक्षयम् ।।
जीवितं च हि राज्यं च श्रियं च विपुलामिमाम् । प्रजहाम्येष वै तूर्णं महच्चागर्हितं यशः ।।
data.es: 'I am leaving this world soon, along with this vast kingdom, prosperity and untarnished fame.

data.v: अस्यां त्वहमवस्थायां वीर वक्ष्यामि यद्वचः । यद्यप्यसुकरं राजन्कर्तुमेव तदर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O warrior king you should do whatever I request you at this hour even though it may not be easy.

data.v: सुखार्हं सुखसंवृद्धं बालमेनमबालिशम् । बाष्पपूर्णमुखं पश्य भूमौ पतितमङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: 'Look at this young Angada fallen on the ground, face flooded with tears. Raised with comfort, he deserves to be kept happy.

data.v: मम प्राणैः प्रियतरं पुत्रं पुत्रमिवौरसं । मया हीनमहीनार्थं सर्वतः परिपालय ।।
data.es: 'He is dearer to me than my life. Take care of him like your own son. He is separated from me. Take care of him in all respects, so that he is not deprived of anything.

data.v: त्वमप्यस्य हि दाता च परित्राता च सर्वतः । भयेष्वभयदश्चैव यथाहं प्लवगेश्वर ।।
