data.es: Lakshmana saw famous Sugriva, difficult to be conquered, seated on a golden throne strewn around with cushions, decorated with ornaments of different colours, endearing in appearance, decked with beautiful garlands and clothes. He was surrounded by women adorned with most fascinating ornaments and garlands. Bewildered at the sight, Lakshmana's eyes turned red in anger. He appeared like Yama, lord of death.

data.v: रुमां तु वीरः परिरभ्य गाढं; वरासनस्थो वरहेमवर्णः । ददर्श सौमित्रिमदीनसत्त्वं; विशालनेत्रः सुविशालनेत्रम् ।।
तमप्रतिहतं क्रुद्धं प्रविष्टं पुरुषर्षभम् । सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणं दृष्ट्वा बभूव व्यथितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: On seeing the angry Lakshmana, a bull among men, who could not be obstructed, enter in, Sugriva was disturbed.

data.v: क्रुद्धं निःश्वसमानं तं प्रदीप्तमिव तेजसा । भ्रातुर्व्यसनसंतप्तं दृष्ट्वा दशरथात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Seeing enraged Lakshmana, son of Dasaratha, sighing heavily, glowing like bright fire burning with the sorrow of Rama, Sugriva jumped out of his seat quitting the decorated golden throne just as Indra's decorated banner is raised up suddenly.

data.v: उत्पपात हरिश्रेष्ठो हित्वा सौवर्णमासनम् । महान्महेन्द्रस्य यथा स्वलंकृत इव ध्वजः ।।
data.es: Seeing enraged Lakshmana, son of Dasaratha, sighing heavily, glowing like bright fire burning with the sorrow of Rama, Sugriva jumped out of his seat quitting the decorated golden throne just as Indra's decorated banner is raised up suddenly.

data.v: उत्पतन्तमनूत्पेतू रुमाप्रभृतयः स्त्रियः । सुग्रीवं गगने पूर्णं चन्द्रं तारागणा इव ।।
data.es: As soon as Sugriva jumped up ,Ruma and other womenfolk rose to their feet like the clusters of stars around the fullMoon in the sky.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः श्रीमान्विचचाल कृताञ्जलिः । बभूवावस्थितस्तत्र कल्पवृक्षो महानिव ।।
data.es: With eyes red as blood through drunkenness,prosperous Sugriva was shaken like the Kalpa tree.He stood there and offered salutations(to Lakshmana) with folded hands.

data.v: रुमा द्वितीयं सुग्रीवं नारीमध्यगतं स्थितम् । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणः क्रुद्धः सतारं शशिनं यथा ।।
data.es: Looking at Sugriva surrounded by Ruma and other women like the Moon among stars, infuriated Lakshmana said

data.v: सत्त्वाभिजनसंपन्नः सानुक्रोशो जितेन्द्रियः । कृतज्ञः सत्यवादी च राजा लोके महीयते ।।
data.es: 'Only a king who is an heir to a noble family, compassionate, and selfcontrolled, grateful and truthful excels in the world.

data.v: यस्तु राजा स्थितोऽधर्मे मित्राणामुपकारिणाम् । मिथ्याप्रतिज्ञां कुरुते को नृशंसतरस्ततः ।।
data.es: 'Which king can be more malicious than the one who makes false promises and adopts an unrighteous path towards those who helped him?

data.v: शतमश्वानृते हन्ति सहस्रं तु गवानृते । आत्मानं स्वजनं हन्ति पुरुषः पुरुषानृते ।।
data.es: 'If a man tells a lie about a horse, he commits the sin of killing a hundred horses. If one tells a lie about a cow, he shares the sin of killing a thousand cows. If one tells a lie about a man, it is equal to the sin of killing oneself and his own people.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतार्थो मित्राणां न तत्प्रतिकरोति यः । कृतघ्नः सर्वभूतानां स वध्यः प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys he who, having accomplished his task first with the help of his friend, does not return the help is ungrateful. Such a person deserves to be killed.It applies to all beings.

data.v: गीतोऽयं ब्रह्मणा श्लोकः सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः । दृष्ट्वा कृतघ्नं क्रुद्धेन तं निबोध प्लवंगम ।।
data.es: 'O lord of the monkeys here is a verse worthy of appreciation by all the worlds, sung by a brahmin, when he saw an ungrateful person. Listen:

data.v: ब्रह्मघ्ने च सुरापे च चोरे भग्नव्रते तथा । निष्कृतिर्विहिता सद्भिः कृतघ्ने नास्ति निष्कृतिः ।।
data.es: 'There is expiation for one who kills a brahmin, a drunkard, a thief and a violator of sacred vows. But there is no atonement for an ungrateful man.'

data.v: अनार्यस्त्वं कृतघ्नश्च मिथ्यावादी च वानर । पूर्वं कृतार्थो रामस्य न तत्प्रतिकरोषि यत् ।।
data.es: 'O monkey you have already achieved your objective (with the help of Rama) but have not helped Rama in return. You are surely an ignoble and ungrateful liar.

data.v: ननु नाम कृतार्थेन त्वया रामस्य वानर । सीताया मार्गणे यत्नः कर्तव्यः कृतमिच्छता ।।
data.es: 'O monkey, if you are grateful to Rama you should wish to search for Sita. Indeed, you should make efforts to take it up.

data.v: स त्वं ग्राम्येषु भोगेषु सक्तो मिथ्या प्रतिश्रवः । न त्वां रामो विजानीते सर्पं मण्डूकराविणम् ।।
data.es: 'You have failed to keep your word. You are engaged in worldly pleasures. Rama did not know that you are a serpent croaking like a frog.

data.v: महाभागेन रामेण पापः करुणवेदिना । हरीणां प्रापितो राज्यं त्वं दुरात्मा महात्मना ।।
data.es: 'Rama is illustrious, compassionate and great. He has granted the kingdom to you, to one who is a sinner and an evilminded person.

data.v: कृतं चेन्नाभिजानीषे रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । सद्यस्त्वं निशितैर्बाणैर्हतो द्रक्ष्यसि वालिनम् ।।
data.es: 'If you do not recognise the help of Rama who can accomplish any deed with ease, you will be killed with my sharp arrows and meet Vali (in heaven).

data.v: न च संकुचितः पन्था येन वाली हतो गतः । समये तिष्ठ सुग्रीव मा वालिपथमन्वगाः ।।
data.es: 'The route by which Vali departed, killed by me has not been closed. O Sugriva you ought to abide by the pledge given. Do not follow the path of Vali.

data.v: न नूनमिक्ष्वाकुवरस्य कार्मुका;च्च्युताञ्शरान्पश्यसि वज्रसंनिभान् । ततः सुखं नाम निषेवसे सुखी; न रामकार्यं मनसाप्यवेक्षसे ।।
data.es: 'You have not seen the thunderboltlike arrows released from the bow of Rama, the renowned prince of the Ikshvaku race. Therefore you are resorting to enjoyment without any fear and have not given thought to Rama's work.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणं सौमित्रिं प्रदीप्तमिव तेजसा । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणं तारा ताराधिपनिभानना ।।
data.es: While Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra, was glowing like fire with his brilliance, thus spoke the moonfaced Tara:

data.v: नैवं लक्ष्मण वक्तव्यो नायं परुषमर्हति । हरीणामीश्वरः श्रोतुं तव वक्त्राद्विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana you, in particular, should not speak to the king of vanaras in that manner. He does not deserve to hear from your mouth words which are harsh.

data.v: नैवाकृतज्ञः सुग्रीवो न शठो नापि दारुणः । नैवानृतकथो वीर न जिह्मश्च कपीश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'O hero Sugriva, king of monkeys, is not ungrateful or deceitful, He is neither crooked nor false.

data.v: उपकारं कृतं वीरो नाप्ययं विस्मृतः कपिः । रामेण वीर सुग्रीवो यदन्यैर्दुष्करं रणे ।।
data.es: 'O hero this warrior Sugriva has not forgotten the help rendered by Rama in combat which was difficult (to win).

data.v: रामप्रसादात्कीर्तिं च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । प्राप्तवानिह सुग्रीवो रुमां मां च परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies it is by Rama's grace that Sugriva has attained fame, the kingdom of monkeys and Ruma and me.

data.v: सुदुःखं शायितः पूर्वं प्राप्येदं सुखमुत्तमम् । प्राप्तकालं न जानीते विश्वामित्रो यथा मुनिः ।।
data.es: 'Sleep did not come to him in deep distress in the past, and now that great happiness has come, he does not realize that it is time to act (search for Sita). He behaves like sage Viswamitra.

data.v: घृताच्यां किल संसक्तो दशवर्षाणि लक्ष्मण । अहोऽमन्यत धर्मात्मा विश्वामित्रो महामुनिः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana great sage Visvamitra was in union with an apsara Gritachi for ten years and felt it was just one day indeed

data.v: स हि प्राप्तं न जानीते कालं कालविदां वरः । विश्वामित्रो महातेजाः किं पुनर्यः पृथग्जनः ।।
data.es: 'If the brilliant and the most distinguished of those who knew the value of time did not realise the passing of time, what can be said of an ordinary person?

data.v: देहधर्मं गतस्यास्य परिश्रान्तस्य लक्ष्मण । अवितृप्तस्य कामेषु रामः क्षन्तुमिहार्हति ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana you should pardon him since he is not yet satisfied, though tired, with the struggle for the fulfilment of his sensual pleasures.

data.v: न च रोषवशं तात गन्तुमर्हसि लक्ष्मण । निश्चयार्थमविज्ञाय सहसा प्राकृतो यथा ।।
data.es: 'O dear Lakshmana not knowing the true intention of Sugriva, it is not proper for you to be rashly angry like an ordinary man.

data.v: सत्त्वयुक्ता हि पुरुषास्त्वद्विधाः पुरुषर्षभ । अविमृश्य न रोषस्य सहसा यान्ति वश्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'O bull among men men with right vision like you do not become angry instantly without right thinking.

data.v: प्रसादये त्वां धर्मज्ञ सुग्रीवार्थे समाहिता । महान्रोषसमुत्पन्नः संरम्भस्त्यज्यतामयम् ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, knower of dharma, give up your agitation arising out of great anger. Be composed for the sake of Sugriva.

data.v: रुमां मां कपिराज्यं च धनधान्यवसूनि च । रामप्रियार्थं सुग्रीवस्त्यजेदिति मतिर्मम ।।
data.es: 'I feel Sugriva should (is prepared to) renounce the monkeykingdom, wealth, grains and other treasures and even Ruma and me for the pleasure of Rama.

data.v: समानेष्व्यति सुग्रीवः सीतया सह राघवम् । शशाङ्कमिव रोहिष्या निहत्वा रावणं रणे ।।
data.es: 'Killing Ravana in war, Sugriva will restore Sita soon to Rama.Rama will join Sita like Moon joins Rohini.

data.v: शतकोटिसहस्राणि लङ्कायां किल रक्षसाम् । अयुतानि च षट्त्रिंशत्सहस्राणि शतानि च ।।
data.es: 'The number of demons in Lanka is reported to be a hundred thousand crore, three lakh, ninetynine thousand and six hundred. (Note: Indian tradition has numbers up to eighteen digits. One hundred thousand crores is equal to a 'mahapadma' which has thirteen digits. The number described here is 1000000399600.)

data.v: अहत्वा तांश्च दुर्धर्षान्राक्षसान्कामरूपिणः । न शक्यो रावणो हन्तुं येन सा मैथिली हृता ।।
data.es: 'It is not possible to kill Ravana who has stolen Sita without killing those unassailable demons who can assume any form at their will.

data.v: ते न शक्या रणे हन्तुमसहायेन लक्ष्मण । रावणः क्रूरकर्मा च सुग्रीवेण विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana moreover it is not possible for Sugriva alone to kill the wicked Ravana without the help of the monkeys.

data.v: एवमाख्यातवान्वाली स ह्यभिज्ञो हरीश्वरः । आगमस्तु न मे व्यक्तः श्रवात्तस्य ब्रवीम्यहम् ।।
data.es: Vali, the wellinformed lord of the monkeys, has given an account of the demons. The source of the account is not known to me.Therefore I am speaking from what I have heard.

data.v: त्वत्सहायनिमित्तं वै प्रेषिता हरिपुंगवाः । आनेतुं वानरान्युद्धे सुबहून्हरियूथपान् ।।
data.es: 'Monkey chiefs have been sent to bring multitudes of monkey leaders to help you in the battle.

data.v: तांश्च प्रतीक्षमाणोऽयं विक्रान्तान्सुमहाबलान् । राघवस्यार्थसिद्ध्यर्थं न निर्याति हरीश्वरः ।।
data.es: 'Sugriva is awaiting the arrival of the powerful and strong vanaras without whose help he cannot accomplish Rama's task.Therefore he has not yet started (the search).

data.v: कृता तु संस्था सौमित्रे सुग्रीवेण यथापुरा । अद्य तैर्वानरैर्सर्वैरागन्तव्यं महाबलैः ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana since Sugriva has already promulgated an ordinance to all the mighty vanaras, they should be all arriving by now.

data.v: ऋक्षकोटिसहस्राणि गोलाङ्गूलशतानि च । अद्य त्वामुपयास्यन्ति जहि कोपमरिंदम । कोट्योऽनेकास्तु काकुत्स्थ कपीनां दीप्ततेजसाम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जयभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: सससम], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसरत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यसतर]

data.v: तव हि मुखमिदं निरीक्ष्य कोपा;त्क्षतजनिभे नयने निरीक्षमाणाः । हरिवरवनिता न यान्ति शान्तिं; प्रथमभयस्य हि शङ्किताः स्म सर्वाः ।।
data.es: 'Looking at your angry countenance with bloodred eyes, the wives of the foremost of monkeys are frightened by the possibility of similar danger of the past (of Vali's death) and do not find peace of mind.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तारया वाक्यं प्रश्रितं धर्मसंहितम् । मृदुस्वभावः सौमित्रिः प्रतिजग्राह तद्वचः ।।
data.es: Thus the gentlenatured Saumitri accepted Tara's courteous words sanctioned by dharma.

data.v: तस्मिन्प्रतिगृहीते तु वाक्ये हरिगणेश्वरः । लक्ष्मणात्सुमहत्त्रासं वस्त्रं क्लिन्नमिवात्यजत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, king of the vanara clan, cast aside his great fear when Lakshmana accepted the words of Tara just as one discards a wet garment from the body.

data.v: ततः कण्ठगतं माल्यं चित्रं बहुगुणं महत् । चिच्छेद विमदश्चासीत्सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Thereupon Sugriva, relieved from his drunken state tore off the great, colourful valuable garland worn on his neck.

data.v: स लक्ष्मणं भीमबलं सर्ववानरसत्तमः । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवः संप्रहर्षयन् ।।
data.es: Seeing Sugriva had lost his senses, Lakshmana, the slayer of enemy warriors humbly said at the end of Rama's address:

data.v: प्रनष्टा श्रीश्च कीर्तिश्च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । रामप्रसादात्सौमित्रे पुनः प्राप्तमिदं मया ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri my prosperity, fame and the permanent sovereignty of vanaras had been lost. It was regained by the grace of Rama.

data.v: कः शक्तस्तस्य देवस्य ख्यातस्य स्वेन कर्मणा । तादृशं विक्रमं वीर प्रतिकर्तुमरिंदम ।।
data.es: 'O crusher of enemies how is it possible to repay the famous lord Rama's valour (in killing Vali)?

data.v: सीतां प्राप्स्यति धर्मात्मा वधिष्यति च रावणम् । सहायमात्रेण मया राघवः स्वेन तेजसा ।।
data.es: 'Righteous Rama can merely restore Sita with my assistance. By his own fiery energy he will kill Ravana.

data.v: सहायकृत्यं हि तस्य येन सप्त महाद्रुमाः । शैलश्च वसुधा चैव बाणेनैकेन दारिताः ।।
data.es: 'Rama shattered seven huge trees, a mountain and earth with a single arrow. What assistance does he need?

data.v: धनुर्विस्फारमाणस्य यस्य शब्देन लक्ष्मण । सशैला कम्पिता भूमिः सहायैस्तस्य किं नु वै ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana the twang of his bow shook even the mountains and the earth. What assistance does he need?

data.v: अनुयात्रां नरेन्द्रस्य करिष्येऽहं नरर्षभ । गच्छतो रावणं हन्तुं वैरिणं सपुरःसरम् ।।
data.es: 'O Lakshmana, bull among men I shall only join him along with others when he leads the army to kill Ravana.

data.v: यदि किंचिदतिक्रान्तं विश्वासात्प्रणयेन वा । प्रेष्यस्य क्षमितव्यं मे न कश्चिन्नापराध्यति ।।
data.es: 'If I have committed even a little transgression in my faith in Rama or affection for him and exceeded the time limit, my mistakes are to be excused as one would pardons a servant. No one is flawless in the world.'

data.v: इति तस्य ब्रुवाणस्य सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । अभवल्लक्ष्मणः प्रीतः प्रेंणा चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Having heard the great Sugriva, Rama replied with a gentle smile:

data.v: सर्वथा हि मम भ्राता सनाथो वानरेश्वर । त्वया नाथेन सुग्रीव प्रश्रितेन विशेषतः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva, king of monkeys when you are extending due courtesy to my brother,he has a guardian in you by all means.

data.v: यस्ते प्रभावः सुग्रीव यच्च ते शौचमुत्तमम् । अर्हस्तं कपिराज्यस्य श्रियं भोक्तुमनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: 'You are powerful and straightforward by nature.You are humble and noble. Therefore, you deserve the high prosperity of the kingdom of the monkeys.

data.v: सहायेन च सुग्रीव त्वया रामः प्रतापवान् । वधिष्यति रणे शत्रूनचिरान्नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva with you as associate, valiant hero Rama will kill his enemies in war very soon. There is no doubt about it.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य संग्रामेष्वनिवर्तिनः । उपपन्नं च युक्तं च सुग्रीव तव भाषितम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sugriva you know dharma.You are grateful and will not turn back from the battle. So your words are true and befitting.

data.v: दोषज्ञः सति सामर्थ्ये कोऽन्यो भाषितुमर्हति । वर्जयित्वा मम ज्येष्ठं त्वां च वानरसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys barring you and my elder brother, who else would be capable of speaking this way about themselves even when you are aware of other's faults?

data.v: सदृशश्चासि रामस्य विक्रमेण बलेन च । सहायो दैवतैर्दत्तश्चिराय हरिपुंगव ।।
data.es: 'You who are equal to Rama in valour and strength, will continue to be the gift of gods to us for long.

data.v: किं तु शीघ्रमितो वीर निष्क्राम त्वं मया सह । सान्त्वयस्व वयस्यं च भार्याहरणदुःखितम् ।।
data.es: 'Nevertheless I want you to proceed from here with me at once and reassure your friend who is agrieved due to the abduction of his wife.

data.v: यच्च शोकाभिभूतस्य श्रुत्वा रामस्य भाषितम् । मया त्वं परुषाण्युक्तस्तच्च त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामयणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysix sarga of Kishkindakanda of the Holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना । हनुमन्तं स्थितं पार्श्वे सचिवं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When the great Rama said this, Sugriva with all the four monkeys felt immeasurably glad.

data.v: महेन्द्रहिमवद्विन्ध्यकैलासशिखरेषु च । मन्दरे पाण्डुशिखरे पञ्चशैलेषु ये स्थिताः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णेषु भ्राजमानेषु सर्वशः । पर्वतेषु समुद्रान्ते पश्चिमस्यां तु ये दिशि ।।
आदित्यभवने चैव गिरौ संध्याभ्रसंनिभे । पद्मतालवनं भीमं संश्रिता हरिपुंगवाः ।।
अञ्जनाम्बुदसंकाशाः कुञ्जरप्रतिमौजसः । अञ्जने परते चैव ये वसन्ति प्लवंगमाः ।।
मनःशिला गुहावासा वानराः कनकप्रभाः । मेरुपार्श्वगताश्चैव ये च धूम्रगिरिं श्रिताः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णाश्च पर्वते ये महारुणे । पिबन्तो मधुमैरेयं भीमवेगाः प्लवंगमाः ।।
वनेषु च सुरम्येषु सुगन्धिषु महत्सु च । तापसानां च रम्येषु वनान्तेषु समन्ततः ।।
तांस्तांस्त्वमानय क्षिप्रं पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् । सामदानादिभिः कल्पैराशु प्रेषय वानरान् ।।
प्रेषिताः प्रथमं ये च मया दूता महाजवाः । त्वरणार्थं तु भूयस्त्वं हरीन्संप्रेषयापरान् ।।
data.es: 'This is in addition to the monkeys for whom swiftfooted messengers have already been sent.

data.v: ये प्रसक्ताश्च कामेषु दीर्घसूत्राश्च वानराः । इहानयस्व तान्सर्वाञ्शीघ्रं तु मम शासनात् ।।
data.es: 'Get all the monkeys including those engaged in carnal pleasures and those slow in movement all at once on my command.

data.v: अहोभिर्दशभिर्ये च नागच्छन्ति ममाज्ञया । हन्तव्यास्ते दुरात्मानो राजशासनदूषकाः ।।
data.es: 'Kill those evilminded ones within ten days for disobeying the royal orders.

data.v: शतान्यथ सहस्राणि कोट्यश्च मम शासनात् । प्रयान्तु कपिसिंहानां दिशो मम मते स्थिताः ।।
data.es: 'The hundreds of thousands of crores of obedient lionlike monkeys should proceed in all directions at my command.

data.v: मेघपर्वतसंकाशाश्छादयन्त इवाम्बरम् । घोररूपाः कपिश्रेष्ठा यान्तु मच्छासनादितः ।।
data.es: 'Fierce monkeys, comparable to clouds and mountains in appearance shall go as though covering the sky from here at my command.

data.v: ते गतिज्ञा गतिं गत्वा पृथिव्यां सर्ववानराः । आनयन्तु हरीन्सर्वांस्त्वरिताः शासनान्मम ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders from all over the earth arrived quickly, leading the hordes of them.

data.v: तस्य वानरराजस्य श्रुत्वा वायुसुतो वचः । दिक्षु सर्वासु विक्रान्तान्प्रेषयामास वानरान् ।।
data.es: Having heard Sugriva's command, Hanuman, son of the Windgod, sent powerful monkeys in all directions.

data.v: ते पदं विष्णुविक्रान्तं पतत्रिज्योतिरध्वगाः । प्रयाताः प्रहिता राज्ञा हरयस्तत्क्षणेन वै ।।
data.es: The monkeys ordered by the king, traversed the pathway of birds and heavenly bodies, the path Lord Visnu had trod. [Note: the sky is called Vishnupada since Lord Visnu set his foot on the sky in his incarnation as Vamana.]

data.v: ते समुद्रेषु गिरिषु वनेषु च सरित्सु च । वानरा वानरान्सर्वान्रामहेतोरचोदयन् ।।
data.es: The messenger monkeys drove in all those living on the sea shore, mountains, forests as well as banks of lakes in order to serve the cause of Rama.

data.v: मृत्युकालोपमस्याज्ञां राजराजस्य वानराः । सुग्रीवस्याययुः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवभयदर्शिनः ।।
data.es: In response to the command of the king, who was like death to them, the monkeys came at once, driven by fear from Sugriva.

data.v: ततस्तेऽञ्जनसंकाशा गिरेस्तस्मान्महाजवाः । तिस्रः कोट्यः प्लवंगानां निर्ययुर्यत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: Then three crores of swiftfooted monkeys, dark like collyrium, rushed forth to the mountain to meet Rama.

data.v: अस्तं गच्छति यत्रार्कस्तस्मिन्गिरिवरे रताः । तप्तहेमसमाभासास्तस्मात्कोट्यो दशच्युताः ।।
data.es: Ten crores of monkeys shining like pure molten gold, staying on the best of mountains where the Sun sets moved towards Kishkinda.

data.v: कैलास शिखरेभ्यश्च सिंहकेसरवर्चसाम् । ततः कोटिसहस्राणि वानराणामुपागमन् ।।
data.es: From the peaks of Kailasa mountain moved out one thousand crores of monkeys who were of bright colour like the lion's mane.

data.v: फलमूलेन जीवन्तो हिमवन्तमुपाश्रिताः । तेषां कोटिसहस्राणां सहस्रं समवर्तत ।।
data.es: Then monkeys residing at mount Himavan feeding on fruits and roots came in thousands of crores. (This number is called Shankha 1000,000,000,000,0, it is one digit higher than Mahapadma.)

data.v: अङ्गारक समानानां भीमानां भीमकर्मणाम् । विन्ध्याद्वानरकोटीनां सहस्राण्यपतन्द्रुतम् ।।
data.es: From the Vindhya mountain came down thousands of crores of swiftfooted monkeys of terrific deeds. They were fierce like fire (Angaraka).

data.v: क्षीरोदवेलानिलयास्तमालवनवासिनः । नारिकेलाशनाश्चैव तेषां संख्या न विद्यते ।।
data.es: The monkeys residents of Tamala forest on the shores of the ocean of milk feeding on coconuts arrived from the groves in countless number.

data.v: वनेभ्यो गह्वरेभ्यश्च सरिद्भ्यश्च महाजवाः । आगच्छद्वानरी सेना पिबन्तीव दिवाकरम् ।।
data.es: An army of swiftmoving monkeys came from the caves, from the banks of rivers and forests as though it was swallowing up the Sungod.

data.v: ये तु त्वरयितुं याता वानराः सर्ववानरान् । ते वीरा हिमवच्छैलं ददृशुस्तं महाद्रुमम् ।।
data.es: The monkeys sent earlier to hasten all their counterparts saw mount Himavat from the great tree.

data.v: तस्मिन्गिरिवरे रम्ये यज्ञो महेश्वरः पुरा । सर्वदेवमनस्तोषो बभौ दिव्यो मनोहरः ।।
data.es: A divine, wonderful, delightful Yagna dedicated to Lord Siva used to be performed on the beautiful (Himalayan) mountain in the past so that the minds of all deities were satisfied.

data.v: अन्नविष्यन्दजातानि मूलानि च फलानि च । अमृतस्वादुकल्पानि ददृशुस्तत्र वानराः ।।
data.es: There the monkeys saw the Yajna, and partook the fruits and roots produced out of the havis which tasted sweet like nectar.

data.v: तदन्न संभवं दिव्यं फलं मूलं मनोहरम् । यः कश्चित्सकृदश्नाति मासं भवति तर्पितः ।।
data.es: Any one who shares even a little of the divine, delicious fruits and roots grown out of that havis will have no hunger or thirst for a month.

data.v: तानि मूलानि दिव्यानि फलानि च फलाशनाः । औषधानि च दिव्यानि जगृहुर्हरियूथपाः ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders who lived on fruits collected the divine fruits, roots as well as medicinal herbs.

data.v: तस्माच्च यज्ञायतनात्पुष्पाणि सुरभीणि च । आनिन्युर्वानरा गत्वा सुग्रीवप्रियकारणात् ।।
data.es: The monkeys also collected finesmelling flowers from the sacrificial altar to please Sugriva with.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे हरिवराः पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् । संचोदयित्वा त्वरितं यूथानां जग्मुरग्रतः ।।
data.es: The monkey leaders from all over the earth arrived quickly, leading the hordes of them.

data.v: ते तु तेन मुहूर्तेन यूथपाः शीघ्रकारिणः । किष्किन्धां त्वरया प्राप्ताः सुग्रीवो यत्र वानरः ।।
data.es: In a short while the swiftmoving leaders of the monkeys groups reached Kishkinda quickly.

data.v: ते गृहीत्वौषधीः सर्वाः फलं मूलं च वानराः । तं प्रतिग्राहयामासुर्वचनं चेदमब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: Offering all kinds of medicinal herbs, fruits and roots collected, to Sugriva the monkeys said:

data.v: सर्वे परिगताः शैलाः समुद्राश्च वनानि च । पृथिव्यां वानराः सर्वे शासनादुपयान्ति ते ।।
एवं श्रुत्वा ततो हृष्टः सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । प्रतिजग्राह च प्रीतस्तेषां सर्वमुपायनम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the report from the monkeys, Sugriva the king of vanaras, accepted all the gifts they had brought him, with great pleasure.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, of the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तत्सर्वमुपानयमुपाहृतम् । वानरान्सान्त्वयित्वा च सर्वानेव व्यसर्जयत् ।।
data.es: On receiving all the gifts presented by the monkeys, Sugriva permitted them to go happy.

data.v: विसर्जयित्वा स हरीञ्शूरांस्तान्कृतकर्मणः । मेने कृतार्थमात्मानं राघवं च महाबलम् ।।
data.es: The monkey heroes sent by Sugriva performed the task assigned to them and felt powerful Rama's task has been achieved (a successful beginning has been made).

data.v: स लक्ष्मणो भीमबलं सर्ववानरसत्तमम् । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सुग्रीवं संप्रहर्षयन् । किष्किन्धाया विनिष्क्राम यदि ते सौम्य रोचते ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जतयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: यनतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरयम], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततम]

data.es: Sugriva, the noblest of all monkeys, spoke these polite words in a pleasing manner to Lakshmana of terrific strength:

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणस्य सुभाषितम् । सुग्रीवः परमप्रीतो वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Sugriva, very much pleased with the words of Rama, spoke highly (of him).

data.v: एवं भवतु गच्छामः स्थेयं त्वच्छासने मया । तमेवमुक्त्वा सुग्रीवो लक्ष्मणं शुभलक्ष्मणम् ।।
विसर्जयामास तदा तारामन्याश्च योषितः । एतेत्युच्चैर्हरिवरान्सुग्रीवः समुदाहरत् ।।
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हरयः शीघ्रमाययुः । बद्धाञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वे ये स्युः स्त्रीदर्शनक्षमाः ।।
data.es: Sugriva called in the monkeys who deserved audience of the female folk of the royal family. They came forward quickly with folded hands welcoming the heroes.

data.v: तानुवाच ततः प्राप्तान्राजार्कसदृशप्रभः । उपस्थापयत क्षिप्रं शिबिकां मम वानराः ।।
data.es: Then seeing the monkeys who had come there, king Sugriva who was shining like the Sungod asked them to get a palanquin ready at once.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तस्य हरयः शीघ्रविक्रमाः । समुपस्थापयामासुः शिबिकां प्रियदर्शनाम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the king, the monkeys who were quick to act placed a beautiful palanquin in front of him.

data.v: तामुपस्थापितां दृष्ट्वा शिबिकां वानराधिपः । लक्ष्मणारुह्यतां शीघ्रमिति सौमित्रिमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the palanquin placed in front of Sugriva, the chief of the monkeys requested Lakshmana to get in quickly.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा काञ्चनं यानं सुग्रीवः सूर्यसंनिभम् । बृहद्भिर्हरिभिर्युक्तमारुरोह सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: With this Sugriva, shining like the Sungod, entered along with Lakshmana the golden palanquin carried by ablebodied monkeys.

data.v: पाण्डुरेणातपत्रेण ध्रियमाणेन मूर्धनि । शुक्लैश्च बालव्यजनैर्धूयमानैः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: With a pale white umbrella over his head, white yaktail fans and sounds of conches and drums, Sugriva set out receiving greetings from monkeys, rejoicing in his royal glory.

data.v: शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च बन्दिभिश्चाभिवन्दितः । निर्ययौ प्राप्य सुग्रीवो राज्यश्रियमनुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: With a pale white umbrella over his head, white yaktail fans and sounds of conches and drums, Sugriva set out receiving greetings from monkeys, rejoicing in his royal glory.

data.v: स वानरशतैस्तीष्क्णैर्बहुभिः शस्त्रपाणिभिः । परिकीर्णो ययौ तत्र यत्र रामो व्यवस्थितः ।।
data.es: Surrounded by hundreds of monkeys wielding various sharp weapons, Sugriva went forth to the region where Rama resided৷৷

data.v: स तं देशमनुप्राप्य श्रेष्ठं रामनिषेवितम् । अवातरन्महातेजाः शिबिकायाः सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Having reached the place where Rama lived, brilliant Sugriva along with Lakshmana descended from the palanquin.

data.v: आसाद्य च ततो रामं कृताञ्जलिपुटोऽभवत् । कृताञ्जलौ स्थिते तस्मिन्वानराश्चभवंस्तथा ।।
data.es: Thereafter Sugriva followed by the monkeys approached Rama, and stood with folded hands.

data.v: तटाकमिव तद्दृष्ट्वा रामः कुड्मलपङ्कजम् । वानराणां महत्सैन्यं सुग्रीवे प्रीतिमानभूत् ।।
data.es: Rama was pleased on beholding the great army of monkeys standing, resembling a pond full of lotus buds.

data.v: पादयोः पतितं मूर्ध्ना तमुत्थाप्य हरीश्वरम् । प्रेंणा च बहुमानाच्च राघवः परिषस्वजे ।।
data.es: Sugriva touched Rama's feet, bending his head down, and Rama lifted him up and embraced him with love and great regard.

data.v: परिष्वज्य च धर्मात्मा निषीदेति ततोऽब्रवीत् । तं निषण्णं ततो दृष्ट्वा क्षितौ रामोऽब्रवीद्वचः ।।
data.es: Embracing him, Rama offered him a seat on the ground and said:

data.v: धर्ममर्थं च कामं च काले यस्तु निषेवते । विभज्य सततं वीर स राजा हरिसत्तम ।।
data.es: 'O best among the heroic monkeys, a king who apportions his time properly towards pursuit of dharma, artha and kama is a hero and deserves to be a king.

data.v: हित्वा धर्मं तथार्थं च कामं यस्तु निषेवते । स वृक्षाग्रे यथा सुप्तः पतितः प्रतिबुध्यते ।।
data.es: 'One who neglects dharma and artha and pursues only kama (sensuous enjoyment) is like a man asleep on top of the tree, waking up only to realize that he has fallen down.

data.v: अमित्राणां वधे युक्तो मित्राणां संग्रहे रतः । त्रिवर्गफलभोक्ता तु राजा धर्मेण युज्यते ।।
उद्योगसमयस्त्वेष प्राप्तः शत्रुविनाशन । संचिन्त्यतां हि पिङ्गेश हरिभिः सह मन्त्रिभिः ।।
data.es: 'O king of monkeys, slayer of enemies the time to act has arrived. Think of the strategies with your ministers and other monkeys.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो रामं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Rama in deep distress, the monkey replied to him with folded hands, his throat choked with tears:

data.v: प्रनष्टा श्रीश्च कीर्तिश्च कपिराज्यं च शाश्वतम् । त्वत्प्रसादान्महाबाहो पुनः प्राप्तमिदं मया ।।
data.es: 'O Saumitri my prosperity, fame and the permanent sovereignty of vanaras had been lost. It was regained by the grace of Rama.

data.v: तव देवप्रसदाच्च भ्रातुश्च जयतां वर । कृतं न प्रतिकुर्याद्यः पुरुषाणां स दूषकः ।।
data.es: 'O victorious lord he who does not repay the help got through your grace and your brother's is despicable among men.

data.v: एते वानरमुख्याश्च शतशः शत्रुसूदन । प्राप्ताश्चादाय बलिनः पृथिव्यां सर्ववानरान् ।।
data.es: 'O destroyer of enemies hundreds of strong vanara chiefs gathered from all over the earth have reached here.

data.v: ऋक्षाश्चावहिताः शूरा गोलाङ्गूलाश्च राघव । कान्तार वनदुर्गाणामभिज्ञा घोरदर्शनाः ।।
data.es: 'O Rama valiant bears of fierce appearance, also golangulas (a variety of monkeys with tails like cows') familiar with the inaccessible fortresses of forest have come. These monkeys are sons of divine beings and gandharvas who can assume any form at will. They are on their way along with their armies.

data.v: देवगन्धर्वपुत्राश्च वानराः कामरूपिणः । स्वैः स्वैः परिवृताः सैन्यैर्वर्तन्ते पथि राघव ।।
data.es: 'O Rama valiant bears of fierce appearance, also golangulas (a variety of monkeys with tails like cows') familiar with the inaccessible fortresses of forest have come. These monkeys are sons of divine beings and gandharvas who can assume any form at will. They are on their way along with their armies.

data.v: शतैः शतसहस्रैश्च कोटिभिश्च प्लवंगमाः । अयुतैश्चावृता वीरा शङ्कुभिश्च परंतप ।।
अर्बुदैरर्बुदशतैर्मध्यैश्चान्तैश्च वानराः । समुद्रैश्च परार्धैश्च हरयो हरियूथपाः ।।
आगमिष्यन्ति ते राजन्महेन्द्रसमविक्रमाः । मेरुमन्दरसंकाशा विन्ध्यमेरुकृतालयाः ।।
ते त्वामभिगमिष्यन्ति राक्षसं ये सबान्धवम् । निहत्य रावणं संख्ये ह्यानयिष्यन्ति मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'The monkeys who can kill ogre Ravana and his relatives in battle and bring back Maithili will be arriving shortly.

data.v: ततस्तमुद्योगमवेक्ष्य बुद्धिमा;न्हरिप्रवीरस्य निदेशवर्तिनः । बभूव हर्षाद्वसुधाधिपात्मजः; प्रबुद्धनीलोत्पलतुल्यदर्शनः ।।
data.es: The wise statesman, Rama observing the efforts of Sugriva and his attendants looked like a blooming blue lotus through delight.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends of thirtyeighth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana, composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । बाहुभ्यां संपरिष्वज्य प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलिम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Sugriva who stood with folded hands, Rama, the foremost among the upholders of righteousness, hugged him and said:

data.v: यदिन्द्रो वर्षते वर्षं न तच्चित्रं भवेद्भुवि । आदित्यो वा सहस्रांशुः कुर्याद्वितिमिरं नभः ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, gentle Sugriva it will not be strange if Indra showers rain, if the Sun in the sky dispels darkness with his thousand rays, and if the Moon cools down the earth with his light, and a person like you helps his friend.

data.v: चन्द्रमा रश्मिभिः कुर्यात्पृथिवीं सौम्य निर्मलाम् । त्वद्विधो वापि मित्राणां प्रतिकुर्यात्परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, gentle Sugriva it will not be strange if Indra showers rain, if the Sun in the sky dispels darkness with his thousand rays, and if the Moon cools down the earth with his light, and a person like you helps his friend.

data.v: एवं त्वयि न तच्चित्रं भवेद्यत्सौम्य शोभनम् । जानाम्यहं त्वां सुग्रीव सततं प्रियवादिनम् ।।
data.es: 'O gentle Sugriva this your help to me is not surprising. You always help your friends and speak in a pleasing manner.

data.v: त्वत्सनाथः सखे संख्ये जेतास्मि सकलानरीन् । त्वमेव मे सुहृन्मित्रं साहाय्यं कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O friend I will win over all enemies in war supported by you.You are a goodhearted friend and you alone should help me.

data.v: जहारात्मविनाशाय वैदेहीं राक्षसाधमः । वञ्चयित्वा तु पौलोमीमनुह्लादो यथा शचीम् ।।
data.es: Just as Anuhlada (son of Hiranyakasipu and brother of Prahlada) took away, Poulomi (Sachi, daughter of Puloma) deceiving Indra, this lowly demon took away Sita, daughter of the king of Videha.

data.v: नचिरात्तं हनिष्यामि रावणं निशितैः शरैः । पौलोम्याः पितरं दृप्तं शतक्रतुरिवारिहा ।।
data.es: 'I will kill Ravana with my sharp arrows just as Indra, (who had done a hundred sacrifices) killed the proud father of Poulomi.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे चैव रजः समभिवर्तत । उष्णां तीव्रां सहस्रांशोश्छादयद्गगने प्रभाम् ।।
data.es: In the mean while the dust raised (by army of monkeys) all over obscured the intense heat from the sky and the radiance of the thousandrayed Sun.

data.v: दिशः पर्याकुलाश्चासन्रजसा तेन मूर्छिताः । चचाल च मही सर्वा सशैलवनकानना ।।
data.es: By the spreading of dust, the quarters were not visible.The earth including the mountains gardens and forests was shaken up.

data.v: ततो नगेन्द्रसंकाशैस्तीक्ष्ण दंष्ट्रैर्महाबलैः । कृत्स्ना संछादिता भूमिरसंख्येयैः प्लवंगमैः ।।
निमेषान्तरमात्रेण ततस्तैर्हरियूथपैः । कोटीशतपरीवारैः कामरूपिभिरावृता ।।
नादेयैः पार्वतीयैश्च सामुद्रैश्च महाबलैः । हरिभिर्मेघनिर्ह्रादैरन्यैश्च वनचारिभिः ।।
तरुणादित्यवर्णैश्च शशिगौरैश्च वानरैः । पद्मकेसरवर्णैश्च श्वेतैर्मेरुकृतालयैः ।।
कोटीसहस्रैर्दशभिः श्रीमान्परिवृतस्तदा । वीरः शतबलिर्नाम वानरः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Then appeared the glorious warrior named Satavali, followed by ten thousand crore of monkeys.

data.v: ततः काञ्चनशैलाभस्ताराया वीर्यवान्पिता । अनेकैर्दशसाहस्रैः कोटिभिः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: (Next came) the valiant father of Tara of golden complexion like mount Meru followed by ten thousand crore of vanaras.

data.v: पद्मकेसरसंकाशस्तरुणार्कनिभाननः । बुद्धिमान्वानरश्रेष्ठः सर्ववानरसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Then arrived Kesari, the wise and illustrious monkey, foremost and the best among vanaras, father of Hanuman. He was of the colour of lotus filaments and his countenance was red like the early morning Sun. He was accompanied by many thousands of monkeys.

data.v: अनीकैर्बहुसाहस्रैर्वानराणां समन्वितः । पिता हनुमतः श्रीमान्केसरी प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Then arrived Kesari, the wise and illustrious monkey, foremost and the best among vanaras, father of Hanuman. He was of the colour of lotus filaments and his countenance was red like the early morning Sun. He was accompanied by many thousands of monkeys.

data.v: गोलाङ्गूलमहाराजो गवाक्षो भीमविक्रमः । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण वानराणामदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Next arrived Gavaksha, king of Langurs (whose tail resembled the cow's), of fierceful courage surrounded by a thousand crore of vanaras.

data.v: ऋक्षाणां भीमवेगानां धूम्रः शत्रुनिबर्हणः । वृतः कोटिसहस्राभ्यां द्वाभ्यां समभिवर्तत ।।
data.es: Dhumra, destroyer of enemies, came next followed by two thousand crore of bears of terrible speed.

data.v: महाचलनिभैर्घोरैः पनसो नाम यूथपः । आजगाम महावीर्यस्तिसृभिः कोटिभिर्वृतः ।।
data.es: Similarly, the great warrior named Panasa, leader of the troop, reported with three crore dreadful vanaras of the size of huge mountains.

data.v: नीलाञ्जनचयाकारो नीलो नामाथ यूथपः । अदृश्यत महाकायः कोटिभिर्दशभिर्वृतः ।।
data.es: Then appeared Nila of huge body, dark like a mountain of collyrium accompanied by ten crore vanaras.

data.v: दरीमुखश्च बलवान्यूथपोऽभ्याययौ तदा । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण सुग्रीवं समुपस्थितः ।।
data.es: Then the strong Darimukha, leader of a thousand crore monkeys approached Sugriva.

data.v: मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चोभावश्विपुत्रौ महावलौ । कोटिकोटिसहस्रेण वानराणामदृश्यताम् ।।
data.es: Two very powerful sons of Asvini, Mainda and Dvivida, appeared with a thousand crore vanaras.

data.v: ततः कोटिसहस्राणां सहस्रेण शतेन च । पृष्ठतोऽनुगतः प्राप्तो हरिभिर्गन्धमादनः ।।
data.es: Then came Gandhamadana with a hundred thousand crore of vanaras following him.

data.v: ततः पद्मसहस्रेण वृतः शङ्कुशतेन च । युवराजोऽङ्गदः प्राप्तः पितृतुल्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Then arrived the heir apparent, Angada, whose prowess is comparable to that of his father with him came a thousand padmas and a hundred sankus of followers.

data.v: ततस्ताराद्युतिस्तारो हरिर्भीमपराक्रमः । पञ्चभिर्हरिकोटीभिर्दूरतः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: And Tara (brother of Ruma's father) of terrific valour shining like a star showed up at a distance with five crore vanaras.

data.v: इन्द्रजानुः कपिर्वीरो यूथपः प्रत्यदृश्यत । एकादशानां कोटीनामीश्वरस्तैश्च संवृतः ।।
data.es: Then Indrajanu the troop leader and chief of vanaras appeared along with eleven crore monkeys.

data.v: ततो रम्भस्त्वनुप्राप्तस्तरुणादित्यसंनिभः । अयुतेन वृतश्चैव सहस्रेण शतेन च ।।
data.es: Thereafter Rambha of the colour of the rising Sun brought together an army of one thousand and one hundred ayuta troops.

data.v: ततो यूथपतिर्वीरो दुर्मुखो नाम वानरः । प्रत्यदृश्यत कोटिभ्यां द्वाभ्यां परिवृतो बली ।।
data.es: Thereafter the mighty hero, leader of the troop, by name Durmukha appeared with two crore vanaras.

data.v: कैलासशिखराकारैर्वानरैर्भीमविक्रमैः । वृतः कोटिसहस्रेण हनुमान्प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Next arrived Gavaksha, king of Langurs (whose tail resembled the cow's), of fierceful courage surrounded by a thousand crore of vanaras.

data.v: नलश्चापि महावीर्यः संवृतो द्रुमवासिभिः । कोटीशतेन संप्राप्तः सहस्रेण शतेन च ।।
data.es: Valiant Nala also arrived surrounded by a hundred crore and a hundred thousand treedwellers (monkeys).

data.v: शरभः कुमुदो वह्निर्वानरो रम्भ एव च । एते चान्ये च बहवो वानराः कामरूपिणः ।।
आवृत्य पृथिवीं सर्वां पर्वतांश्च वनानि च । आप्लवन्तः प्लवन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवंगमाः । अभ्यवर्तन्त सुग्रीवं सूर्यमभ्रगणा इव ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जजतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: मरयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: यतभभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: तसमज]

data.es: The monkeys came leaping, jumping and roaring in enthusiasm and surrounded Sugriva just as clouds surround the Sun.

data.v: कुर्वाणा बहुशब्दांश्च प्रहृष्टा बलशालिनः । शिरोभिर्वानरेन्द्राय सुग्रीवाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.es: The leaders of monkeys possesing sturdy shoulders made many kinds of noises and reported to Sugriva, bending their heads in reverence.

data.v: अपरे वानरश्रेष्ठाः संगम्य च यथोचितम् । सुग्रीवेण समागम्य स्थिताः प्राञ्जलयस्तदा ।।
data.es: Thereafter the vanaras came close to Sugriva freely and on reaching him stood, offering salutations with folded hands.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्त्वरितो रामे सर्वांस्तान्वानरर्षभान् । निवेदयित्वा धर्मज्ञः स्थितः प्राञ्जलिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, knower of dharma, at once presented all the prominent vanaras to Rama, and standing with folded hands said.

data.v: यथा सुखं पर्वतनिर्झरेषु; वनेषु सर्वेषु च वानरेन्द्राः । निवेशयित्वा विधिवद्बलानि; बलं बलज्ञः प्रतिपत्तुमीष्टे ।।
data.es: Sugriva told the chiefs to station the forces by the side of swift mountain streams, in forests, and hills and ascertain their exact number.इत्यार्ष श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: अथ राजा समृद्धार्थः सुग्रीवः प्लवगेश्वरः । उवाच नरशार्दूलं रामं परबलार्दनम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, lord of monkeys, who was supported by a massive army informed Rama, the tiger among men and a crusher of the enemy army

data.v: आगता विनिविष्टाश्च बलिनः कामरूपिणः । वानरेन्द्रा महेन्द्राभा ये मद्विषयवासिनः ।।
data.es: 'The vanaras living in my kingdom have come and have settled down. They are strong and huge like elephants and they can assume any form at will.

data.v: त इमे बहुसाहस्रैर्हरिभिर्भीमविक्रमैः । आगता वानरा घोरा दैत्यदानवसंनिभाः ।।
data.es: 'Dreadful monkeys, powerful monkeys of fierce valour who resemble demons in form, have arrived.

data.v: ख्यातकर्मापदानाश्च बलवन्तो जितक्लमाः । पराक्रमेषु विख्याता व्यवसायेषु चोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Powerful vanaras who have earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, those who are indefatigable and wellknown for their valour having gained preeminence through their efforts and living on several mountains, those who can move on the earth as well as water, crores of them have arrived.

data.v: पृथिव्यम्बुचरा राम नानानगनिवासिनः । कोट्यग्रश इमे प्राप्ता वानरास्तव किंकराः ।।
data.es: Powerful vanaras who have earned fame for their valiant deeds in the past, those who are indefatigable and wellknown for their valour having gained preeminence through their efforts and living on several mountains, those who can move on the earth as well as water, crores of them have arrived.

data.v: निदेशवर्तिनः सर्वे सर्वे गुरुहिते रताः । अभिप्रेतमनुष्ठातुं तव शक्ष्यन्त्यरिंदम ।।
data.es: 'O Rama,the subduer of foes all of them will follow your command.They are engaged in seeking the wellbeing of elders and can fulfil your wish.

data.v: यन्मन्यसे नरव्याघ्र प्राप्तकालं तदुच्यताम् । तत्सैन्यं त्वद्वशे युक्तमाज्ञापयितुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among men announce the proper time for action. This army is at your command. Command them.

data.v: काममेषामिदं कार्यं विदितं मम तत्त्वतः । तथापि तु यथा तत्त्वमाज्ञापयितुमर्हसि ।।
तथा ब्रुवाणं सुग्रीवं रामो दशरथात्मजः । बाहुभ्यां संपरिष्वज्य इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Sugriva who stood with folded hands, Rama, the foremost among the upholders of righteousness, hugged him and said:

data.v: ज्ञायतां सौम्य वैदेही यदि जीवति वा न वा । स च देशो महाप्राज्ञ यस्मिन्वसति रावणः ।।
data.es: 'O wise warrior I wish to know whether Vaidehi is alive or not. Let the kingdom of Ravana be found out.

data.v: अधिगम्य च वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । प्राप्तकालं विधास्यामि तस्मिन्काले सह त्वया ।।
data.es: 'On locating Vaidehi in the kingdom of Ravana I shall take up proper course of action in conjunction with you.

data.v: नाहमस्मिन्प्रभुः कार्ये वानरेश न लक्ष्मणः । त्वमस्य हेतुः कार्यस्य प्रभुश्च प्लवगेश्वर ।।
data.es: 'O lord of monkeys neither I nor my brother Lakshmana should command the monkeys. You are the right person to do it.

data.v: त्वमेवाज्ञापय विभो मम कार्यविनिश्चयम् । त्वं हि जानासि यत्कार्यं मम वीर न संशयः ।।
data.es: 'O king you have understood the task to be performed and, therefore, issue orders without the least hesitation.

data.v: सुहृद्द्वितीयो विक्रान्तः प्राज्ञः कालविशेषवित् । भवानस्मद्धिते युक्तः सुकृतार्थोऽर्थवित्तमः ।।
data.es: 'You are my second friend (Lakshmana being the first). You are valiant as well as wise. You are aware of timely action. You are interested in my wellbeing. You are capable. You know my purpose. You are a startegic planner'. (The present purpose is to plan the course of action. That is artha. Sugriva knows this artha very well).

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सुग्रीवो विनतं नाम यूथपम् । अब्रवीद्राम साम्निध्ये लक्ष्मणस्य च धीमतः । शैलाभं मेघनिर्घोषमूर्जितं प्लवगेश्वरम् ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयम], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततम], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररतय]

data.es: 'In response to Rama's desire, Sugriva beckoned a troopleader called Vinata who was wellbuilt and lofty like a mountain. And thundering like a cloud, said to him in the presence of Rama and wise Lakshmana:

data.v: सोमसूर्यात्मजैः सार्धं वानरैर्वानरोत्तम । देशकालनयैर्युक्तः कार्याकार्यविनिश्चये ।।
data.es: 'O foremost of the vanaras march forward with the sons of Moon and Sun, followed by one lakh swift monkeys towards the eastern direction full of mountains, gardens, and forests. Endowed with political wisdom, you are capable of taking right decision in accordance with time and place.

data.v: वृतः शतसहस्रेण वानराणां तरस्विनाम् । अधिगच्छ दिशं पूर्वां सशैलवनकाननाम् ।।
data.es: 'O foremost of the vanaras march forward with the sons of Moon and Sun, followed by one lakh swift monkeys towards the eastern direction full of mountains, gardens, and forests. Endowed with political wisdom, you are capable of taking right decision in accordance with time and place.

data.v: तत्र सीतां च वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । मार्गध्वं गिरिदुर्गेषु वनेषु च नदीषु च ।।
data.es: 'Search for Sita in the abode of Ravana, on mountain peaks and river banks and in forests.

data.v: नदीं भागीरथीं रम्यां सरयूं कौशिकीं तथा । कालिन्दीं यमुनां रम्यां यामुनं च महागिरिम् ।।
सरस्वतीं च सिन्धुं च शोणं मणिनिभोदकम् । महीं कालमहीं चैव शैलकाननशोभिताम् ।।
ब्रह्ममालान्विदेहांश्च मालवान्काशिकोसलान् । मागधांश्च महाग्रामान्पुण्ड्रान्वङ्गांस्तथैव च ।।
पत्तनं कोशकाराणां भूमिं च रजताकराम् । सर्वमेतद्विचेतव्यं मृगयद्भिर्ततस्ततः ।।
रामस्य दयितां भार्यां सीतां दशरतः स्नुषाम् । समुद्रमवगाढांश्च पर्वतान्पत्तनानि च ।।
मन्दरस्य च ये कोटिं संश्रिताः केचिदायताम् । कर्णप्रावरणाश्चैव तथा चाप्योष्ठकर्णकाः ।।
घोरा लोहमुखाश्चैव जवनाश्चैकपादकाः । अक्षया बलवन्तश्च पुरुषाः पुरुषादकाः ।।
किराताः कर्णचूडाश्च हेमाङ्गाः प्रियदर्शनाः । आममीनाशनास्तत्र किराता द्वीपवासिनः ।।
अन्तर्जलचरा घोरा नरव्याघ्रा इति श्रुताः । एतेषामालयाः सर्वे विचेयाः काननौकसः ।।
गिरिभिर्ये च गम्यन्ते प्लवनेन प्लवेन च । रत्नवन्तं यवद्वीपं सप्तराज्योपशोभितम् ।।
सुवर्णरूप्यकं चैव सुवर्णाकरमण्डितम् । यवद्वीपमतिक्रम्य शिशिरो नाम पर्वतः ।।
दिवं स्पृशति शृङ्गेण देवदानवसेवितः । एतेषां गिरिदुर्गेषु प्रतापेषु वनेषु च ।।
रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः । ततः समुद्रद्वीपांश्च सुभीमान्द्रष्टुमर्हथ ।।
तत्रासुरा महाकायाश्छायां गृह्णन्ति नित्यशः । ब्रह्मणा समनुज्ञाता दीर्घकालं बुभुक्षिताः ।।
data.es: 'Demons of huge bodies catch the shadows of passersby in that place as they have been hungry for long and have the permission of Brahma to do so.

data.v: तं कालमेघप्रतिमं महोरगनिषेवितम् । अभिगम्य महानादं तीर्थेनैव महोदधिम् ।।

data.es: 'You would see there a house of Garuda constructed by Visvakarma. It looks like the Kailasa mountain and is adorned with different kinds of gems.

data.v: तत्र शैलनिभा भीमा मन्देहा नाम राक्षसाः । शैलशृङ्गेषु लम्बन्ते नानारूपा भयावहाः ।।
data.es: 'There are frightening demons called Mandehas of different forms, fearsome as huge mountains hanging down the mountain peaks.

data.v: ते पतन्ति जले नित्यं सूर्यस्योदयनं प्रति । अभितप्ताश्च सूर्येण लम्बन्ते स्म पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Those demons keep dropping down in water at the time of Sunrise every day, by the power of Gayatri mantras recited by brahmins scorched by the heat of the Sun. Again and again they keep hanging on to the cliffs.

data.v: ततः पाण्डुरमेघाभं क्षीरौदं नाम सागरम् । गता द्रक्ष्यथ दुर्धर्षा मुखा हारमिवोर्मिभिः ।।
data.es: 'You who are unassailable by the enemies, will see the milky ocean appearing like clouds, resembling a pearl necklace with its rows of waves.

data.v: तस्य मध्ये महाश्वेत ऋषभो नाम पर्वतः । दिव्यगन्धैः कुसुमितै रजतैश्च नगैर्वृतः ।।
data.es: 'In the midst of that ocean stands a majestic white mountain named Rishaba surrounded by trees filled with silver flowers emitting wonderful fragrance.There is also a lake named Sudarsana with glittering silver lotuses having gleaming golden filaments. data.es: 'In the midst of that ocean stands a majestic white mountain named Rishaba surrounded by trees filled with silver flowers emitting wonderful fragrance.There is also a lake named Sudarsana with glittering silver lotuses having gleaming golden filaments. Royal swans inhabit these surroundings.

data.v: विबुधाश्चारणा यक्षाः किंनराः साप्सरोगणाः । हृष्टाः समभिगच्छन्ति नलिनीं तां रिरंसवः ।।
data.es: 'The deities, called charanas, yakshas and kinneras, also apsarasas keep coming there to stoll by that lotus pond.

data.v: क्षीरोदं समतिक्रम्य ततो द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः । जलोदं सागरश्रेष्ठं सर्वभूतभयावहम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys going beyond the milky ocean you will see the seas most dreadful to all creatures.

data.v: तत्र तत्कोपजं तेजः कृतं हयमुखं महत् । अस्याहुस्तन्महावेगमोदनं सचराचरम् ।।
data.es: 'Here is born Hayamukha, out of the fastspreading fire of anger of the ocean. Its movable and immovable creatures constitute his food.

data.v: तत्र विक्रोशतां नादो भूतानां सागरौकसाम् । श्रूयते चासमर्थानां दृष्ट्वा तद्वडवामुखम् ।।
data.es: 'You can hear the sounds of helpless oceanic creatures crying loudly on seeing the burning face of Vadava.

data.v: स्वादूदस्योत्तरे देशे योजनानि त्रयोदश । जातरूपशिलो नाम महान्कनकपर्वतः ।।
data.es: 'Thirteen yojanas to the north of this ocean of pure waters is a huge golden mountain called Jatarupasila.

data.v: आसीनं पर्वतस्याग्रे सर्वभूतनमस्कृतम् । सहस्रशिरसं देवमनन्तं नीलवाससं ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys on top of the mountain you will see Ananta, a thousandhooded serpent seated, as bright as the Moon, robed in blue, with large eyes like lotus petals bearing the load of the earth, and revered by all beings.

data.v: त्रिशिराः काञ्चनः केतुस्तालस्तस्य महात्मनः । स्थापितः पर्वतस्याग्रे विराजति सवेदिकः ।।
data.es: 'Highsouled Ananta's flag is a threeheaded golden palm tree shining on an altar on top of the mountain.

data.v: पूर्वस्यां दिशि निर्माणं कृतं तत्त्रिदशेश्वरैः । ततः परं हेममयः श्रीमानुदयपर्वतः ।।
data.es: 'The flag of Ananta is fixed by the gods in the eastern direction. Beyond that stands the famous golden mountain behind which the sun rises. Its golden peak with a divine altar spread over a hundred yojanas touches heaven.

data.v: तस्य कोटिर्दिवं स्पृष्ट्वा शतयोजनमायता । जातरूपमयी दिव्या विराजति सवेदिका ।।
data.es: 'The flag of Ananta is fixed by the gods in the eastern direction. Beyond that stands the famous golden mountain behind which the sun rises. Its golden peak with a divine altar spread over a hundred yojanas touches heaven.

data.v: सालैस्तालैस्तमालैश्च कर्णिकारैश्च पुष्पितैः । जातरूपमयैर्दिव्यैः शोभते सूर्यसंनिभैः ।।
data.es: 'The place looks beautiful with salas, palmyras, tamalas and karnikara trees in full bloom. These golden, divine flowers shine like the Sungod.

data.v: तत्र योजनविस्तारमुच्छ्रितं दशयोजनम् । शृङ्गं सौमनसं नाम जातरूपमयं ध्रुवम् ।।
data.es: 'There is a huge golden peak called Saumanas of ten yojanas in height spread over a breadth of one yojana.

data.v: तत्र पूर्वं पदं कृत्वा पुरा विष्णुस्त्रिविक्रमे । द्वितीयं शिखरं मेरोश्चकार पुरुषोत्तमः ।।
data.es: 'When the supreme being, Visnu took his three strides as Lord Vamana, he placed his first foot on this peak and the second on the peak of mount Meru.

data.v: उत्तरेण परिक्रम्य जम्बूद्वीपं दिवाकरः । दृश्यो भवति भूयिष्ठं शिखरं तन्महोच्छ्रयम् ।।
data.es: 'The Sun circumabulates Jambu island and when he arrives at this lofty cliff of the mountain, it takes the northern direction and becomes visible to the world.

data.v: तत्र वैखानसा नाम वालखिल्या महर्षयः । प्रकाशमाना दृश्यन्ते सूर्यवर्णास्तपस्विनः ।।
data.es: 'Over there the great ascetics Vaikhanasas and Valakhilyas appear like the radiating Sun.

data.v: अयं सुदर्शनो द्वीपः पुरो यस्य प्रकाशते । यस्मिंस्तेजश्च चक्षुश्च सर्वप्रानभृतामपि ।।
data.es: 'The region in front of this mountain is called Sudarsana Island. This island is where the Sun who gives all beings the ability to see rises.

data.v: शैलस्य तस्य कुञ्जेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च । रावणः सह वैदेह्या मार्गितव्यस्ततस्ततः ।।
data.es: 'Therefrom reach out to the swiftflowing river Sona which has redcoloured waters. Then crossing the sea which is the abode of Siddhas and Charanas search the different rivers reaching the sea, and the picturesque and wonderful forests to trace the abode of Ravana who has stolen Sita.

data.v: काञ्चनस्य च शैलस्य सूर्यस्य च महात्मनः । आविष्टा तेजसा संध्या पूर्वा रक्ता प्रकाशते ।।
data.es: 'The early morning twilight appears bright red because of the glow of the golden mountain as well as of the great Sungod.

data.v: ततः परमगम्या स्याद्दिक्पूर्वा त्रिदशावृता । रहिता चन्द्रसूर्याभ्यामदृश्या तिमिरावृता ।।
data.es: 'Beyond, there is no Sun or Moon. Darkness pervades. It is neither accessible nor visible. It is guarded by the gods.

data.v: शैलेषु तेषु सर्वेषु कन्दरेषु वनेषु च । ये च नोक्ता मया देशा विचेया तेषु जानकी ।।
data.es: 'You should look for Janaki everywhere -- on the mountains, in the lakes and in the places not indicated by me.

data.v: एतावद्वानरैः शक्यं गन्तुं वानरपुंगवाः । अभास्करममर्यादं न जानीमस्ततः परम् ।।
data.es: 'O chieftains monkeys can go that far. We know not what lies beyond those boundaries where no Sun shines.

data.v: अधिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च । मासे पूर्णे निवर्तध्वमुदयं प्राप्य पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: 'On locating Vaidehi in the kingdom of Ravana I shall take up proper course of action in conjunction with you.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न वस्तव्यं वसन्वध्यो भवेन्मम । सिद्धार्थाः संनिवर्तध्वमधिगम्य च मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'If you do not report within one month, you will be killed. May you see Maithili and come back after reaching the goal.

data.v: महेन्द्रकान्तां वनषण्ड मण्डितां; दिशं चरित्वा निपुणेन वानराः । अवाप्य सीतां रघुवंशजप्रियां; ततो निवृत्ताः सुखितो भविष्यथ ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys go about the beloved quarter (east) of Indra bestowed with differnt kinds of forests and groves. Look out carefully for Rama's beloved Sita, spot her and return, you will live happily.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकांडे चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततः प्रस्थाप्य सुग्रीवस्तन्महद्वानरं बलम् । दक्षिणां प्रेषयामास वानरानभिलक्षितान् ।।
data.es: Sugriva then sends in the southern direction another vanara army known for their excellence.

data.v: नीलमग्निसुतं चैव हनुमन्तं च वानरम् । पितामहसुतं चैव जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिम् ।।

अङ्गदप्रमुखान्वीरान्वीरः कपिगणेश्वरः । वेगविक्रमसंपन्नान्संदिदेश विशेषवित् ।।

data.es: Then Sugriva ordered mighty Angada to lead the group of the heroic monkeys in the southern direction.

data.v: ये केचन समुद्देशास्तस्यां दिशि सुदुर्गमाः । कपीशः कपिमुख्यानां स तेषां तानुदाहरत् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the monkey king, explained to the monkey chiefs about the inaccessible places in the southern direction.

data.v: सहस्रशिरसं विन्ध्यं नानाद्रुमलतावृतम् । नर्मदां च नदीं दुर्गां महोरगनिषेविताम् ।।
ततो गोदावरीं रम्यां कृष्णावेणीं महानदीम् । वरदां च महाभागां महोरगनिषेविताम् ।।

विदर्भानृषिकांश्चैव रम्यान्माहिषकानपि । तथा बङ्गान्कलिङ्गांश्च कौशिकांश्च समन्ततः ।।

तथैवान्ध्रांश्च पुण्ड्रांश्च चोलान्पाण्ड्यान्सकेरलान् । अयोमुखश्च गन्तव्यः पर्वतो धातुमण्डितः ।।

data.es: 'Look for Sita all over mount Ayomukha (known as Malaya), rich in ores. It has wonderful peaks. It looks colourful with the forest in bloom. This great mountain is full of sandalwood forest.

data.v: ततस्तामापगां दिव्यां प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम् । तत्र द्रक्ष्यथ कावेरीं विहृतामप्सरोगणैः ।।
data.es: 'Then you will see the sacred river Cauvery with pure and auspicious water, where celestial nymphs sport.

data.v: तस्यासीनं नगस्याग्रे मलयस्य महौजसं । द्रक्ष्यथादित्यसंकाशमगस्त्यमृषिसत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'Dwelling on the top of that Malaya mountain you will find celebrated sage Agastya, resplendent like the Sun.

data.v: ततस्तेनाभ्यनुज्ञाताः प्रसन्नेन महात्मना । ताम्रपर्णीं ग्राहजुष्टां तरिष्यथ महानदीम् ।।
data.es: 'You will then come cross the great river Tamraparni infested with alligators. Cross it with the permission of the sage pleased (with you).

data.v: सा चन्दनवनैर्दिव्यैः प्रच्छन्ना द्वीप शालिनी । कान्तेव युवतिः कान्तं समुद्रमवगाहते ।।
data.es: 'With its wonderful islands covered with lovely sandalwood forests, the river mingles with the ocean just as a young beloved meets her lover.

data.v: ततो हेममयं दिव्यं मुक्तामणिविभूषितम् । युक्तं कवाटं पाण्ड्यानां गता द्रक्ष्यथ वानराः ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys leaving that river, you will find encrusted with pearls the wonderful golden gate of the city of Pandyas (modern Madurai).

data.v: ततः समुद्रमासाद्य संप्रधार्यार्थनिश्चयम् । अगस्त्येनान्तरे तत्र सागरे विनिवेशितः ।।
data.es: 'Then on reaching the sea shore, decide the course of action. Sage Agastya has set up (between the moat of the city and and the sea) a glorious golden mountain Mahendra. Filled with colourful trees, it stretches into the sea.

data.es: 'You should not pluck any fruits from those woods, for courageous gandharvas protect the fruits of the trees. It is difficult to go there, for those heroes have frightening bravery.

data.es: 'Exert yourself in your search for Janaki. Indeed there will be no fear from them, if you behave like normal monkeys in a natural way.

data.es: You should search for Ravana and Vaidehi on the peak of that mountain, in the caves, in the forests here and there.
