data.es: 'I saw a young lady of beautiful appearance, adorned with all kinds of ornaments borne away by the evilminded Ravana. That dainty lady was calling out, 'O Rama, O Lakshmana' and was crying aloud. She was throwing away her ornaments and was wriggling to get out of Ravana's grip.

data.v: सूर्यप्रभेव शैलाग्रे तस्याः कौशेयमुत्तमम् । असिते राक्षसे भाति यथा वा तडिदम्बुदे ।।
data.es: 'Her fine silk garment was shining like the radiance of the Sun on the mountain peak, like lightning against the dark cloud. (That was Ravana).

data.v: तां तु सीतामहं मन्ये रामस्य परिकीर्तनात् । श्रूयतां मे कथयतो निलयं तस्य रक्षसः ।।
data.es: 'Since she was uttering Rama's name I think she is Sita. (Now) I will tell you about the demon's abode. Listen

data.v: पुत्रो विश्रवसः साक्षाद्भ्राता वैश्रवणस्य च । अध्यास्ते नगरीं लङ्कां रावणो नाम राकसः ।।
data.es: 'He is Vishrava's son and halfbrother of Vaishravana. His name is Ravana and he resides in the city of Lanka.

data.v: इतो द्वीपे समुद्रस्य संपूर्णे शतयोजने । तस्मिँल्लङ्का पुरी रम्या निर्मिता विश्वकर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'The beautiful city of Lanka is an island, a hundred yojanas away from here.It was built by Visvakarma.

data.v: तस्यां वसति वैदेही दीना कौशेयवासिनी । रावणान्तःपुरे रुद्धा राक्षसीभिः सुरक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'You will see in the city of Lanka, the princess from Videha, daughter of Janaka, a picture of dejection, robed in silk, confined in the harem of Ravana, wellprotected by demonesses.

data.v: जनकस्यात्मजां राज्ञस्तस्यां द्रक्ष्यथ मैथिलीम् । लङ्कायामथ गुप्तायां सागरेण समन्ततः ।।
संप्राप्य सागरस्यान्तं संपूर्णं शतयोजनम् । आसाद्य दक्षिणं कूलं ततो द्रक्ष्यथ रावणम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys traverse a hundred yojanas across the sea. On reaching the southern coast you will be able to see Ravana's Lanka defended and surrounded by the sea. Now proceed swiftly and prove your strength.

data.v: तत्रैव त्वरिताः क्षिप्रं विक्रमध्वं प्लवंगमाः । ज्ञानेन खलु पश्यामि दृष्ट्वा प्रत्यागमिष्यथ ।।
आद्यः पन्थाः कुलिङ्गानां ये चान्ये धान्यजीविनः । द्वितीयो बलिभोजानां ये च वृक्षफलाशिनः ।।
data.es: 'By intuition I know you would see Sita and return. On the first plane you will see sparrows and birds which live on grain. On the second, you will see crows living on the food offered to the dead and birds living on the fruits of trees, and then cocks, cranes and kraunchas moving on the third plane, on the fourth, hawks and falcons and on the fifth, vultures.

data.v: भासास्तृतीयं गच्छन्ति क्रौञ्चाश्च कुररैः सह । श्येनाश्चतुर्थं गच्छन्ति गृध्रा गच्छन्ति पञ्चमम् ।।
data.es: 'By intuition I know you would see Sita and return. On the first plane you will see sparrows and birds which live on grain. On the second, you will see crows living on the food offered to the dead and birds living on the fruits of trees, and then cocks, cranes and kraunchas moving on the third plane, on the fourth, hawks and falcons and on the fifth, vultures.

data.v: बलवीर्योपपन्नानां रूपयौवनशालिनाम् । षष्ठस्तु पन्था हंसानां वैनतेयगतिः परा । वैनतेयाच्च नो जन्म सर्वेषां वानरर्षभाः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: सरमज], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसयय], अज्ञातम् [१२: ययतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमयम]

data.es: 'O bulls among monkeys swans blessed with strength, vigour, beauty and youth move in the sixth region. Beyond, on the seventh plane, you will see the descendants of Garuda.

data.v: गर्हितं तु कृतं कर्म येन स्म पिशिताशनाः । इहस्थोऽहं प्रपश्यामि रावणं जानकीं तथा ।।
अस्माकमपि सौवर्णं दिव्यं चक्षुर्बलं तथा । तस्मादाहारवीर्येण निसर्गेण च वानराः । आयोजनशतात्साग्राद्वयं पश्याम नित्यशः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: तसमत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यसयभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमतत]

data.es: 'O monkeys therefore, by the strength of food and by nature we can always see beyond a hundred yojanas from this edge.

data.v: अस्माकं विहिता वृत्तिर्निसार्गेण च दूरतः । विहिता पादमूले तु वृत्तिश्चरणयोधिनाम् ।।
data.es: 'Our movement and vision naturally extends to distant places. For those fighting on foot, the movement is restricted to the extent of foot movement.

data.v: उपायो दृश्यतां कश्चिल्लङ्घने लवणाम्भसः । अभिगम्य तु वैदेहीं समृद्धार्था गमिष्यथ ।।
data.es: 'Look out for some means to cross the salty ocean. You will see Vaidehi, and return, your mission accomplished.

data.v: समुद्रं नेतुमिच्छामि भवद्भिर्वरुणालयम् । प्रदास्याम्युदकं भ्रातुः स्वर्गतस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: 'Take me to the ocean, the abode of Varuna. I intend to offer oblation to my brother, a great soul who is in heaven.'

data.v: ततो नीत्वा तु तं देशं तीरे नदनदीपतेः । निर्दग्धपक्षं संपातिं वानराः सुमहौजसः ।।
data.es: Th mightiest of monkeys carried Sampati, whose wings were totally burnt, to the sea shore and after he had offered oblations took him back to the same place. Having obtained all information from the king of vultures the monkeys were very happy.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: पुनः प्रत्यानयित्वा वै तं देशं पतगेश्वरम् । बभूवुर्वानरा हृष्टाः प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य ते ।।
data.es: Th mightiest of monkeys carried Sampati, whose wings were totally burnt, to the sea shore and after he had offered oblations took him back to the same place. Having obtained all information from the king of vultures the monkeys were very happy.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततस्तदमृतास्वादं गृध्रराजेन भाषितम् । निशम्य वदतो हृष्टास्ते वचः प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: The mighty monkeys were delighted to hear the nectarlike words of the king of vultures.

data.v: जाम्बवान्वै हरिश्रेष्ठः सह सर्वैः प्लवंगमैः । भूतलात्सहसोत्थाय गृध्रराजानमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Jambavan the king of bears got up at once from the ground along with the monkeys and spoke to the king of vultures:

data.v: क्व सीता केन वा दृष्टा को वा हरति मैथिलीम् । तदाख्यातु भवान्सर्वं गतिर्भव वनौकसाम् ।।
data.es: 'Where is Sita now? By whom else was she seen while being carried? Pray, tell us everything. You are the ultimate saviour of monkeys.

data.v: को दाशरथिबाणानां वज्रवेगनिपातिनाम् । स्वयं लक्ष्मणमुक्तानां न चिन्तयति विक्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'Who is not aware of Rama's swift arrows which are like thunderbolt? Who is not able to assess the speed and power of arrows of Lakshmana released directly?'

data.v: स हरीन्प्रीतिसंयुक्तान्सीता श्रुतिसमाहितान् । पुनराश्वासयन्प्रीत इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Pleased to see the happiness and eagernes of the monkeys assembled to hear about Sita, Sampati continued in order to reassure them:

data.v: श्रूयतामिह वैदेह्या यथा मे हरणं श्रुतम् । येन चापि ममाख्यातं यत्र चायतलोचना ।।
data.es: 'Now hear by whom I was informed about the abduction of the largeeyed princess from Videha and where she is at present.

data.v: अहमस्मिन्गिरौ दुर्गे बहुयोजनमायते । चिरान्निपतितो वृद्धः क्षीणप्राणपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'With my vitality and prowess depleted, I have been staying for a long time on this mountain, extended by several yojanas and inaccessible.

data.v: तं मामेवंगतं पुत्रः सुपार्श्वो नाम नामतः । आहारेण यथाकालं बिभर्ति पततां वरः ।।
data.es: 'Reduced to this state, I have been maintained by food given in time by my son named Suparshva, best among birds.

data.v: तीक्ष्णकामास्तु गन्धर्वास्तीक्ष्णकोपा भुजंगमाः । मृगाणां तु भयं तीक्ष्णं ततस्तीक्ष्णक्षुधा वयम् ।।
data.es: 'Gandharvas have intense passion. Serpents show violent anger. Deer have great fear. And we vultures have great hunger.

data.v: स कदाचित्क्षुधार्तस्य मम चाहारकाङ्क्षिणः । गतसूर्योऽहनि प्राप्तो मम पुत्रो ह्यनामिषः ।।
data.es: 'Once my son came to me without meat after sunset while I was feeling hungry for food.

data.v: स मया वृद्धभावाच्च कोपाच्च परिभर्त्सितः । क्षुत्पिपासा परीतेन कुमारः पततां वरः ।।
स ममाहारसंरोधात्पीडितः प्रीतिवर्धनः । अनुमान्य यथातत्त्वमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: 'I was thinking, tormented with hunger, my son who always keeps me happy told me exactly what had happened:

data.v: अहं तात यथाकालमामिषार्थी खमाप्लुतः । महेन्द्रस्य गिरेर्द्वारमावृत्य च समास्थितः ।।
data.es: 'O dear father I went to get food at the right time and stood blocking the entrance of mount Mahendra.

data.v: तत्र सत्त्वसहस्राणां सागरान्तरचारिणाम् । पन्थानमेकोऽध्यवसं संनिरोद्धुमवाङ्मुखः ।।
data.es: 'There I stood alone looking down, obstructing the path of thousands of creatures inhabiting the ocean.

data.v: तत्र कश्चिन्मया दृष्टः सूर्योदयसमप्रभाम् । स्त्रियमादाय गच्छन्वै भिन्नाञ्जनचयोपमः ।।
data.es: 'I saw a person who was dark and huge like a mass of collyrium carrying a lady whose radiance was like the rising Sun.

data.v: सोऽहमभ्यवहारार्थी तौ दृष्ट्वा कृतनिश्चयः । तेन साम्ना विनीतेन पन्थानमभियाचितः ।।
data.es: 'Since I was looking for food I resolved to seize both of them. (But) he asked me in a gentle and courteous manner to make way (since I was blocking the aerial path).

data.v: न हि सामोपपन्नानां प्रहर्ता विद्यते क्वचित् । नीचेष्वपि जनः कश्चित्किमङ्ग बत मद्विधः ।।
data.es: 'Who will strike polite people? Even the mean do not do it anywhere. And what to speak of me.

data.v: स यातस्तेजसा व्योम संक्षिपन्निव वेगतः । अथाहं खे चरैर्भूतैरभिगम्य सभाजितः ।।
data.es: 'He flew hurriedly with splendour as though he was enveloping the sky (making it small). All the flying creatures in the sky came and greeted me with respect.

data.v: दिष्ट्या जीवसि तातेति अब्रुवन्मां महर्षयः । कथंचित्सकलत्रोऽसौ गतस्ते स्वस्त्यसंशयम् ।।
data.es: 'I heard the great sages saying, 'O dear you are lucky to be saved. He has somehow gone from here with that lady (without hurting you). Undoubtedly you are lucky.'

data.v: एवमुक्तस्ततोऽहं तैः सिद्धैः परमशोभनैः । स च मे रावणो राजा रक्षसां प्रतिवेदितः ।।
हरन्दाशरथेर्भार्यां रामस्य जनकात्मजाम् । भ्रष्टाभरणकौशेयां शोकवेगपराजिताम् ।।
रामलक्ष्मणयोर्नाम क्रोशन्तीं मुक्तमूर्धजाम् । एष कालात्ययस्तावदिति वाक्यविदां वरः ।।
एतमर्थं समग्रं मे सुपार्श्वः प्रत्यवेदयत् । तच्छ्रुत्वापि हि मे बुद्धिर्नासीत्काचित्पराक्रमे ।।
अपक्षो हि कथं पक्षी कर्म किंचिदुपक्रमेत् । यत्तु शक्यं मया कर्तुं वाग्बुद्धिगुणवर्तिना ।।
श्रूयतां तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि भवतां पौरुषाश्रयम् । वाङ्मतिभ्यां हि सार्वेषां करिष्यामि प्रियं हि वः । यद्धि दाशरथेः कार्यं मम तन्नात्र संशयः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: ररभय], अज्ञातम् [१२: यभतर], अज्ञातम् [१२: यरयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततम]

data.es: 'I will please you with my word and thought and do not doubt that Rama's task is dear to me as well.

data.v: ते भवन्तो मतिश्रेष्ठा बलवन्तो मनस्विनः । सहिताः कपिराजेन देवैरपि दुरासदाः ।।
data.es: 'Indeed, you monkeys are very wise, strong and sensitive. The king of monkeys has sent you on this mission. You cannot be conquered even by gods.

data.v: रामलक्ष्मणबाणाश्च निशिताः कङ्कपत्रिणः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानां पर्याप्तास्त्राणनिग्रहे ।।
data.es: 'The heronfeathered arrows of Rama and Lakshmana are sharp and strong enough to protect or subdue all the three worlds.

data.v: कामं खलु दशग्रीवस्तेजोबलसमन्वितः । भवतां तु समर्थानां न किंचिदपि दुष्करम् ।।
data.es: 'The tenheaded Ravana is mighty, powerful and strong, indeed. But you are efficient and it will not be difficult for you to achieve this task.

data.v: तदलं कालसंगेन क्रियतां बुद्धिनिश्चयः । न हि कर्मसु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.es: 'Do not bother about the time limit. Resolve to achieve the objective, for wise people like you should not lag behind in accepting challenges.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततः कृतोदकं स्नातं तं गृध्रं हरियूथपाः । उपविष्टा गिरौ दुर्गे परिवार्य समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Sampati bathed and offered libations to Jatayu. Then all the monkeys sat round him on the beautiful mountain.

data.v: तमङ्गदमुपासीनं तैः सर्वैर्हरिभिर्वृतम् । जनितप्रत्ययो हर्षात्संपातिः पुनरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Angada sat near Sampati surrounded by all monkeys. Sampati who had gained confidence spoke to Angada once again joyously.

data.v: कृत्वा निःशब्दमेकाग्राः शृण्वन्तु हरयो मम । तत्त्वं संकीर्तयिष्यामि यथा जानामि मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys I shall tell you in detail how I came to know the princess from Mithila. Listen quietly with rapt attention:

data.v: अस्य विन्ध्यस्य शिखरे पतितोऽस्मि पुरा वने । सूर्यातपपरीताङ्गो निर्दग्धः सूर्यरश्मिभिः ।।
data.es: Scorched by the rays of the Sun, I was burnt totally and fell on the peak of this mount Vindhya years ago.

data.v: लब्धसंज्ञस्तु षड्रात्राद्विवशो विह्वलन्निव । वीक्षमाणो दिशः सर्वा नाभिजानामि किंचन ।।
ततस्तु सागराञ्शैलान्नदीः सर्वाः सरांसि च । वनान्यटविदेशांश्च समीक्ष्य मतिरागमत् ।।
data.es: 'Then I looked at the oceans, the mountains, rivers, lakes, forests and all locations and my memory returned gradually.

data.v: हृष्टपक्षिगणाकीर्णः कन्दरान्तरकूटवान् । दक्षिणस्योदधेस्तीरे विन्ध्योऽयमिति निश्चितः ।।
data.es: 'I came to know then that this place is inhabited by flocks of happy birds and full of many caves and mountain peaks. This is mount Vindhya on the shore of the southern ocean.

data.v: आसीच्चात्राश्रमं पुण्यं सुरैरपि सुपूजितम् । ऋषिर्निशाकरो नाम यस्मिन्नुग्रतपाभवत् ।।
data.es: 'There was a hermitage nearby, where a revered sage, who was even worshpped by gods lived. His name was Nishakara. He did rigorous penance here.

data.v: अष्टौ वर्षसहस्राणि तेनास्मिन्नृषिणा विना । वसतो मम धर्मज्ञाः स्वर्गते तु निशाकरे ।।
data.es: 'O righteous monkeys after the death of sage Nishakara eight thousand years have passed. And I have been living here.

data.v: अवतीर्य च विन्ध्याग्रात्कृच्छ्रेण विषमाच्छनैः । तीक्ष्णदर्भां वसुमतीं दुःखेन पुनरागतः ।।
data.es: 'I descended down slowly from the high rugged peak of the Vindhya mountain with great difficulty to the plain land bristling with sharp, harsh darbha grass.

data.v: तमृषिं द्रष्टु कामोऽस्मि दुःखेनाभ्यागतो भृशम् । जटायुषा मया चैव बहुशोऽभिगतो हि सः ।।
data.es: 'Eager to see the great sage I reached the place with much difficulty. I and my brother Jatayu had approached him many a time earlier.

data.v: तस्याश्रमपदाभ्याशे ववुर्वाताः सुगन्धिनः । वृक्षो नापुष्पितः कश्चिदफलो वा न दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'In the vicinity of that hermitage there was no tree without flowers or fruits and fragrant was the breeze that blew around.

data.v: उपेत्य चाश्रमं पुण्यं वृक्षमूलमुपाश्रितः । द्रष्टुकामः प्रतीक्षे च भगवन्तं निशाकरम् ।।
data.es: 'On reaching the sacred hermitage, I stood and waited under a tree for the audience of the divine sage Nishakara.

data.v: अथापश्यमदूरस्थमृषिं ज्वलिततेजसं । कृताभिषेकं दुर्धर्षमुपावृत्तमुदङ्मुखम् ।।
तमृक्षाः सृमरा व्याघ्राः सिंहा नागाः सरीसृपाः । परिवार्योपगच्छन्ति दातारं प्राणिनो यथा ।।
data.es: 'He was followed by bears, deer, tigers, lions, elephants and snakes just as living beings follow their creator.

data.v: ततः प्राप्तमृषिं ज्ञात्वा तानि सत्त्वानि वै ययुः । प्रविष्टे राजनि यथा सर्वं सामात्यकं बलम् ।।
data.es: 'Just as the army including feudatories recede, when the king comes, all those creatures repaired to their dens when they knew the arrival of the sage at the hermitage.

data.v: ऋषिस्तु दृष्ट्वा मां तुष्टः प्रविष्टश्चाश्रमं पुनः । मुहूर्तमात्रान्निष्क्रम्य ततः कार्यमपृच्छत ।।
data.es: The sage who entered the hermitage came out again within a moment on seeing me and enquired about me affectionately:

data.v: सौम्य वैकल्यतां दृष्ट्वा रोंणां ते नावगम्यते । अग्निदग्धाविमौ पक्षौ त्वक्चैव व्रणिता तव ।।
data.es: 'O gentle one seeing your body devoid of hair I can understood that your wings have been burnt and your body bruised.

data.v: द्वौ गृध्रौ दृष्टपूर्वौ मे मातरिश्वसमौ जवे । गृध्राणां चैव राजानौ भ्रातरौ कामरूपिणौ ।।
data.es: 'You are the king among vultures equal to wind in speed.I had seen both the brothers earlier and both of you could change your form at will.

data.v: ज्येष्ठस्त्वं तु च संपातिर्जटायुरनुजस्तव । मानुषं रूपमास्थाय गृह्णीतां चरणौ मम ।।
किं ते व्याधिसमुत्थानं पक्षयोः पतनं कथम् । दण्डो वायं धृतः केन सर्वमाख्याहि पृच्छतः ।।
data.es: 'What disease has affected you? Why are your wings dropped down? Who punished you in this way? Tell me.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtieth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततस्तद्दारुणं कर्म दुष्करं साहसात्कृतम् । आचचक्षे मुनेः सर्वं सूर्यानुगमनं तथा ।।
data.es: 'Then I revealed everything to the sage,including the arrogant, impetuous action of rashly following the Sun (for challenging Indra).

data.v: भगवन्व्रणयुक्तत्वाल्लज्जया चाकुलेन्द्रियः । परिश्रान्तो न शक्नोमि वचनं परिभाषितुम् ।।
data.es: 'O revered sage I am exhausted and my senses are depressed. I am ashamed of myself. My body is wounded. Therefore I am not able to reply.

data.v: अहं चैव जटायुश्च संघर्षाद्दर्पमोहितौ । आकाशं पतितौ वीरौ जिघासन्तौ पराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'Deluded by pride, I and my brother Jatayu challenging each other to test our relative strength flew far into the sky.

data.v: कैलासशिखरे बद्ध्वा मुनीनामग्रतः पणम् । रविः स्यादनुयातव्यो यावदस्तं महागिरिम् ।।
data.es: 'Both of us made a bet on the peak of mount Kailasa in the presence of sages to follow the Sungod until he sets on the western mountain.

data.v: अथावां युगपत्प्राप्तावपश्याव महीतले । रथचक्रप्रमाणानि नगराणि पृथक्पृथक् ।।
क्वचिद्वादित्रघोषांश्च ब्रह्मघोषांश्च शुश्रुव । गायन्तीश्चाङ्गना बह्वीः पश्यावो रक्तवाससः ।।
data.es: 'We heard at some places sounds of musical instruments, sounds of Vedic chanting, and many lovely young women dressed in redsinging.

data.v: तूर्णमुत्पत्य चाकाशमादित्यपथमास्थितौ । आवामालोकयावस्तद्वनं शाद्वलसंस्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'We flew quickly into the sky and reached the path of the Sun and looked down at the forest which looked like a green lawn.

data.v: उपलैरिव संछन्ना दृश्यते भूः शिलोच्चयैः । आपगाभिश्च संवीता सूत्रैरिव वसुंधरा ।।
data.es: 'The earth filled with lofty mountains appeared as if it is covered with pebbles. Surrounded by rivers meandering, it looked as though it was entwined with threads.

data.v: हिमवांश्चैव विन्ध्यश्च मेरुश्च सुमहान्नगः । भूतले संप्रकाशन्ते नागा इव जलाशये ।।
data.es: 'The mountains of the earth, Himavan and Vindhya and the great Meru looked like huge elephants in a huge pond.

data.v: तीव्रस्वेदश्च खेदश्च भयं चासीत्तदावयोः । समाविशत मोहश्च मोहान्मूर्छा च दारुणा ।।
data.es: 'Much sweat, pain and fear generated in us while we went on and up. This led to terrific confusion and stupor.

data.v: न दिग्विज्ञायते याम्या नागेन्या न च वारुणी । युगान्ते नियतो लोको हतो दग्ध इवाग्निना ।।
data.es: 'I did not know which the southern direction was or the southeast or the west. It looked as if the world had been consumed by fire and dissolved, as if it was the end of the yuga.

data.v: यत्नेन महता भूयो रविः समवलोकितः । तुल्यः पृथ्वीप्रमाणेन भास्करः प्रतिभाति नौ ।।
data.es: 'My mind was disturbed and I turned my attention from the object. Once again I focused my attention (on the Sun) and could see the Sungod with great effort. The Sun appeared to us equal in size to earth.

data.v: जटायुर्मामनापृच्छ्य निपपात महीं ततः । तं दृष्ट्वा तूर्णमाकाशादात्मानं मुक्तवानहम् ।।
data.es: 'Without taking leave of me Jatayu descended down to the earth. Seeing that, I also followed him down quickly from the sky.

data.v: पक्षिभ्यां च मया गुप्तो जटायुर्न प्रदह्यत । प्रमादात्तत्र निर्दग्धः पतन्वायुपथादहम् ।।
data.es: 'I protected Jatayu with my wings so that he was not burnt. I, however, got burnt miserably and fell down from the aerial region.

data.v: आशङ्के तं निपतितं जनस्थाने जटायुषम् । अहं तु पतितो विन्ध्ये दग्धपक्षो जडीकृतः ।।
data.es: 'I thought Jatayu had fallen down somewhere at Janasthana, but I fell on Vindhya, wings burnt, in an unconscious state.

data.v: राज्येन हीनो भ्रात्रा च पक्षाभ्यां विक्रमेण च । सर्वथा मर्तुमेवेच्छन्पतिष्ये शिखराद्गिरेः ।।
data.es: 'Bereft of my kingdom, my brother and my wings, and having lost my strength I desire to fall down from the mountain top and die.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे एकषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfirst sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिश्रेष्ठमरुदं दुःखितो भृशम् । अथ ध्यात्वा मुहूर्तं तु भगवानिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having said this and thinking for a moment, Sugriva again said to the heroic Rama whose eyes had turned red.

data.v: पक्षौ च ते प्रपक्षौ च पुनरन्यौ भविष्यतः । चक्षुषी चैव प्राणाश्च विक्रमश्च बलं च ते ।।
data.es: 'You will get new wings and feathers and also other parts.You will attain vision, life, prowess and strength.

data.v: पुराणे सुमहत्कार्यं भविष्यं हि मया श्रुतम् । दृष्टं मे तपसा चैव श्रुत्वा च विदितं मम ।।
data.es: 'I have foreseen with the power of my penance that a great task will be done by you. I have also heard about it in the Puranas and came to know of it.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम कश्चिदिक्ष्वाकुनन्दनः । तस्य पुत्रो महातेजा रामो नाम भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Indeed in the Ikshvaku family there will be a king named Dasaratha. He will beget a brilliant son named Rama.

data.v: अरण्यं च सह भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणेन गमिष्यति । तस्मिन्नर्थे नियुक्तः सन्पित्रा सत्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'On account of the command of his father, Rama armed with the strength of truth will proceed to the forest with his brother Lakshmana.

data.v: नैरृतो रावणो नाम तस्या भार्यां हरिष्यति । राक्षसेन्द्रो जनस्थानादवध्यः सुरदानवैः ।।
data.es: 'The king of demons, Ravana who is indestructible even by gods and demons will be abducting his wife from Janastahana.

data.v: सा च कामैः प्रलोभ्यन्ती भक्ष्यैर्भोज्यैश्च मैथिली । न भोक्ष्यति महाभागा दुःखमग्ना यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: 'Immersed in grief, chaste and famed Sita, will not take any food or enjoy pleasures however much she is tempted.

data.v: परमान्नं तु वैदेह्या ज्ञात्वा दास्यति वासवः । यदन्नममृतप्रख्यं सुराणामपि दुर्लभम् ।।
data.es: 'Knowing that Vaidehi is not eating food(given by Ravana) Indra,the ruler of gods, will offer nectarlike food rare even for gods.

data.v: तदन्नं मैथिली प्राप्य विज्ञायेन्द्रादिदं त्विति । अग्रमुद्धृत्य रामाय भूतले निर्वपिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Having understood that it has been provided by Indra, Sita will take out a large portion of it and pour it on the ground (as an offering to Rama) and say 'I offer it to Rama wherever he is on earth'.

data.v: यदि जीवति मे भर्ता लक्ष्मणेन सह प्रभुः । देवत्वं गतयोर्वापि तयोरन्नमिदं त्विति ।।
data.es: 'If my husband and Lakshmana are living or else even if they have attained heaven let this food be enjoyed by them', Sita will say.

data.v: एष्यन्त्यन्वेषकास्तस्या रामदूताः प्लवंगमाः । आख्येया राममहिषी त्वया तेभ्यो विहंगम ।।
data.es: 'Rama's messenger and other monkeys will be coming to search for the his queen. O Sampati you should narrate this to them.

data.v: सर्वथा तु न गन्तव्यमीदृशः क्व गमिष्यसि । देशकालौ प्रतीक्षस्व पक्षौ त्वं प्रतिपत्स्यसे ।।
data.es: 'It is good for you in all respects to remain here. Where can you go (without wings)? Wait for appropriate time and place. You will recover your wings'.

data.v: उत्सहेयमहं कर्तुमद्यैव त्वां सपक्षकम् । इहस्थस्त्वं तु लोकानां हितं कार्यं करिष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'I am not enthusiastic about giving you the wings now. Remain here and carry on the work for the welfare of the world.

data.v: त्वयापि खलु तत्कार्यं तयोश्च नृपपुत्रयोः । ब्राह्मणानां सुराणां च मुनीनां वासवस्य च ।।
data.es: '(Carry on) the work not only for the princes (Rama and Lakshmana) but also for the brahmins, sages, gods and others who live here.

data.v: इच्छाम्यहमपि द्रष्टुं भ्रातरु रामलक्ष्मणौ । नेच्छे चिरं धारयितुं प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्ये कलेवरम् ।।
data.es: 'I also want to see Rama and Lakshmana. But I do not like to hold on to my life for long. Hence I will give up my body'. The knower of self, the sage (Nishakara) said this to Sampati.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे द्विषष्टितम स्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: एतैरन्यैश्च बहुभिर्वाक्यैर्वाक्यविशारदः । मां प्रशस्याभ्यनुज्ञाप्य प्रविष्टः स स्वमाश्रमम् ।।
data.es: 'The sage who was skilful in speech, having praised me thus and in many other ways, permitted me to leave and entered his dwelling.

data.v: कन्दरात्तु विसर्पित्वा पर्वतस्य शनैः शनैः । अहं विन्ध्यं समारुह्य भवतः प्रतिपालये ।।
data.es: 'Having crawled slowly and slowly from the cave and climbed the Vindhya, I have been awaiting your arrival.

data.v: अद्य त्वेतस्य कालस्य साग्रं वर्षशतं गतम् । देशकालप्रतीक्षोऽस्मि हृदि कृत्वा मुनेर्वचः ।।
data.es: 'More than a hundred years have passed and all this time I have borne the sage's words in my heart and have waited for the right time and place.

data.v: महाप्रस्थानमासाद्य स्वर्गते तु निशाकरे । मां निर्दहति संतापो वितर्कैर्बहुभिर्वृतम् ।।
data.es: 'Nishakara went on his last journey and attained heaven. Since then many sad thoughts have crisscrossed my mind and I am consumed with those thoughts.

data.v: उत्थितां मरणे बुद्धिं मुनि वाक्यैर्निवर्तये । बुद्धिर्या तेन मे दत्ता प्राणसंरक्षणाय तु । सा मेऽपनयते दुःखं दीप्तेवाग्निशिखा तमः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: ररसभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: यमभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: जमतम], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसतय]

data.es: 'Whenever I intended to die, the words of the sage rang in my mind. The inspiration he gave me to preserve my life removed my agony like the glowing flames of fire that take away darkness.

data.v: बुध्यता च मया वीर्यं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः । पुत्रः संतर्जितो वाग्भिर्न त्राता मैथिली कथम् ।।
data.es: 'I goaded my son with harsh words saying, 'Knowing the valour of the evilminded Ravana, why did you not protect her (Sita)'

data.v: तस्या विलपितं श्रुत्वा तौ च सीता विनाकृतौ । न मे दशरथस्नेहात्पुत्रेणोत्पादितं प्रियम् ।।
data.es: 'Even after hearing the wailing of Sita, knowing that both (Rama and Lakshmana) are separated from her and considering my friendship with Dasaratha, I felt displeased with my son (as he did not make an attempt to rescue her)'.

data.v: तस्य त्वेवं ब्रुवाणस्य संपातेर्वानरैः सह । उत्पेततुस्तदा पक्षौ समक्षं वनचारिणाम् ।।
data.es: Even as he was telling this to the monkeys his wings started appearing in their presence.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा स्वां तनुं पक्षैरुद्गतैररुणच्छदैः । प्रहर्षमतुलं लेभे वानरांश्चेदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: He experienced an unparalleled delight seeing wings with red feathers growing on his body, and said to the monkeys:

data.v: निशाकरस्य महर्षेः प्रभावादमितात्मनः । आदित्यरश्मिनिर्दग्धौ पक्षौ मे पुनरुत्थितौ ।।
data.es: 'By the grace of the most revered soul,sage Nishakara, both my wings that were burnt by the Sun's radiance have grown again.

data.v: यौवने वर्तमानस्य ममासीद्यः पराक्रमः । तमेवाद्यावगच्छामि बलं पौरुषमेव च ।।
data.es: 'The valour, strength and even courage that I had in my youth,I am experiencing now.

data.v: सर्वथा क्रियतां यत्नः सीतामधिगमिष्यथ । पक्षलाभो ममायं वः सिद्धिप्रत्यय कारकः ।।
इत्युक्त्वा तान्हरीन्सर्वान्संपातिः पततां वरः । उत्पपात गिरेः शृङ्गाज्जिज्ञासुः खगमो गतिम् ।।
data.es: Sampati, the foremost of the birds thus spoke to the monkeys and flew up from the mountain's peak keen on finding the aerial path.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रीतिसंहृष्टमानसाः । बभूवुर्हरिशार्दूला विक्रमाभ्युदयोन्मुखाः ।।
data.es: The tigers among monkeys felt very happy on hearing the words of Sampati and became sure of their success with their valour.

data.v: अथ पवनसमानविक्रमाः; प्लवगवराः प्रतिलब्ध पौरुषाः । अभिजिदभिमुखां दिशं ययु;र्जनकसुता परिमार्गणोन्मुखाः ।।
data.es: The monkeys as strong as the wind regained courage and went in search of the daughter of Janaka in the direction of Abhijit (constellation known as Abhijit is associated with success).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtythird sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: आख्याता गृध्रराजेन समुत्पत्य प्लवंगमाः । संगताः प्रीतिसंयुक्ता विनेदुः सिंहविक्रमाः ।।
data.es: Hearing the words spoken by the king of vultures, the highly courageous monkeys assembled together and leaped with joyscreaming.

data.v: संपातेर्वचनं श्रुत्वा हरयो रावणक्षयम् । हृष्टाः सागरमाजग्मुः सीतादर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of Sampati, the monkeys felt glad and, eager to see Sita, reached the ocean, the passage to the abode of Ravana.

data.v: अभिक्रम्य तु तं देशं ददृशुर्भीमविक्रमाः । कृत्स्नं लोकस्य महतः प्रतिबिम्बमिव स्थितम् ।।
data.es: Having reached the ocean, the monkeys, endowed with frightening courage, stood looking at the vast ocean which appeared like an image of the whole world.

data.v: दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य समासाद्योत्तरां दिशम् । संनिवेशं ततश्चक्रुः सहिता वानरोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Powerful and heroic monkeys assembled at the northern end of the southern ocean.

data.v: सत्त्वैर्महद्भिर्विकृतैः क्रीडद्भिर्विविधैर्जले । व्यात्तास्यैः सुमहाकायैरूर्मिभिश्च समाकुलम् ।।
प्रसुप्तमिव चान्यत्र क्रीडन्तमिव चान्यतः । क्वचित्पर्वतमात्रैश्च जलराशिभिरावृतम् ।।
संकुलं दानवेन्द्रैश्च पातालतलवासिभिः । रोमहर्षकरं दृष्ट्वा विषेदुः कपिकुञ्जराः ।।
आकाशमिव दुष्पारं सागरं प्रेक्ष्य वानराः । विषेदुः सहसा सर्वे कथं कार्यमिति ब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: All the monkeys were worried when they suddenly saw the ocean which looked impassable like the sky. They wondered if they can at all accomplish the task (of finding Sita)

data.v: विषण्णां वाहिनीं दृष्ट्वा सागरस्य निरीक्षणात् । आश्वासयामास हरीन्भयार्तान्हरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Angada, the best among the monkeys saw the worried army despondent gazing at the ocean, and comforted the frightened troops.

data.v: न निषादेन नः कार्यं विषादो दोषवत्तरः । विषादो हन्ति पुरुषं बालं क्रुद्ध इवोरगः ।।
data.es: 'Do not be despondent. It is the biggest flaw. It destroys a person like an angry serpent killing a young child.

data.v: विषादोऽयं प्रसहते विक्रमे पर्युपस्थिते । तेजसा तस्य हीनस्य पुरुषार्थो न सिध्यति ।।
data.es: 'If one succumbs to despondency while he has to exhibit his valour, his brilliance gets diminished and he does not succeed in his manly pursuits'.

data.v: तस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायामङ्गदो वानरैः सह । हरिवृद्धैः समागम्य पुनर्मन्त्रममन्त्रयत् ।।
data.es: With the night over, Angada joined the older monkeys again and sought their counsel.

data.v: सा वानराणां ध्वजिनी परिवार्याङ्गदं बभौ । वासवं परिवार्येव मरुतां वाहिनी स्थिता ।।
data.es: The army of monkeys encircled Angada like the army of Maruts surrounding Indra.

data.v: कोऽन्यस्तां वानरीं सेनां शक्तः स्तम्भयितुं भवेत् । अन्यत्र वालितनयादन्यत्र च हनूमतः ।।
data.es: Who else other than the son of Vali and Hanuman can resist and pacify the monkeyarmy?

data.v: ततस्तान्हरिवृद्धांश्च तच्च सैन्यमरिंदमः । अनुमान्याङ्गदः श्रीमान्वाक्यमर्थवदब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then the illustrious Angada, subduer of foes took the counsel of elderly monkeys and the army into confidence and thus addressed them all in meaningful words:

data.v: क इदानीं महातेजा लङ्घयिष्यति सागरम् । कः करिष्यति सुग्रीवं सत्यसंधमरिंदमम् ।।
data.es: 'Now which mighty monkey will cross the ocean? Who will prove Sugriva, subduer of enemies, true to his promise?

data.v: को वीरो योजनशतं लङ्घयेत प्लवंगमाः । इमांश्च यूथपान्सर्वान्मोचयेत्को महाभयात् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys which one can leap a hundred yojanas and liberate the monkey leaders from the great fear of Sugriva?

data.v: कस्य प्रसादाद्दारांश्च पुत्रांश्चैव गृहाणि च । इतो निवृत्ताः पश्येम सिद्धार्थाः सुखिनो वयम् ।।
data.es: 'By whose effort can we be successful and return home happily from here to meet wives and sons?

data.v: कस्य प्रसादाद्रामं च लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् । अभिगच्छेम संहृष्टाः सुग्रीवं च महाबलम् ।।
data.es: 'By whose grace shall we approach Rama and Lakshmana and even the monkey king Sugriva happily?

data.v: यदि कश्चित्समर्थो वः सागरप्लवने हरिः । स ददात्विह नः शीघ्रं पुण्यामभयदक्षिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'If there is any one among you who is capable of leaping across the ocean he will be giving all of us the sacred gift of life quickly?'

data.v: अङ्गदस्य वचः श्रुत्वा न कश्चित्किंचिदब्रवीत् । स्तिमितेवाभवत्सर्वा सा तत्र हरिवाहिनी ।।
data.es: After hearing Angada, no one spoke a word. The entire army of monkeys became still and motionless.

data.v: पुनरेवाङ्गदः प्राह तान्हरीन्हरिसत्तमः । सर्वे बलवतां श्रेष्ठा भवन्तो दृढविक्रमाः ।।
data.es: Angada, the best of the monkeys again addressed them saying, 'you are all mighty, eminent and courageous, born in renowned families and have been honoured again and again(for your actions).

data.v: व्यपदेश्य कुले जाताः पूजिताश्चाप्यभीक्ष्णशः । न हि वो गमने संगः कदाचिदपि कस्यचित् ।।
ब्रुवध्वं यस्य या शक्तिर्गमने प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: 'None of you at any time have faced any obstruction in doing your deeds. You are efficient in leaping. O bulls among monkeys now speak out, who among you can fly and how far?इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये किष्किन्धाकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga in Kishkindakanda of the first epic, the Holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.v: ततोऽङ्गदवचः श्रुत्वा सर्वे ते वानरोत्तमाः । स्वं स्वं गतौ समुत्साहमाहुस्तत्र यथाक्रमम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after the other their capability for leaping.

data.v: गजो गवाक्षो गवयः शरभो गन्धमादनः । मैन्दश्च द्विविदश्चैव सुषेणो जाम्बवांस्तथा ।।
data.es: Thereafter, on hearing Angada, all the leaders among the monkeys, Gaja, Gavaksha, Gavaya, Sarabha, Gandhamadana, Mainda, Dvivida, Sushena and Jambavan as well expressed one after the other their capability for leaping.

data.v: आबभाषे गजस्तत्र प्लवेयं दशयोजनम् । गवाक्षो योजनान्याह गमिष्यामीति विंशतिम् ।।
data.es: Gaja said he can leap ten yojanas and Gavaksha said he can go upto twenty yojanas.

data.v: गवयो वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । त्रिंशतं तु गमिष्यामि योजनानां प्लवंगमाः ।।
शरभो वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । चत्वारिंशद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां न संशयः ।।
वानरांस्तु महातेजा अब्रवीद्गन्धमादनः । योजनानां गमिष्यामि पञ्चाशत्तु न संशयः ।।
मैन्दस्तु वानरस्तत्र वानरांस्तानुवाच ह । योजनानां परं षष्टिमहं प्लवितुमुत्सहे ।।
ततस्तत्र महातेजा द्विविदः प्रत्यभाषत । गमिष्यामि न संदेहः सप्ततिं योजनान्यहम् ।।
सुषेणस्तु हरिश्रेष्ठः प्रोक्तवान्कपिसत्तमान् । अशीतिं योजनानां तु प्लवेयं प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
तेषां कथयतां तत्र सर्वांस्ताननुमान्य च । ततो वृद्धतमस्तेषां जाम्बवान्प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.es: When the monkeys were talking (of their individual capacity) in that manner about their speed, Jambavan the oldest of the monkeys inferred (their capacity) and said:

data.v: पूर्वमस्माकमप्यासीत्कश्चिद्गतिपराक्रमः । ते वयं वयसः पारमनुप्राप्ताः स्म साम्प्रतम् ।।
data.es: 'Earlier I was also very courageous, but now I have become old and reached the fag end of life.

data.v: किं तु नैवं गते शक्यमिदं कार्यमुपेक्षितुम् । यदर्थं कपिराजश्च रामश्च कृतनिश्चयौ ।।
data.es: 'However in this situation, it is not possible for us to neglect (our task) as it is the order of the monkeyking and Rama who are determined to achieve the objective.

data.v: साम्प्रतं कालभेदेन या गतिस्तां निबोधत । नवतिं योजनानां तु गमिष्यामि न संशयः ।।
तांश्च सर्वान्हरिश्रेष्ठाञ्जाम्बवान्पुनरब्रवीत् । न खल्वेतावदेवासीद्गमने मे पराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Jambavan, the distinguished among the monkeys again said, 'My strength to leap into the sky was not only that much (I was stronger in my youth and could cover longer distances)'

data.v: मया महाबलैश्चैव यज्ञे विष्णुः सनातनः । प्रदक्षिणीकृतः पूर्वं क्रममाणस्त्रिविक्रमः ।।
data.es: 'In the past, at the time of the wellknown yagna (of king Bali) I was very strong. I circumambulated the eternal Vishnu while he was taking three strides (in his incarnation of Trivikrama Vamana.)

data.v: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः प्लवने मन्दविक्रमः । यौवने च तदासीन्मे बलमप्रतिमं परैः ।।
data.es: 'Having grown old I do not have the same courage. In my youth my prowess was incomparable and none could excel me.

data.v: संप्रत्येतावतीं शक्तिं गमने तर्कयाम्यहम् । नैतावता च संसिद्धिः कार्यस्यास्य भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'I guess that at this time I do not have the capacity to fly to that extent. Achieving the objective is out of question with this much of energy.

data.v: अथोत्तरमुदारार्थमब्रवीदङ्गदस्तदा । अनुमान्य महाप्राज्ञो जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिम् ।।
data.es: 'Then the wise Angada said to great Jambavan, in a gentle manner about his own strength.

data.v: अहमेतद्गमिष्यामि योजनानां शतं महत् । निवर्तने तु मे शक्तिः स्यान्न वेति न निश्चितम् ।।
data.es: 'I can certainly go to a distance of a hundred yojanas. However, I cannot say whether I will have enough capacity to return?

data.v: तमुवाच हरिश्रेष्ठो जाम्बवान्वाक्यकोविदः । ज्ञायते गमने शक्तिस्तव हर्यृक्षसत्तम ।।
data.es: Jambavan who was skilful in speech spoke to that great Angada, 'O leader among monkeys and bears your energy to cover this distance is wellknown to us'.

data.v: कामं शतसहस्रं वा न ह्येष विधिरुच्यते । योजनानां भवाञ्शक्तो गन्तुं प्रतिनिवर्तितुम् ।।
data.es: 'You can go upto even a hundred thousand yojanas and have the required energy to return also. But it is not proper to send you (because you are the heir apparent).

data.v: न हि प्रेषयिता तत स्वामी प्रेष्यः कथंचन । भवतायं जनः सर्वः प्रेष्यः प्लवगसत्तम ।।
भवान्कलत्रमस्माकं स्वामिभावे व्यवस्थितः । स्वामी कलत्रं सैन्यस्य गतिरेषा परंतप ।।
data.es: 'O scorcher of enemies, you are established as the commander of the army and it is proper for us to protect you as we protect our wives.

data.v: तस्मात्कलत्रवत्तात प्रतिपाल्यः सदा भवान् । अपि चैतस्य कार्यस्य भवान्मूलमरिंदम ।।
मूलमर्थस्य संरक्ष्यमेष कार्यविदां नयः । मूले हि सति सिध्यन्ति गुणाः पुष्पफलादयः ।।
data.es: 'The root of any objective should be protected well. This is the basis of an accomplisher. Only when the roots are intact, the trees have the ability to yield flowers and fruits.

data.v: तद्भवानस्या कार्यस्य साधने सत्यविक्रमः । बुद्धिविक्रमसंपन्नो हेतुरत्र परंतपः ।।
data.es: 'O warrior of proven valour O subduer of enemies in achieving this objective you are the source, being endowed with valour and wisdom.

data.v: गुरुश्च गुरुपुत्रश्च त्वं हि नः कपिसत्तम । भवन्तमाश्रित्य वयं समर्था ह्यर्थसाधने ।।
data.es: 'O best of monkeys you are the son of my guide (Vali) and respectable. We will be capable of accomplishing the goal only under your protection and guidance.

data.v: उक्तवाक्यं महाप्राज्ञं जाम्बवन्तं महाकपिः । प्रत्युवाचोत्तरं वाक्यं वालिसूनुरथाङ्गदः ।।
data.es: Jambavan, the wise monkey having said that, Angada, the great son of Vali, replied:

data.v: यदि नाहं गमिष्यामि नान्यो वानरपुंगवः । पुनः खल्विदमस्माभिः कार्यं प्रायोपवेशनम् ।।
data.es: 'If I do not go and no other monkey leader goes, then we have to resort to fasting unto death once again.

data.v: न ह्यकृत्वा हरिपतेः संदेशं तस्य धीमतः । तत्रापि गत्वा प्राणानां पश्यामि परिरक्षणम् ।।
data.es: 'If I do not fulfil the objective of the wise king of monkeys I cannot save my life even after returning there (Kishkinda).

data.v: स हि प्रसादे चात्यर्थं कोपे च हरिरीश्वरः । अतीत्य तस्य संदेशं विनाशो गमने भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'The monkey king has the authority to shower grace or give vent to his anger. If we go without fulfilling the task we will face destruction.

data.v: तद्यथा ह्यस्य कार्यस्य न भवत्यन्यथा गतिः । तद्भवानेव दृष्टार्थः संचिन्तयितुमर्हति ।।
data.es: 'Therefore, think over well so that we do not fail ultimately. You have a vision.You should suggest means by which this mission does not misfire.'

data.v: सोऽङ्गदेन तदा वीरः प्रत्युक्तः प्लवगर्षभः । जाम्बवानुत्तरं वाक्यं प्रोवाचेदं ततोऽङ्गदम् ।।
data.es: On listening to Angada's words, Jambavan, the bull among monkeys, replied this way:

data.v: अस्य ते वीर कार्यस्य न किंचित्परिहीयते । एष संचोदयाम्येनं यः कार्यं साधयिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'O hero this work will not be balked. I will now inspire one who can achieve this task.'

data.v: ततः प्रतीतं प्लवतां वरिष्ठ;मेकान्तमाश्रित्य सुखोपविष्टम् । संचोदयामास हरिप्रवीरो; हरिप्रवीरं हनुमन्तमेव ।।
अनेकशतसाहस्रीं विषण्णां हरिवाहिनीम् । जाम्बवान्समुदीक्ष्यैवं हनुमन्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then Jambavan observed the worries of several hundred thousands of the monkey army and said to Hanuman:

data.v: वीर वानरलोकस्य सर्वशास्त्रविदां वर । तूष्णीमेकान्तमाश्रित्य हनुमन्किं न जल्पसि ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman you are the choicest one among many scholars wellversed in all sastras. Why do you sit alone? Why do you not speak?

data.v: हनुमन्हरिराजस्य सुग्रीवस्य समो ह्यसि । रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि तेजसा च बलेन च ।।
data.es: 'Hanuman you are equal to the king of monkeys and also Rama and Lakshmana in brilliance and strength.

data.v: अरिष्टनेमिनः पुत्रौ वैनतेयो महाबलः । गरुत्मानिव विख्यात उत्तमः सर्वपक्षिणाम् ।।
data.es: 'You are the son of Arishtanemi (sage Kasyapa) and Vinata, and your gurulike (elder brother) is Garuda, the greatest among birds. He is powerful and and famous.

data.v: बहुशो हि मया दृष्टः सागरे स महाबलः । भुजगानुद्धरन्पक्षी महावेगो महायशाः ।।
data.es: 'Garuda is very powerful, swift, and famous. I have seen him snatching serpents from the ocean many times.

data.v: पक्षयोर्यद्बलं तस्य तावद्भुजबलं तव । विक्रमश्चापि वेगश्च न ते तेनापहीयते ।।
data.es: 'The strength of your shoulders is equal to that of his (Garuda's) wings. Your speed and valour are no less.

data.v: बलं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च सत्त्वं च हरिसत्तम । विशिष्टं सर्वभूतेषु किमात्मानं न बुध्यसे ।।
data.es: 'O leader of the monkeys you are superior in strength, wisdom, brilliance and valour to all beings. Why do you not realise your own strength?

data.v: अप्सराप्सरसां श्रेष्ठा विख्याता पुञ्जिकस्थला । अज्ञनेति परिख्याता पत्नी केसरिणो हरेः ।।
अभिशापादभूत्तात वानरी कामरूपिणी । दुहिता वानरेन्द्रस्य कुञ्जरस्य महात्मनः ।।
कपित्वे चारुसर्वाङ्गी कदाचित्कामरूपिणी । मानुषं विग्रहं कृत्वा यौवनोत्तमशालिनी ।।
अचरत्पर्वतस्याग्रे प्रावृडम्बुदसंनिभे । विचित्रमाल्याभरणा महार्हक्षौमवासिनी ।।
तस्या वस्त्रं विशालाक्ष्याः पीतं रक्तदशं शुभम् । स्थितायाः पर्वतस्याग्रे मारुतोऽपहरच्छनैः ।।
data.es: 'While the largeeyed lady was stationed on the mountain top, the Windgod gently let her auspicious yellow garment with red border fly away.

data.v: स ददर्श ततस्तस्या वृत्तावूरू सुसंहतौ । स्तनौ च पीनौ सहितौ सुजातं चारु चाननम् ।।
data.es: 'Then he (Windgod) saw her curved, wellset thighs, her beautiful plump breasts and her lovely pleasing face.

data.v: तां विशालायतश्रोणीं तनुमध्यां यशस्विनीम् । दृष्ट्वैव शुभसर्वाग्नीं पवनः काममोहितः ।।
data.es: 'On seeing the broad hips, slender waist and beautiful limbs of that famous lady the Windgod was infatuated.

data.v: स तां भुजाभ्यां पीनाभ्यां पर्यष्वजत मारुतः । मन्मथाविष्टसर्वाङ्गो गतात्मा तामनिन्दिताम् ।।
data.es: 'The Windgod lost his control over himself. His whole being was overpowered by love for her beautiful, flawless body. He embraced her with his long arms.

data.v: सा तु तत्रैव संभ्रान्ता सुवृत्ता वाक्यमब्रवीत् । एकपत्नीव्रतमिदं को नाशयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: 'She was bewildered by this and being chaste and strict observer of chastiny she said, 'Who is it that has destroyed my monoandry?

data.v: अञ्जनाया वचः श्रुत्वा मारुतः प्रत्यभाषत । न त्वां हिंसामि सुश्रोणि मा भूत्ते सुभगे भयम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing Anjana's words, the Windgod replied, ' O auspicious lady, I do you no harm, O lady of beautiful hips. I reached (enjoyed) you in mind, not body. You need not fear.'

data.v: मनसास्मि गतो यत्त्वां परिष्वज्य यशस्विनि । वीर्यवान्बुद्धिसंपन्नः पुत्रस्तव भविष्यति ।।
data.es: 'O renowned lady I have embraced you and united with you mentally (enjoyed you without physical contact).You will bring forth a son endowed with great wisdom and courage.

data.v: अभ्युत्थितं ततः सूर्यं बालो दृष्ट्वा महावने । फलं चेति जिघृक्षुस्त्वमुत्प्लुत्याभ्यपतो दिवम् ।।
data.es: 'On seeing the rising Sun in the deep forest, mistaking him to be a fruit, you wanted to seize it, when you were young.You suddenly flew into the sky and went flying towards the Sun.

data.v: शतानि त्रीणि गत्वाथ योजनानां महाकपे । तेजसा तस्य निर्धूतो न विषादं ततो गतः ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey you went three hundred yojanas and were pushed back by the Sun's radiance. Yet it did not leave you depressed.

data.v: तावदापततस्तूर्णमन्तरिक्षं महाकपे । क्षिप्तमिन्द्रेण ते वज्रं क्रोधाविष्टेन धीमता ।।
data.es: 'O great monkey while falling fast in space, wise Indra hurled his thunderbolt quickly at you, in anger.

data.v: ततः शैलाग्रशिखरे वामो हनुरभज्यत । ततो हि नामधेयं ते हनुमानिति कीर्त्यते ।।
data.es: 'You fell on the edge of the mountain peak and your left chin got broken. Since then you are widely known as Hanuman (one who has a wounded chin).

data.v: ततस्त्वां निहतं दृष्ट्वा वायुर्गन्धवहः स्वयम् । त्रैलोक्ये भृशसंक्रुद्धो न ववौ वै प्रभञ्जनः ।।
data.es: The Windgod who is a carrier of fragrance and breaker of trees became very angry on seeing (the injury on) you and stopped blowing in the three worlds.

data.v: संभ्रान्ताश्च सुराः सर्वे त्रैलोक्ये क्षुभिते सति । प्रसादयन्ति संक्रुद्धं मारुतं भुवनेश्वराः ।।
प्रसादिते च पवने ब्रह्मा तुभ्यं वरं ददौ । अशस्त्रवध्यतां तात समरे सत्यविक्रम ।।
data.es: 'O dear when the Windgod was pleased, Brahma gave a boon to you, to appease his anger. The boon made you truly valiant so that you cannot be struck by any weapon and killed.

data.v: वज्रस्य च निपातेन विरुजं त्वां समीक्ष्य च । सहस्रनेत्रः प्रीतात्मा ददौ ते वरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: 'O lord observing that you are not hurt even when struck by the thunderbolt, Indra offered, one of the best boons to you, to choose to die only when you wish.

data.v: स्वच्छन्दतश्च मरणं ते भूयादिति वै प्रभो । स त्वं केसरिणः पुत्रः क्षेत्रजो भीमविक्रमः ।।
मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तेजसा चापि तत्समः । त्वं हि वायुसुतो वत्स प्लवने चापि तत्समः ।।
data.es: 'You are a son of Kesari endowed with terrific strength and a lawful son of Maruta also. You are, therefore, equal to the very Windgod in flying and in brilliance.

data.v: वयमद्य गतप्राणा भवानस्मासु साम्प्रतम् । दाक्ष्यविक्रमसंपन्नः पक्षिराज इवापरः ।।
data.es: 'Now we have almost lost our life.You are our saviour like another monkeyking (like Garuda, king of birds).You are fully endowed with valour and courage.

data.v: त्रिविक्रमे मया तात सशैलवनकानना । त्रिः सप्तकृत्वः पृथिवी परिक्रान्ता प्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O dear when Visnu (Vamana incarnate) took three strides I circumambulated the whole earth including its mountains and trees twentyone times.

data.v: तदा चौषधयोऽस्माभिः संचिता देवशासनात् । निष्पन्नममृतं याभिस्तदासीन्नो महद्बलम् ।।
data.es: 'Then on receiving orders from the gods, we collected medicinal herbs and nectar which gave us great strength.

data.v: स इदानीमहं वृद्धः परिहीनपराक्रमः । साम्प्रतं कालमस्माकं भवान्सर्वगुणान्वितः ।।
data.es: 'I have become old and my valour is depleted. At this time you are the sole resort for us. You have all the necessary qualities.

data.v: तद्विजृम्भस्व विक्रान्तः प्लवतामुत्तमो ह्यसि । त्वद्वीर्यं द्रष्टुकामेयं सर्वा वानरवाहिनी ।।
data.es: 'Cheer up and advance.You are the best among the creatures that can leap.The entire army of monkeys want to see your valour.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ हरिशार्दूल लङ्घयस्व महार्णवम् । परा हि सर्वभूतानां हनुमन्या गतिस्तव ।।
data.es: 'O tiger among monkeys get up. Come and sleep on the best of beds. Best of kings, you should not lie on the ground.

data.v: विषाण्णा हरयः सर्वे हनुमन्किमुपेक्षसे । विक्रमस्व महावेगो विष्णुस्त्रीन्विक्रमानिव ।।
data.es: 'O Hanuman All the monkeys look dejected. Why do you delay? O warrior, act quick with your rapid speed like Trivikrama who took three strides that covered the entire universe'.

data.v: ततस्तु वै जाम्बवताभिचोदितः; प्रतीतवेगः पवनात्मजः कपिः । प्रहर्षयंस्तां हरिवीर वाहिनीं; चकार रूपं महदात्मनस्तदा ।।
संस्तूयमानो हनुमान्व्यवर्धत महाबलः । समाविध्य च लाङ्गूलं हर्षाच्च बलमेयिवान् ।।
data.es: The monkeys praised the mighty Hanuman as he grew in size whirling his tail around joyfully.

data.v: तस्य संस्तूयमानस्य सर्वैर्वानरपुंगवैः । तेजसापूर्यमाणस्य रूपमासीदनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: As Hanuman was being praised by the monkey leaders, his body filled with lustre. It looked excellent.

data.v: यथा विजृम्भते सिंहो विवृद्धो गिरिगह्वरे । मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रस्तथा संप्रति जृम्भते ।।
data.es: Just as a lion grown in a mountain cave stretches its body, the Windgod's son stretched (his limbs) at that time.

data.v: अशोभत मुखं तस्य जृम्भमाणस्य धीमतः । अम्बरीषोपमं दीप्तं विधूम इव पावकः ।।
data.es: On expansion, wise Hanuman's face was bright, glowing like a burning oven and shining like smokeless fire.

data.v: हरीणामुत्थितो मध्यात्संप्रहृष्टतनूरुहः । अभिवाद्य हरीन्वृद्धान्हनुमानिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman risen from the midst of the monkeys with his hair bristling on the body (due to expansion of body), saluted reverentially to the elderly monkey Jambavan and said :

data.v: अरुजन्पर्वताग्राणि हुताशनसखोऽनिलः । बलवानप्रमेयश्च वायुराकाशगोचरः ।।
data.es: 'The Windgod is a friend of fire who is a powerful consumer of oblations. His strength is immeasurable. He wanders in the sky and shatters the mountain tops.

data.v: तस्याहं शीघ्रवेगस्य शीघ्रगस्य महात्मनः । मारुतस्यौरसः पुत्रः प्लवने नास्ति मे समः ।।
data.es: 'I am the lawfulson of the swiftmoving Windgod, Maruta, comparable to him in leaping.

data.v: उत्सहेयं हि विस्तीर्णमालिखन्तमिवाम्बरम् । मेरुं गिरिमसंगेन परिगन्तुं सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: 'I can with all enthusiasm go round the vast mount Meru a thousand times without resting on it which is as though scratching the sky.

data.v: बाहुवेगप्रणुन्नेन सागरेणाहमुत्सहे । समाप्लावयितुं लोकं सपर्वतनदीह्रदम् ।।
data.es: 'I can submerge this world including its mountains rivers and lakes. I can push back the sea waters quickly with my arms.

data.v: ममोरुजङ्घावेगेन भविष्यति समुत्थितः । संमूर्छितमहाग्राहः समुद्रो वरुणालयः ।।
data.es: 'Thrust by my thighs,the ocean will rise up, carrying with it the shanks and mighty crocodiles stunned by the force.

data.v: पन्नगाशनमाकाशे पतन्तं पक्षिसेवितम् । वैनतेयमहं शक्तः परिगन्तुं सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: 'I am capable of circumambulating a thousand times the great Garuda who consumes snakes and flies in the sky, the abode of birds.

data.v: उदयात्प्रस्थितं वापि ज्वलन्तं रश्मिमालिनम् । अनस्तमितमादित्यमभिगन्तुं समुत्सहे ।।
data.es: 'O bull among monkeys when the Sun rises from behind the eastern mountain it is possible for me to start with him and go to the western horizon and return before the blazing Sun with its beams of light sets. It is also possible for me to descend to the earth with the same speed and return to the Sun without touching the earth.

data.v: ततो भूमिमसंस्पृश्य पुनरागन्तुमुत्सहे । प्रवेगेनैव महता भीमेन प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: 'O bull among monkeys when the Sun rises from behind the eastern mountain it is possible for me to start with him and go to the western horizon and return before the blazing Sun with its beams of light sets. It is also possible for me to descend to the earth with the same speed and return to the Sun without touching the earth.

data.v: उत्सहेयमतिक्रान्तुं सर्वानाकाशगोचरान् । सागरं क्षोभयिष्यामि दारयिष्यामि मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: 'If I rise up, I can overtake all those creatures flying in the sky and from there I can stir up the ocean and tear up the earth easily.

data.v: पर्वतान्कम्पयिष्यामि प्लवमानः प्लवंगमाः । हरिष्ये चोरुवेगेन प्लवमानो महार्णवम् ।।
data.es: 'O monkeys when I leap, I can crush the mountains into powder and pull the vast ocean with me with the force of my thighs.

data.v: चामीकरमहानाभ देवगन्धर्वसेवित । हनूमांस्त्वयि विश्रान्तस्ततः शेषं गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "O goldenpeaked mountainyou are the refuge of the gods and gandharvas. Let him also rest on you for a while before he negotiates the remaining part of the journey.

data.v: काकुत्स्थस्यानृशंस्यं च मैथिल्याश्च विवासनम् । श्रमं च प्लवगेन्द्रस्य समीक्ष्योत्थातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "You ought to rise up if you consider the nobility of the scion of the Kakusthas, the deportation of Mythili, and the exertion put forth by Hanuman, the lord of monkeys".

data.v: हिरण्यनाभो मैनाको निशम्य लवणाम्भसः । उत्पपात जलात्तूर्णं महाद्रुमलतायुतः ।।
data.es: Hearing the command of the god of the ocean, mount Mainaka, rich in gold and covered with trees and creepers rose up at once from the water.

data.v: स सागरजलं भित्त्वा बभूवात्युत्थितस्तदा । यथा जलधरं भित्त्वा दीप्तरश्मिर्दिवाकरः ।।
data.es: Just as the rising Sun comes out with glowing rays tearing the veil of dark clouds, the mountain rose up from the water of the ocean.

data.v: शातकुम्भमयैः शृङ्गैः सकिंनरमहोरगैः । आदित्योदयसंकाशैरालिखद्भिरिवाम्बरम् ।।
तस्य जाम्बूनदैः शृङ्गैः पर्वतस्य समुत्थितैः । आकाशं शस्त्रसंकाशमभवत्काञ्चनप्रभम् ।।
data.es: The sky shone like barnished weapons smeared with the golden colour of the mountain peaks that rose up above the water.

data.v: जातरूपमयैः शृङ्गैर्भ्राजमानैः स्वयं प्रभैः । आदित्यशतसंकाशः सोऽभवद्गिरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: The noble mountain, Mainaka was glittering like a thousand Suns with selfeffulgent golden peaks shining.

data.v: तमुत्थितमसंगेन हनूमानग्रतः स्थितम् । मध्ये लवणतोयस्य विघ्नोऽयमिति निश्चितः ।।
data.es: Hanuman considered the mountain rising up in the midst of the ocean and standing in front an impediment.

data.v: स तमुच्छ्रितमत्यर्थं महावेगो महाकपिः । उरसा पातयामास जीमूतमिव मारुतः ।।
data.es: The great vanara,who was swift in action felled down the mountain that had risen high instantly with his chest just as the wind would strike a cloud.

data.v: स तदा पातितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः । बुद्ध्वा तस्य कपेर्वेगं जहर्ष च ननन्द च ।।
data.es: Felled by the vanara's speed, the tall mountain overwhelmed with joy roared in high pitch.

data.v: तमाकाशगतं वीरमाकाशे समवस्थितम् । प्रीतो हृष्टमना वाक्यमब्रवीत्पर्वतः कपिम् । मानुषं धरयन्रूपमात्मनः शिखरे स्थितः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमभत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यसरत], अज्ञातम् [१२: ररयज], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर]

data.es: Now the mountain assumed a human form and standing on its own summit, which stood very high, and glad at heart, addressed the heroic vanara gone to the aerial region.

data.v: दुष्करं कृतवान्कर्म त्वमिदं वानरोत्तम । निपत्य मम शृङ्गेषु विश्रमस्व यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: "O best of vanaras you have achieved a formidable deed. Alighting on my peak and comfortably resting awhile, you may resume your journey.

data.v: राघावस्य कुले जातैरुदधिः परिवर्धितः । स त्वां रामहिते युक्तं प्रत्यर्चयति सागरः ।।
data.es: "The son of Rama's family, Sagara, has extended the ocean in the past.It is most appropriate that he (the god of the sea) honours you in return as you have set out in the service of Rama.

data.v: कृते च प्रतिकर्तव्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः । सोऽयं तत्प्रतिकारार्थी त्वत्तः संमानमर्हति ।।
त्वन्निमित्तमनेनाहं बहुमानात्प्रचोदितः । योजनानां शतं चापि कपिरेष समाप्लुतः । तव सानुषु विश्रान्तः शेषं प्रक्रमतामिति ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: यमभभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: जततत], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसतय], अज्ञातम् [१२: ससजज]

data.es: "I was prompted by the ocean for your sake since he has great regard for you. O great monkey you may rest here for a while and continue your journey. The lord of the ocean feels that this tiger among monkeys can cover the distance of a hundred yojanas. He tells me, 'let him rest on your peak and then cover the rest of the distance'.

data.v: तिष्ठ त्वं हरिशार्दूल मयि विश्रम्य गम्यताम् । तदिदं गन्धवत्स्वादु कन्दमूलफलं बहु । तदास्वाद्य हरिश्रेष्ठ विश्रान्तोऽनुगमिष्यसि ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: रसनत], अज्ञातम् [१२: ययभभ], अज्ञातम् [१२: जभतत], अज्ञातम् [१२: मसभज]

data.es: "O foremost of the monkeys after eating plenty of sweet and tasty roots and fruits and resting a while you may go.

data.v: अस्माकमपि संबन्धः कपिमुख्यस्त्वयास्ति वै । प्रख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु महागुणपरिग्रहः ।।
data.es: "O chief of monkeys, indeed we too have a relationship with you based on merit which is wellknown to all the three worlds.

data.v: वेगवन्तः प्लवन्तो ये प्लवगा मारुतात्मज । तेषां मुख्यतमं मन्ये त्वामहं कपिकुञ्जर ।।
data.es: "O son of the Windgod you are an elephant among monkeys, the foremost among them who move at a high speed.

data.v: अतिथिः किल पूजार्हः प्राकृतोऽपि विजानता । धर्मं जिज्ञासमानेन किं पुनर्यादृशो भवान् ।।
data.es: "Even a newcomer, however ordinary, deserves worship by a wise man who wishes to educate himself in the path of righteousness. Needless to say that distinguished guest like you deserves all reverence.

data.v: त्वं हि देववरिष्ठस्य मारुतस्य महात्मनः । पुत्रस्तस्यैव वेगेन सदृशः कपिकुञ्जर ।।
data.es: "O foremost among the vanaras you are the son of the highsouled Windgod's, preeminent among the gods, you are also equal to him in speed.

data.v: पूजिते त्वयि धर्मज्ञ पूजां प्राप्नोति मारुतः । तस्मात्त्वं पूजनीयो मे शृणु चाप्यत्र कारणम् ।।
data.es: "O knower of righteousness to worship you is to honour the Windgod. Therefore you are worthy of worship for me. I will tell you the reason. Listen.

data.v: पूर्वं कृतयुगे तात पर्वताः पक्षिणोऽभवन् । तेऽपि जग्मुर्दिशः सर्वा गरुडानिलवेगिनः ।।
data.es: "Formerly in Kritayuga, O dear, mountains were endowed with wings. They used to move speedily in all directions like Garuda and the Windgod.

data.v: ततस्तेषु प्रयातेषु देवसंघाः सहर्षिभिः । भूतानि च भयं जग्मुस्तेषां पतनशङ्कया ।।
data.es: "When they moved about, even hosts of sages, gods and creatures panicked for fear of falling down (and destroying all worlds).

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धः सहस्राक्षः पर्वतानां शतक्रतुः । पक्षांश्चिच्छेद वज्रेण तत्र तत्र सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: "Provoked at this, the thousandeyed Indra who had performed a hundred sacrifices cut off the wings of mountains into a thousands pieces with his thunderbolt.

data.v: स मामुपगतः क्रुद्धो वज्रमुद्यम्य देवराट् । ततोऽहं सहसा क्षिप्तः श्वसनेन महात्मना ।।
अस्मिँल्लवणतोये च प्रक्षिप्तः प्लवगोत्तम । गुप्तपक्षः समग्रश्च तव पित्राभिरक्षितः ।।
data.es: "O distinguished vanara your father, the Windgod threw me down into this saltwater sea. Thus my wings were protected.

data.v: ततोऽहं मानयामि त्वां मान्यो हि मम मारुतः । त्वया मे ह्येष संबन्धः कपिमुख्य महागुणः ।।
data.es: "O esteemed vanara the Windgod is revered by me and so I honour you. O chief of monkeys, my bondage with you is therefore of high value to me, indeed.

data.v: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कार्ये सागरस्य ममैव च । प्रीतिं प्रीतमना कर्तुं त्वमर्हसि महाकपे ।।
data.es: "O great monkey when I hold you so high, you ought to oblige me and the (god of the) ocean wholeheartedly (and accept our hospitalty).

data.v: श्रमं मोक्षय पूजां च गृहाण कपिसत्तम । प्रीतिं च बहुमन्यस्व प्रीतोऽस्मि तव दर्शनात् ।।
data.es: "O noble monkey oblige us by accepting our offering given with love and be relieved of your fatigue. Your presence itself is welcome to me".

data.v: एवमुक्तः कपिश्रेष्ठस्तं नगोत्तममब्रवीत् । प्रीतोऽस्मि कृतमातिथ्यं मन्युरेषोऽपनीयताम् ।।
data.es: The great Hanuman, pleased with the words of Mainaka, said "I am pleased at your hospitality. Remove your unhappiness.

data.v: त्वरते कार्यकालो मे अहश्चाप्यतिवर्तते । प्रतिज्ञा च मया दत्ता न स्थातव्यमिहान्तरा ।।
data.es: "My commitment is hastening me. The day set (for the accomplishment of the task) is also drawing to a close. A vow is made and I will not halt in the middle of my work."

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा पाणिना शैलमालभ्य हरिपुंगवः । जगामाकाशमाविश्य वीर्यवान्प्रहसन्निव ।।
data.es: Having said this, the mighty monkey gently touched the mountain with his hands before ascending to the sky with a smile on his face.

data.v: स पर्वतसमुद्राभ्यां बहुमानादवेक्षितः । पूजितश्चोपपन्नाभिराशीर्भिरनिलात्मजः ।।
data.es: The mountain and the sea honoured and adored the son of the Windgod and gave him appropriate blessings.

data.v: अथोर्ध्वं दूरमुत्पत्य हित्वा शैलमहार्णवौ । पितुः पन्थानमास्थाय जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: And thereafter leaping a long distance into the clear sky, he (Hanuman) took the path of the Windgod, his father, leaving behind the mountain and the sea.

data.v: भूयश्चोर्ध्वगतिं प्राप्य गिरिं तमवलोकयन् । वायुसूनुर्निरालम्बे जगाम विमलेऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: Rising higher and further up and looking at the mountain (which was going down into the ocean), the son of the Windgod coursed through the cloudless sky unsupported.

data.v: तद्द्वितीयं हनुमतो दृष्ट्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । प्रशशंसुः सुराः सर्वे सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः ।।
data.es: Gods, siddhas as well as the great sages praised him for the second great achievment of Hanuman, which is impossible for others to accomplish.

data.v: देवताश्चाभवन्हृष्टास्तत्रस्थास्तस्य कर्मणा । काञ्चनस्य सुनाभस्य सहस्राक्षश्च वासवः ।।
data.es: The gods who happened to be present at that time (on the mountain) and the thousandeyed Indra were delighted by the gesture of golden Sunabha (Mainaka) mountain.

data.v: उवाच वचनं धीमान्परितोषात्सगद्गदम् । सुनाभं पर्वतश्रेष्ठं स्वयमेव शचीपतिः ।।
data.es: Indra, the lord of Sachi, was personally satisfied and spoke to Mainaka, the best of mountains, in faltering tone, his throat choked out of joy.

data.v: हिरण्यनाभशैलेन्द्रपरितुष्टोऽस्मि ते भृशम् । अभयं ते प्रयच्छामि तिष्ठ सौम्य यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: "O Hiranyanabha, the foremost among the mountains I am highly pleased with you. I give you security (free from fear of losing wings). O pious one you may stay on happily as you please.

data.v: साह्यं कृतं ते सुमहद्विक्रान्तस्य हनूमतः । क्रमतो योजनशतं निर्भयस्य भये सति ।।
data.es: "You have rendered very valuable help to Hanuman who was attempting to leap a distance of a hundred yojanas. He is fearless even when there is reason to fear (of falling down).

data.v: रामस्यैष हि दौत्येन याति दाशरथेर्हरिः । सत्क्रियां कुर्वता शक्या तोषितोऽस्मि दृढं त्वया ।।
data.es: "The vanara has gone on a mission to help the son of Dasaratha. I am highly pleased with the service rendered to him.

data.v: ततः प्रहर्षमलभद्विपुलं पर्वतोत्तमः । देवतानां पतिं दृष्ट्वा परितुष्टं शतक्रतुम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Mainaka, the great mountain was delighted to see Indra, lord of the gods, performer of a hundred yajnas satisfied.

data.v: स वै दत्तवरः शैलो बभूवावस्थितस्तदा । हनूमांश्च मुहूर्तेन व्यतिचक्राम सागरम् ।।
data.es: Then mount Mainaka, assured by Indra became secure. And Hanuman also crossed over the ocean in a short while.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । अब्रुवन्सूर्यसंकाशां सुरसां नागमातरम् ।।
data.es: Then the gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great sages approached Surasa, the mother of nagas, who was glowing like the Sungod and said:.

data.v: अयं वातात्मजः श्रीमान्प्लवते सागरोपरि । हनूमान्नाम तस्य त्वं मुहूर्तं विघ्नमाचर ।।
data.es: "The glorious son of the Windgod, called Hanuman, is crossing the ocean. Obstruct him for sometime by assuming the hideous form of a demon, gigantic as a mountain, fearful with yellowishbrown eyes, with big teeth and a wide mouth like the sky.

data.v: राक्षसं रूपमास्थाय सुघोरं पर्वतोपमम् । दंष्ट्राकरालं पिङ्गाक्षं वक्त्रं कृत्वा नभःस्पृशम् ।।
data.es: "The glorious son of the Windgod, called Hanuman, is crossing the ocean. Obstruct him for sometime by assuming the hideous form of a demon, gigantic as a mountain, fearful with yellowishbrown eyes, with big teeth and a wide mouth like the sky.

data.v: बलमिच्छामहे ज्ञातुं भूयश्चास्य पराक्रमम् । त्वां विजेष्यत्युपायेन विषदं वा गमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "We want to assess his strength, valour and intelligence once again. We wish to know whether he will win or give way to despondency".

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा देवी दैवतैरभिसत्कृता । समुद्रमध्ये सुरसा बिभ्रती राक्षसं वपुः ।।
data.es: Thus honoured by the gods, Surasa assumed a terrific ugly form frightening to all and stood in the midst of the ocean. Putting up a distorted appearance and encompassing Hanuman who was crossing the ocean, she spoke to him:

data.v: विकृतं च विरूपं च सर्वस्य च भयावहम् । प्लवमानं हनूमन्तमावृत्येदमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Thus honoured by the gods, Surasa assumed a terrific ugly form frightening to all and stood in the midst of the ocean. Putting up a distorted appearance and encompassing Hanuman who was crossing the ocean, she spoke to him:

data.v: मम भक्षः प्रदिष्टस्त्वमीश्वरैर्वानरर्षभ । अहं त्वां भक्षयिष्यामि प्रविशेदं ममाननम् ।।
data.es: "O bull among vanaras the lords of the universe have provided you as food for me. I will eat you. Enter my mouth".

data.v: एवमुक्तः सुरसया प्राञ्जलिर्वानरर्षभः । प्रहृष्टवदनः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Surasa, the glorious Hanuman said this with a blooming face and folded hands:

data.v: रामो दाशरथिर्नाम प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा वैदेह्या चापि भार्यया ।।
data.es: "Dasaratha's son called Rama accompanied by his brother Lakshmana and his wife Vaidehi entered Dandaka forest.

data.v: अस्य कार्यविषक्तस्य बद्धवैरस्य राक्षसैः । तस्य सीता हृता भार्या रावणेन यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: "While Rama was engaged otherwise, his glorious wife Sita was abducted by Ravana actuated by deeprooted enmity of demons with him.

data.v: तस्याः सकाशं दूतोऽहं गमिष्ये रामशासनात् । कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य साह्यं विषयवासिनि ।।
data.es: "I am going as Rama's emissary to search for his wife. It is proper for you to render help since you are a resident of his kingdom.

data.v: अथ वा मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा रामं चाक्लिष्टकारिणम् । आगमिष्यामि ते वक्त्रं सत्यं प्रतिशृणोमि ते ।।

data.v: पालितां राक्षसेन्द्रेण निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा । प्लवमानामिवाकाशे ददर्श हनुमान्पुरीम् ।।
data.es: The city of Lanka, ruled by the lord of demons and built by Visvakarma looked as if it was a city floating in the sky.

data.v: संपूर्णां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्नागैर्भोगवतीमिव । अचिन्त्यां सुकृतां स्पष्टां कुबेराध्युषितां पुरा ।।
दंष्ट्रिभिर्बहुभिः शूरैः शूलपट्टिशपाणिभिः । रक्षितां राक्षसैर्घोरैर्गुहामाशीविषैरपि ।।
वप्रप्राकारजघनां विपुलाम्बुनवाम्बराम् । शतघ्नीशूलकेशान्तामट्टालकवतंसकाम् ।।
data.es: Having reached the northern entrance of the city he started thinking that Visvakarma must have conceived Lanka as a lady with its ramparts as her hips and loins, moats filled with water as her robes, the spiked iron tridents as her locks of hair, and the tall towers as her her ear rings

data.v: द्वारमुत्तरमासाद्य चिन्तयामास वानरः । कैलासशिखरप्रख्यमालिखन्तमिवाम्बरम् । ध्रियमाणमिवाकाशमुच्छ्रितैर्भवनोत्तमैः ।।

ch.n: उपजाति जगती: अज्ञातम् [१२: जमनत], अज्ञातम् [१२: यजभर], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसजज], अज्ञातम् [१२: रसरय]

data.v: तस्याश्च महतीं गुप्तिं सागरं च निरीक्ष्य सः । रावणं च रिपुं घोरं चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
आगत्यापीह हरयो भविष्यन्ति निरर्थकाः । न हि युद्धेन वै लङ्का शक्या जेतुं सुरैरपि ।।
data.es: 'It is not possible for monkeys to come here and even if they do, it is no use. Lanka is invincible even to the gods in war.

data.v: इमां तु विषमां दुर्गां लङ्कां रावणपालिताम् । प्राप्यापि स महाबाहुः किं करिष्यति राघवः ।।
data.es: 'What will Rama the mighty armed hero do even after reaching this formidable city of Lanka ruled by Ravana?

data.v: अवकाशो न सान्त्वस्य राक्षसेष्वभिगम्यते । न दानस्य न भेदस्य नैव युद्धस्य दृश्यते ।।
data.es: 'There is no scope for reconciliation with the demons. It is not possible to win over them with gifts. They cannot be divided by dissension. There is no scope for war.

data.v: चतुर्णामेव हि गतिर्वानराणां महात्मनाम् । वालिपुत्रस्य नीलस्य मम राज्ञश्च धीमतः ।।
data.es: 'Only four great monkeys can have access to this place. They are Angada the son of Vali, Nila, Sugriva, the wise king of monkeys and myself.

data.v: यावज्जानामि वैदेहीं यदि जीवति वा न वा । तत्रैव चिन्तयिष्यामि दृष्ट्वा तां जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'Whether Janaka's daughter, Vaidehi is alive or not is not known. After seeing her I shall think over'.

data.v: ततः स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः । गिरिशृङ्गे स्थितस्तस्मिन्रामस्याभ्युदये रतः ।।
data.es: Standing on the mountain, the elephant among monkeys pondered for a while on the means of finding Sita, in which lay the welfare of Rama.

data.v: अनेन रूपेण मया न शक्या रक्षसां पुरी । प्रवेष्टुं राक्षसैर्गुप्ता क्रूरैर्बलसमन्वितैः ।।
data.es: 'I shall not be able in my present form to enter the city guarded by fierce and powerful demons.

data.v: उग्रौजसो महावीर्यो बलवन्तश्च राक्षसाः । वञ्चनीया मया सर्वे जानकीं परिमार्गिता ।।
लक्ष्यालक्ष्येण रूपेण रात्रौ लङ्का पुरी मया । प्रवेष्टुं प्राप्तकालं मे कृत्यं साधयितुं महत् ।।
data.es: 'To accomplish this great task I will have to assume an inconspicious form and enter the city of Lanka in the night as that is the appropriate time.

data.v: तां पुरीं तादृशीं दृष्ट्वा दुराधर्षां सुरासुरैः । हनूमांश्चिन्तयामास विनिःश्वस्य मुहुर्मुहुः ।।
data.es: 'Looking at the city, unassailable even to gods and demons, Hanuman sighed again and again thinking:

data.v: केनोपायेन पश्येयं मैथिलीं जनकात्मजाम् । अदृष्टो राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना ।।
data.es: 'By what means can I find Mythili, daughter of Janaka, without being noticed by the evilminded Ravana, the lord of demons?

data.v: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं रामस्य विदितात्मनः । एकामेकश्च पश्येयं रहिते जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: 'How can the purpose of Rama, a noble soul be not spoilt? I may have a private audience with the daughter of Janaka.

data.v: भूताश्चार्थो विपद्यन्ते देशकालविरोधिताः । विक्लवं दूतमासाद्य तमः सूर्योदये यथा ।।
data.es: 'Just as darkness disappears at Sunrise, wellplanned strategies also fail at the hands of a thoughtless messenger when they are set in opposition to proper time and place.

data.v: अर्थानर्थान्तरे बुद्धिर्निश्चितापि न शोभते । घातयन्ति हि कार्याणि दूताः पण्डितमानिनः ।।
data.es: 'Even though messengers are not intelligent, they think themselves clever and capable. They act foolishly, swerve from proper course of action and fail in their effort.

data.v: न विनश्येत्कथं कार्यं वैक्लव्यं न कथं भवेत् । लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य कथं नु न वृथा भवेत् ।।
data.es: 'How should the task be performed? How to avoid impetuousness? How can my purpose of crossing the ocean be not wasted?

data.v: मयि दृष्टे तु रक्षोभी रामस्य विदितात्मनः । भवेद्व्यर्थमिदं कार्यं रावणानर्थमिच्छतः ।।
data.es: 'If I am seen by the demons, the plan of Rama, possessor of selfknowledge, to kill Ravana, will be wasted.

data.v: न हि शक्यं क्वचित्स्थातुमविज्ञातेन राक्षसैः । अपि राक्षसरूपेण किमुतान्येन केनचित् ।।
data.es: 'It is difficult to stay with the demon anywhere here even in the disguise of a demon without being identified. It will not be possible to remain unidentified even by assuming any other form.

data.v: वायुरप्यत्र नाज्ञातश्चरेदिति मतिर्मम । न ह्यस्त्यविदितं किंचिद्राक्षसानां बलीयसाम् ।।
data.es: 'I think even the wind who has no form cannot move here without being detected. Nothing escapes the notice of powerful demons. There is nothing unknown to them.
